Coal in itself is not easy to get. Your best bet is in the Nether, where you can find tons of dense coal deposits. These drop nominal amounts of coal.
Once you get the furnace, you can easily process overworld coal ore as well.

Charcoal is the main fuel source for the Stone and Refractory eras. The best way to get it is burning Log Piles in Pile Burning. This produces insane
amounts of charcoal, along with flakes and ash.

Now this is probably the most essential resource here.
Diamond is required for the Smeltery, which is your ticket to finally getting a good source of iron and an inbuilt alloy smelter.
So now, how do you get diamond?

The Aurorian has Astral Sorcery structures which may contain diamonds.
Blacksmiths may also have diamonds.
Diamonds can also be obtained by painfully ore-processing them.. the choice is yours.
Refractory machinery is the LAST tier of pyrotech. The first machine to make is the Bloomery, which is how you get your first metals.
You will need a myriad of smelted things from the Pit Kiln, but, i suggest you stock up on these three resources first.

As you might have read before, a Drying rack is quintessential to getting further in Pyrotech. It can process up to 4 items at a time, and requires some 
specific plants.

Cuisine is a useful food mod that helps nullify hunger early on. Its foods depend on your knowledge of the mod, and how much you cook food in the mod
too! Read the food questline for mroe info.

This is your first means of crafting. You will need to keep a few things in mind.

First of all, this block requires you to right-click it with a Hammer to work.
Second, this block has durability. You can see it in WAILA.
Finally, this block has a few storage slots for tools underneath the main crafting area.

Ash is acquired from pit kilns, failed byproducts, pile burning, etc. as a byproduct.
On its own, it is not very useful. But it is an essential component for Refractory Clay. which is a big part of this era.

Nether Quartz is acquired in low amounts in the overworld in form of ore, which only gives 1-2 quartz each.

The real source is in the Nether, where, like redstone, it forms massive deposits dropping dense quartz and quartz.
Quartz is required for many things in Cuisine and Roots and it is worth getting.

This is the bare minimum for a smeltery (Not including base bricks)
Good luck!

Flint Tools, which are the next step in tools.. of course they are.

They have around 130~ durability more than crude tools, so its a worthwhile investment.
The Flint and Tinder is a primitive variant of the Flint and Steel. It has 8 durability and must be held with RMB to use.

This world isn't that hostile. Trees, Oxygen.. you're way better off than a lot of people in other survival situations..
Anyway, now, it is time to acquire your first "Machine". This is the Chopping Block.

The chopping block is used mainly to cut down planks into slabs. It can also be used to convert logs into planks, which is a deprecated recipe by the 
courtesy of Greg.

Coke (No, not the coal tar drink) is acquired from various sources.
First, we have the GT Coke Oven. This is quite hard to get in this pack, so expect it to take a while. Though you can upgrade this to an IE coke oven later.

Secondly, refractory burning (when you make an indoor method for Pile burning, using refractory bricks/igniters/glass/collectors etc.) can yield
coke as well.

Coke is used for Steel and is a great fuel source.

Plus, you can easily infinitely dupe it using Thaumcraft....

Masonry Brick! It comes in 2 main forms.
First, we have our Pyrotech ones. These will be required to create many different machines.
Next, we have our GregTech ones. These are gonna be your first GT Tools.

After you acquire your first few tools and resources, the time begins to start making Dried Fibers.
They are required for Twine, Straw, etc. which are how you smelt your resources in the beginning as well as the way to get beds, bows, tools, etc.

Also, you can gather Flint Shards from mining gravel with a Shovel- a crude one specifically. Gather as many as you can.

This is your first method of smelting. To use, place it down in the ground, then, add your desired item to it. Up to 8 of these can be smelted at once.
Next, add a block of Straw. Straw can be made by drying wheat or with dried fiber and twine/string.

Next, add 3 logs to your kiln and light with a Flint and Tinder.

Amethyst is required for many Roots recipes.. it is found mostly in loot chests but can be refined later on. It ALSO makes some pretty OP tools which
are worth checking out.

If you somehow cannot manage to find a bed, i suggest you make a Straw Bed. these are incredibly cheap costing about 9 dried fiber in total and come
with only one use!

This is an important place to mention that the day/night cycle has been changed. Day now lasts MUCH longer (Think around 30 minutes!) while night
is around 15 minutes.

In early game, redstone cannot be easily refined from ore.
You could find redstone ore, process it with a hammer/granite anvil, soak it, and finally smash it back into dust, but this is highly inefficient.
There are redstone deposits deep in the world, with redstone crystals and ore. They should contain all the redstone you need for early game.
First steps toward the Smeltery!

Any items with [Coal Dust] in the desc. are TOXIC and can cause mesothelioma (lung cancer) which can kill you. Mining ores like Lignite or Coal Blocks
causes it too- wear masks like this to avoid getting lung cancer.

Where are you? Who are you? 

Welcome to this pack. I am going to be guiding you throughout the progression.

First, we all start somewhere- which, in your case, is wood.
Chop down a tree with your hands to get wood.

Crude Tools! Not very pretty or durable, but it'll get the job done.

First agenda is to mine as much logs as possible and make a Chopping Block. Explained more later.
Next, mine as much Gravel as you can, mentioned later too.
Finally, the Hammer, which is good to make right now, as it will be required for 3x3 crafting later.

Some basic resources you will need to get are Fiber, Stone (Or any type of) rocks, and Sticks.
These are used for various purposes throughout the early game, but for now, they're the main way to make Tools.
First, punch grass/tall grass for Fiber. This process has a small chance to drop Dried fiber, which is important for later on, so remember to hoard as much of it
as you can.

Next, rocks can be found in the ground or be mined via gravel. Finally, sticks are acquired from leaves.

Iron! With this we can almost end the Stone Age.
But first, we shall need 2 basic machines; the Crafting Table and Furnace.

Note: TiCon Smeltery may replace the Furnace for steam age, so the acquisition of the furnace/crafting table is not documented.

Congrats! If you complete this quest you're well on your way to the smeltery, and getting actual useful ore processing setup.
Now, i suggest you start magic and head to the Aurorian to find some diamonds in the structures, or loot blacksmiths, or whatevers- diamonds are your
next most important project. You need them to unlock the smeltery, after all!

Pile Burning is an interesting part of Pyrotech. It is mainly where you get your Charcoal from. To start it, make some Log Piles and put them 
underground (make sure it is all covered) and light the one exposed log on fire (with your flint and tinder) make sure to cover it. Wait a bit,
and eventually you will get Ash, with varying degrees of charcoal in them.

You can put Collectors made from Masonry/Refractory bricks on the bottom to collect the liquid byproduct for use. Drains allow you
to route the fluids easily.

Now, this is more leaning into magic, and is not.. strictly required.
Though, if you want to head into the Nether anytime soon, Runic Dust and Runestone is a MUST.
First, this is used for quite a lot of magic items, as you can imagine. Secondly, it is required to start Thaumcraft (Along with some other refined dusts)
Stone Machines. Fuel is to be placed in lower slot and to be ignited.
A small tip with boilers, solid ones in particular; If you have a bonsai pot, you can place one ontop of the boiler, for free energy!
Solars! Yeah, they exist, and we love em. If you have silver, from Galena veins, then sure! go for it.
Red Alloy and Invar are some important alloys to make. Invar will be used for the steam multiblocks, and Red Alloy is an essential component of LV Circuits.
Sheets are gonna be used to coat wires manually.

BEST Storage method, similar to AE2, and modular! Stack it ontop of each other for more space.

Chest is like a.. well, chest, and Crate is similar to Storage Drawers.
Rubber is an important material for LV. It's mainly used for making sheets to coat wires.
Wirecutters are gonna be used a decent amount in Pre-LV, so get them.

The Primitive Blast Furnace is a multiblock that makes Steel. Steel is required a LOT in LV, and in small amounts in Steam as well.
Steel is Iron and Coke, or Charcoal. Pit Burning/Refractory Burning allows you to mass produce this.

The real issue is getting the PBF Itself. Get a LOT of clay, bricks, and more clay.
The Steam Grinder is a multiblock that is a Steam Macerator, and processes 8 recipes in parallel. It's a bit slower but the parallels are worth it.

Steam Machines! They are wonderful but they have a few drawbacks. They can only run recipes up to 32 EU/t, and are twice as slow.
You need to wrench a free side to allow them to vent the used steam, or they will stop working.
HP Boilers and machines are useful and are recommended to meet the production needs of LV.
This took 23h for me to get.. try to beat my time!!!!!!!
Alloys materials w/o need for dust/melting.
You can get Sulfur from a number of miscallenous sources, but by far the best one is the Nether, in the form of Sulfur Ore.
Allows you to get Rubber Pulp from Sticky Resin!
Pipes are used to connect stuff, and this pack has Curvy Pipes! Which allows you to make.. Curvy pipes! Yeah!!!
To progress in LV, you need atleast 6 LV Motors to make the basic stuff. (i.e your first machine, so and so)
To begin making the Good Stuff, you need some basic tools.

Now that you have your basic GT Tools, it's time to get started with GT, finally!
First of all, i expect you've got the Coke Oven already. Use the Creosote to make some Treated Wood, and use the Iron to finally make yourself a Pump.
Infinite Water. What'd you expect?

Look how far you've come! from waiting 8 minutes for smelting stone, to doing 8 recipes in parallel!

Anyway, the Steam Oven is an incredibly useful multiblock that can parallel 8 furnace recipes at once! How cool is that?
Turns Ingots into Plates, 3:2 ratio!
Circuits! Get atleast 2 of them, or more, to get started in LV.

this machine is very cheap, so it is worth making it. it simply makes rods into polarized versions without using redstone.


(redstone is magnetic? makes sense..)

This is basically a Robot Arm but for fluids. 

Supply Exact will simply transfer only a specified amount per tick and will limit it from going any higher or lower.

Keep Exact will keep the amount of fluid in a machine stocked.

Oxygen Gas can be acquired in many Electrolysis recipes.

There are 2 main ways i say you could get it:

Electrolysing Water for Oxygen and Hydrogen, but this produces more Oxygen than Hydrogen. This still can be used to automate easily
as Water is basically infinite.

You can also get oxygen as a byproduct from processing ores, so i recommend not voiding any oxygen after ore processing.

the Arc Furnace is used for a lot of convenient recipes like Sand -> Glass, and it can easily make Wrought Iron as well.

It also unlocks Annealed Copper which can be used for making the Temperature Maintainer which means you don't have to worry about
temperature anymore.

The Basic Extractor is an upgraded version of the regular extractor but with fluid capabilities. it can convert items into fluids-
useful for Liquid Glass for the Diodes.
Aluminium is the main component for MV, for HBM, and for a bit of Advanced Rocketry as well.
Works like a conveyor module and can pull and push fluids.
Separates some ores into other ores.. really not that used.
Essential for Battery Production.

The Sifter is a machine that is very important for producing Flawless versions of certain gems like Emerald.

It inputs Purified Ore variants of gems to have a chance of finding Exquisite and Flawless gems.

This is good for getting higher yield for your gems.

Flawless Emerald is required for MV, so might as well get the infrastructure for it now..
The only way to get Aluminium in LV is to process Sapphire for a chance of getting Aluminium Dust.

Some molds can save on a lot of hassle. Especially this one, since you won't need to hand-craft rotors for turbines anymore.

There are also gear and small gear molds which make it much easier to make Forestry machines later on.

Your first proper multiblock machine! The EBF is a multiblock machine required to make Aluminium and to progress to MV.

This questline will teach you all about how to manage multiblocks and how to use the EBF.

The amount of casings in JEI is not necessary. You can configure the multiblock with any specific amount of hatches and buses
and the amount of casings will change.
No Description

LV Has now been conquered! MV gives you access to a lot of new stuff, like Galacticraft, Petrochem, more centrifuging recipes, and a better
EBF as well as new multiblocks. 

Now that you have the Circuit Assembler, it is a good idea to make some circuits.

You can use either use soldering alloy which is more resource-efficient or tin which isn't as resource efficient but is cheaper.

Batteries are items that are used for storing energy and creating hardware.

Batteries can be put into Battery buffers to add to their energy storage; Batteries can also be used to charge EU-using items in your
inventory.

There are 3 different types of batteries to choose from (limited to LV, MV, and HV)
You can create any type based on the resources you have.

Lithium has the most capacity, then Cadmium, then Sodium.

Check JEI for the recipes, but i suggest just electrolyzing salt for Sodium and if you want you can process Lepidolite in the Ore Washer for
lithium.

All of the coils cost 128 cupronickel, 32 bronze, and 16 tin alloy in total.

Use the alloy smelter for the alloys.

Now that you have MV circuits, it is time to make a Circuit Assembler so you can make recipes for cheap.

If you have aluminium and the circuits you have access to MV machinery.

The fluid solidifier is a machine that converts fluids into items when provided with a mold.

For now you can use this in conjunction with the Chemical Reactor to make Rubber sheets more efficiently.
The Macerator in LV works the same as the steam one; only in HV will the Macerator recieve additional output slots.

Covers are sort of like attachable upgrades that can be put on a face of a machine to do various functions.

They can be removed using a crowbar.
Electrolysing air is also a good way to get Oxygen as well as Nitrogen.

The LBB is a decent method of upgrading your steam power. You may be able to power this with charcoal from Bonsais, providing an efficient way to
produce Steam.

Drills are basically convenient pickaxes. you can use these for mining.. obviously.

A diamond drill tip is recommended.
Welcome to LV! The goal of this voltage tier is to unlock the EBF and acquire Aluminium.

The mixer is a pretty important machine in later tiers as it is used for a lot of recipes involving chemicals and fluids, but it is not 
needed much in LV other than for Gallium Arsenide.

I recommend you hold this off till you are ready to focus on the MV Circuits.

The autoclave is a machine used for converting some specific types of dusts back into their original form.

Be advised though, it is very slow so ore processing of this level (especially for gems) is not recommended at this tier.

EU is the main energy unit of GT. 

In LV the only practical way to generate energy is the Steam Turbine. It converts 2L Steam -> 1 EU.

There are 2 ways to transport power- Wires and Cables. Wires are uninsulated and will lose more energy compared to the insulated Cables.
Wires and Cables need to be connected to machines with Wire Cutters.

How energy loss works is that the farther apart your machines are the more energy is lost- that's why keeping your machines close together
in one room is a must. You can also use Superconductors farther on which have no energy loss.

If you are using cables to transport energy, you will have to keep in mind the Amperage mechanic;

That is that one machine = one amp, and the more machines you have the more amps you will need to sufficiently power them all.

if you have more than one steam turbine it is recommended to make 2x or 4x cables so that your cables do not burn from excessive amperage.
Congrats! you just completed your first bit of chemistry. Time to use this dust to make some diodes.

The recipe for this may be expensive, but don't worry. Once you get PE it will become much cheaper.

Annealed Copper is also recommended but not required; you will get it through the Arc Furnace.

Maintanence means you just have to have a set of tools in your inventory and click the gray button in the centre.

Later on you can craft Tape which avoids this.


The muffler hatch is a waste output block. It needs to be unobstructed otherwise the smoke will not be able to come out and the machine
won't work.

Input/Output hatches and buses are required. Hatches are for fluids and Buses are for items. It is recommended you have one of each,
but it is not necessary.

Energy hatches allow you to input energy into the machine.

Overclocking mechanic was mentioned before.

Electric machines have a feature known as overclocking: This is applied to multiblocks as well. basically if you have 2 energy hatches
of the same voltage on a multiblock machine, the machine will be able to do the next voltage tier of recipes to the energy hatches.

e.g 2 lv energy inputs -> mv power

Some recipes require Programmed Circuits: These cost precious LV circuits. So, to avoid making these, there is a "Ghost Programmed Circuit"
button inside of all Electric machines and input hatches/buses.

The assembly machine is one of the most important machines in gregtech;

it works like a crafting table in the form of a machine, and it is REQUIRED for many components of the MV circuit!

If you want to escape to space and avoid those parasites, you're really, *really* going to need this.

This can also unlock a few special recipes for some.. "tools" to help you destroy the zombies.
Batteries are very useful for storing energy and for certain gadgets that can improve your GT experience by a lot.

This machine takes Crushed Ore or Purified versions of ore to give a different byproduct from the Ore Washer, but at the same rate.

This machine also takes the most energy out of all the other LV ore processing machines, so i recommend you don't use this too much.

( Yes, i know the first line is copied from GCP, but hey, i don't understand shi about ore processing either)
the Ore prospector can be used to find ore veins easier. Along with VisualOres where you can map out your prospected ores.
The conveyor module can accept item filters and it will also transfer items similar to how the electric pump works.

This is your first introduction to some *real* chemistry. in this questline we will be making Diodes for MV circuits.

Diodes are also used in making some very useful items like the Building Wands.

The centrifuge is one of, if not the most important machines to be used in Ore Processing and GT in general.

This machine takes Impure dust (made in macerator or forge hammer) and turns it into clean dust with a byproduct in the form of Tiny dusts.
This is the cheapest way to get ore processing in LV.


Outside of ore processing it has many uses like separating dusts, separating air to form different gases, etc.

It should be made as SOON as possible after you get started with Ore Processing.

This is the first or second machine i reckon you should make. It reduces the cost of making wires heavily, and reduces the microcrafting
issues as well. Can also make other types of wire.

It becomes one ingot -> one wire, WHICH IS THREE TIMES more efficient and doesn't cost you precious durability.
The second machine you should make; it increases plate production to a 1:1 ratio, which is better than the forge hammer at least.

This is basically a more expensive but more useful and advanced Conveyor Module. it can transfer items in certain amounts/rates and
can also keep items stocked like an ME interface.

As you may notice, Gallium and Arsenic cannot be smelted directly from the ore- They have to be obtained from processing ores and they
are obtained as Byproducts. this will be much more common as you progress. 

For Gallium, your best bet is to obtain it as a byproduct from centrifuging Sphlarite in the Thermal Centrifuge/Centrifuge.

For Arsenic, your best bet is to just get some Realgar and turn it into Dust and then centrifuge it.

Every generator in LV (single-block ones specifically) produces 1 amp of its voltage tier.

like one amp in LV is 32 EU/t.

If a machine requests 24 EU/t, let's say, one 'packet' of EU is sent to the machine, which in LV results in 32 EU/t being sent to the machine.

Some machines require more than one amp, like the Electric Blast Furnace. Batteries come into play here; a battery buffer with 4 batteries can
output 4 amps or 128 EU/t in terms of LV.

Cables have limits on how many amps they can carry, e.g a 1x tin cable can only carry 1 amp. That is why there are 2x and 4x cables to 
transmit more than 1 amp at a time. 

Trying to carry more than one amp at a time will result in the cable burning.

Battery buffers work as a way to store energy and also a way to distribute more amps.

Having a 4x Battery Buffer means you have 4 amps available to you. This is especially useful for the EBF.

As the tooltip suggests, this machine can be used to make Rods more efficiently; by turning one ingot into two rods.

It can also turn one bolt into one screw instead of two bolts for one screw.

Glue is an incredibly convenient crafting fluid that is used to make cheaper recipes for a LOT of things.
Glue is also required to make the Phenolic Circuit Board, which is a component of the MV circuit.

It is made from centrifuging Sticky Resin. If you don't have a few rubber trees and lumberjacks to automate it, i recommend you do as soon
as you can.

The Chemical reactor is a machine that is very, *very* important for a lot of GregTech's recipes. it also is important for a bunch of 
chemlines later in this pack, but nothing to worry about now.

for now let's use it to make rubber more efficiently; use the usual rubber recipe (pulp and sulfur) and look at the result after.

rubber as a fluid is not usable outside of the assembling machine, so let us learn how to solidify it.

The Electrolyser is a machine that can be used for many different chemical processes.. Like the production of Oxygen and Hydrogen from 
water. 

This is also used in Ore Processing, and in order to get Sodium batteries you need to electrolyse Salt.

ME drives are basically drive storages for your ME cells. If you add an ME cell in this while it is connected to your network, you will
be able to use that cell for storage. Neat innit?
These Proccessors are the base of just about anything Ae2 related stock up!!
Fairly simple to get. You need some chemicals from this tier, as well as PE to make the board itself.

Oil is an essential component for Polyethylene and can also be used for a wide array of things like energy, flight, etc.

This can find fluid veins underground which cannot be seen regularly. There is a fluid prospector in HV though, so while you are here
your only option is to randomly place it till you find a fluid vein.

Oil: The most used variant, has more Light Fuel.

Heavy Oil: Richer in Heavy Fuel, which does not have many common uses.

Raw Oil: Best for making products as it is rich in Naphtha.

Natural Gas: Gives you Refinery Gas.

Salt Water: Provides chlorine and sodium which are useful in higher tiers.

The nether has Refinery gas but it is more rich in it than overworld veins.

Lava can also be obtained.
Oilsands ore can be centrifuged for Heavy Oil, so it is worth mining a bunch of it.

Refinery Gas / LPG / Methane are all hydrocarbon-based Gases. You can get LPG and Methane from the Centrifuge, but you need to process Natural Gas
or Light Oil to get Refinery Gas.

They are used in the Gas Turbine.

The components are basically the same, except there is a new one; the MV Emitter. It required for the Laser Engraver which is 
incredibly important later on.
Transistors! Like diodes, but MV... ok dont get mad at me electrical engineers...

Does He Know?

Stainless Steel is an important new metal for the HV tier; though you will need both PE and Circuits alongside this to complete the tier!
Many fluids in this tier are Acidic, and thus cannot be carried by regular pipes. Chrome, Vanadiumsteel, and Gold pipes are the best options.
The next tier of energy hatches! It is suggested to get 2 of these for HV recipes.

Aluminium is the core component of the MV machines. If you have aluminium, you are able to make the machine hulls.. But the circuits are still
required for the actual machinery.

MV is also the age where a lot of different mods and mechanics are unlocked, Including HBM's Nuclear Tech-E, Ender IO, etc.

The LV extruder is so useless it's pretty much a meme in the GT community at this point.

But the MV extruder is so much more; it can do a number of useful recipes that reduce your need to microcraft things and makes making
pipes and rotors and the like much easier.

To get the next tier of energy hatches,  you'll need an ULPIC (POWER INTEGRATED CHIP)

These need an Aqua Crystal/Blue/Sapphire lens.
These are required for the next tier of Circuits, and they take a Red/Ruby lens.

Diesel (or "Fuel") is a very good fuel source for MV.

It requires both light fuel and heavy fuel.

NOTE: It can also be used as fuel for Galacticraft Rockets!
Steam-cracking is just infusing your product with steam; For ethylene, you will need to process Steam-Cracked Naphtha.

This questline is for Ethylene; If you are using Oil and the Fluid Rig an LV Distillery is enough.

If you are going with Biomass an MV distillery is required.

How distillation in earlier tiers works is that the Distillery will make only one type of oil product and void the rest. This sounds wasteful
but with the amount of oil you'll be getting later on it's not going to effect you too much.

Later on you can unlock the Distillation Tower which saves all of the byproducts.

When you distill your regular oil, you might notice that the product has "Sulfuric" before its name. This is not a typo, you will have to
remove the sulfur before you can use the products. 

You will have to combine these products with Hydrogen in order to get Hydrogen Sulfide which can be used later for Hydrochloric Acid. This also
gives the product in its purified form.

After you get the purified version you can use it.

The MV electrolyser allows you to do more recipes by decomposition, so ore processing just got a whole lot easier.
In MV, many new metals can be decomposed, and also Clay can be decomposed for free Aluminium.

Another thing to note is Chrome- which can be reliably acquired from Ruby.

You'll want to upgrade to the next coil tier as soon as possible.

For Kanthal, you'll need both an MV Mixer and 2 MV energy hatches on your EBF.
Even more circuits for more gaming. These get even cheaper as you go on!
HV Circuits! You'll want to look at PE or Stainless Steel before anything, though.
Some lenses you'll need.

The pyrolyse oven is an electric version of the Coke Oven. It can convert wood into charcoal and creosote, but it can also make very important
byproducts.

If you don't want to find fluid veins, this is for you.

Some important byproducts you can get are Wood Tar and Biomass.

Read the distillation questline for further information.

Vanadiumsteel is one of the many required alloys in MV. It's also a good tool material.
You might have found some Vanadium from Vanadium Magnetite, and you use it here.

Is your rig too far from your base? Pipes too expensive? The solution: Long-Distance Fluid Pipes.
They are connected via 2 endpoints and MUST be atleast 50 blocks long.

MV machines like the Distillery are especially power hungry, so LV steam turbines just won't do.

For this we have the Advanced generators; for these we have a number of different fuel options. 

Petrochem is incredibly useful for fuels, and distilled fuels like Diesel are incredibly useful for energy.

While you get to petrochem, you will probably have to stick to steam. In that case you should upgrade your boiler and your steam engine.

Sulfuric acid is necessary for making Ethylene if you have decided to use Biomass.

First step of making Sulfuric Acid is to get Hydrogen Sulfide; if you had done the Oil path it would be plentiful as it comes from desulfurizing
oil products. Next you have to combine the Hydrogen Sulfide with some Oxygen (gas collector + centrifuge) you will get Sulfur Dioxide.

You can also use Sulfur Dust and Oxygen for the same effect.

Next you just have to combine it with Oxygen again for Sulfur Trioxide, then just one last time with Water and boom, you have your
sulfuric acid.
New and improved circuits. Much cheaper but need more infrastructure.
Reacting your Ethylene with Oxygen or Air will give you PE!
RAM is required for HV Circuits and many other things! It is made using a Green/Emerald lens.

The MV Mixer is the gate for a lot of mods; Ender IO, Forestry, and Modular Routers.

Modular Routers is especially OP as it can do item and fluid logistics very easily which eliminates the need for pipes in most cases.

It makes 2 important things in this tier; Kanthal and Vanadiumsteel.

The Cutting Machine and Engraving Machine are both required to get cut wafers and chips.

First, a silicon boule is acquired from the EBF. Then, the boule is cut in the Cutting Machine.

Then, to turn them into usable wafers, a Lens of your preferred choice must be used. This will make an Engraved wafer. To finally use this, cut it again
in a Cutting Machine.

Light Fuel is a good energy option.
Also please put some fluid in buckets or the quest won't register...
Although it *does* say MV in the recipe, it still needs a Cleanroom. More of which you will learn in HV!
This may sound stupid but remember NOT to supply your LV machines with MV power...
Biomass is another way to get Ethylene for PE. it is renewable but it is more time-consuming.
The MV assembler is required for the next few circuit components.

Congrats! you have acquired Ethylene! 

Though the processing is not over yet. You need to combine Ethylene with Air from a gas collector in order to get Polyethylene.
the Miner is basically a quarry and it can clear out ore veins easily.
To Enter HV, You'll need these two things. So, that is why i have added these two in one Quest!
Though the quest says "Optional", sadly, these are very much NOT optional.

Ahh.. wait, POLYETHYLENE??!

Yes, Polyethylene. If you haven't somehow done it already go do it!

Anyway, HV machines take almost 4x the power of MV machines, so upgrading your power grid is ESSENTIAL!

The Macerator is pretty good in early game, but the HV macerator unlocks many new outputs! it has Â§34Â§f outputs in total,
which allow you to get many new byproducts!

Liquid air for better renewable oxygen and nitrogen.

Also provides you with Helium and Argon.
Again more efficient rubber, but it eats up chlorine.. wait till you can reliably get chlorine till you begin mass producing it.
this does the cracking recipes from the chemical reactor for a 1:1 ratio instead of wasting a portion of the product.

Steam-Cracked fuels can be distilled for certain chemicals (hydrocarbons) that are of utility in processing lines as well as in IV age.

These include Benzene, Methane, Ethylene (biggie) and Butadiene.
Welcome to the HV Extras chapter. this contains some extra recipes related to EV that are too hard to format into HV questline.
This is required for IV circuitry.
Better type of rubber, and is more efficient in crafting recipes (insulation of cables) it's going to be needed in IV and LuV, so grab some.

The Distillation tower is a multiblock that is very useful for petroleum production. It can make different distillery products all at once instead
of voiding the other products. this reduces waste and also unlocks some more recipes related to distillation.

Wood vinegar is a good way to get acetone early on, but the yield is low compared to the Acetic Acid recipe.

Acetic Acid is acquired in the chemical reactor, it can be made with Ethylene and Oxygen.

Methanol and Carbon Monoxide is worth it too.
Epoxy Resin is used to make circuit boards from now on.

Wood Tar can make Phenol, Benzene, Tolulene and Dimethylbenzene.

Wood Vinegar can make Acetic Acid for Acetone, Methanol, and Acetone.

This is probably your first powered armorset, other than the modular powersuits one. The helmet provides night vision and the boots provide step assist; you can upgrade
the chestplate with a jetpack in HV-EV.
High Octane Diesel is one of the most efficient fuels to use, it's viable for EV and HV as well.

Uranium is a radioactive material (not here though) and this quests tells you on how to process it. this is required for Radon.

Uranium Hexafluoride is made from Uraninite. 

After this you need to separate Uranium's two isotopes; U-238 and U-235.
Another machine required for machine things.

Welcome to EV. the main metal of this tier is Titanium, so you should automate it.

EV Machines require a lot of power so i'd recommend using a Large Turbine or something like that later on.

EV is also home to the infamous Platline, but it's not as complicated as it might seem.

Also, Titanium unlocks Machine Chassis from EnderIO.
Nano CPUs are required for Nano circuits. They require carbon fibers. I highly recommend setting up Epoxy to make carbon fibers more efficient to make.
Just another multiblock energy input.

RTM stands for Ruthenium, Tantalum, Molybdendum.

Yummy, if i do say so myself.
The advantage of getting higher tier coils is that you can get more and more coil bonuses which means more MONEY
EV Mixers are required for RTM Alloy and also for Tungstensteel.
Molybdenum is acquired through Molybdenum Ore, Wulfrenite, and Powellite.
This is the purified version of the Raw PGM Salt version of the respective metals.
Rhodium is for the LuV age and the IV age. RTM Alloy is required for new coils.

Radon is a radioactive gas required for Quantum Eyes. Radon can be made in IV by distilling Ender Air, but for now this is the only way.

Uranium-238 dust with Plutonium-239 Ingots will make a decent amount of Radon.
This is used for Osmium, which unlocks Mekanism, and a bunch of other utilities

The Large Gas Turbine is a scalable and efficient powergen that comes at the cost of complexity.

- Inertia means it has to be running for a while to reach full power
- The rotors have durability and have to be replaced every so often
- It also voids unconsumed energy!

Pretty decent but also pretty undecent.

The EV macerator has a higher chance of producing byproducts compared to lower tier macerators; the chance for byproducts increases
per tier.
To make this you have to invest into a Mainframe which is an IV circuit.
The Advanced Assembler unlocks some utility recipes as usual and also unlocks ME buses and hatches.
Tungstensteel is an essential alloy for IV. it also is used in DeepMobEvolution.

The LCE runs at 2048 EU/t. You can also boost it with oxygen for 3x the energy output. 

Oxygen is pretty easy to get from Distillation, so it's worth a shot.

This is a sigma ultra mega super beta gamma omega epsilon male multiblock that makes an unholy amount of steam for an unholy
amount of fuel

Reserved only for the greatest

And might be useful in some recipes
NOR gates are made from Phosphorous-Doped Wafers.

PVC is a polymer acquired from Vinyl Chloride; it can be used for item pipes but it is chiefly used for insulating EV cables.

It can also be used in place of PE in plastic circuit boards.

The Advanced Fluid Drilling Rig is a better way to get oil; and i mean better.
It produces an absolutely crazy 16x amount of fluid. You will gain 32x more oil from an oil vein.

Using Octane-Boosted Gasoline is an insane way to get a lot of power for IV and LuV.

The PIC is the more advanced version of the HV PIC.

It also requires the cleanroom, so i would recommend you enlargen your current one or make more.

Ruthenium, Rhodium, Iridium, Osmium, and Platinum are all Platinum Group Metals.
They are all required in recipes of this tier and above this tier, and all of this needs to be automated in order for you to gain the maximum
amount of benefit.

First i recommend you setup an Aqua Regia setup; which is Nitric Acid and Hydrochloric Acid. 

After that, you need to centrifuge any ore that produces a PGM metal;

these are Sheldonite, Tetrahedrite, Chalcopyrite, Pentlandrite, Bornite, and finally Chalcoite.

All of the Purified versions of these minerals need to be reacted with Nitric Acid for the Platinum Group Sludge dust.
These are the base PGM salts. They are the most common among the PGM salts.

Congrats! You have got your first PGM Metal.. Platinum! Platinum can be used to upgrade your NanoMuscle suite armor and can be used for
the EV Assembling Machine, which also unlocks Compact Machines 3. Good for automating your setups while being compact!

ME Input/Output hatches and buses are a compact way to connect AE2 to your multiblocks. There is also a Reservoir Hatch which
is basically an infinite water sink for a multiblock.
Explained in HV Extras. Requires Epoxy.
This is the main way to get Ruthenium and Rhodium for RTM alloys.

Tungsten is a VERY VERY VERY important metal that is REQUIRED for HBM's Nuclear Tech Mod. It is also needed for the next tier, AKA IV.
(Tungstensteel) 

Tungsten can be obtained from Tungstate or Scheelite which are End Ores. This can also be looped for infinite tungsten.

You will need Tungstic Acid and an Electrolyser for the base setup, but you can use a Chem Reactor to loop this chain.
New EV machine parts for new EV machines. EV Emitters need Quantum Eyes, which need radon; read more to find out how to get it.
Grove Stones are useless unactivated. To activate them, perform the Grove Supplication ritual.
This is the key to the Soul path of Harken Scythe. Use the Blunt Dagger on it to make a Harken Athame.

Grove Stones serve as a nexus for Fey energy, which can be used in the Fey Crafter.
This unlocks access to Amethyst tools, and also Runestone, which is the most important recipe.
Many kinds of rituals exist in Roots. To view them all, look at the Roots patchouli book.

Welcome to Harken Scythe!
This mod is inspired by old Tekkit.

There are 2 paths you can go down. Make a Glaive to extract Blood Essence, or a Scythe to extract Souls.

To actually USE the altars for crafting, you will have to store the respective essences in the crucible first. The crucible type and the altar type must match.
They must be within a few blocks of the Altar. To input the respective essence into the altar, right click with an Essence Keeper.
Grants access to the Petal Apothecary- I.E Botania

The Pyre is the main way of conducting rituals.

NOTE: Before getting a Flint and Steel, simply lighting a block around the Pyre with your Bow Drill/Flint and Tinder will work.
These three flowers unlock many new mods! So i suggest you make them as soon as you can.

To actually USE the altars for crafting, you will have to store the respective essences in the crucible first. The crucible type and the altar type must match.
They must be within a few blocks of the Altar. To input the respective essence into the altar, right click with an Essence Keeper.

Spells that are put on staves can have modifiers applied to them.
To access the modifier menu, place a staff in an Imposer then right-click with a knife.
Every spell has different modifiers.
The imbuer can also be used as an anvil, with no XP cost.
The Mortar is used for a variety of recipes. Right click with your ingredients, then right click with a pestle.
The Petal Apothecary is the gate to Botania, and you can move onto the next questline!

Runestone is incredibly important for early-game. It unlocks many new things, and it can also be used to make Runic Dust. 
Runic Dust has a lot of recipes and is a key component for the next tier.

Right-clicking a mob with your weapon till it dies causes it to sometimes drop either Souls or Blood.

To collect this, you will need an Essence Keeper. Simply right click to add it to the essence keeper.

Runic Shears may be used to gather Life Essences from mobs, as well as Runic Leather, which is an easy way to get leather.

It is also how you get many of the herbs existent in this mod.

Welcome to the Magic questline! 
The "eras" of magic are gated by the chapter groups sequentially. So, after this chapter, move on to the next in the sequence.
Anyway! Now that you have gathered the basic magic materials, it is time to start Roots.
You will see more of this in Shehitah.

Used in Arcane Archives, also used to make the Runic Shears.
Later unlocks XU2.
This is the key to the Blood path of Harken Scythe. Use the Blunt Dagger on it to make a Harken Athame.

Nether access. Refill it with obsidian!
I suggest you also make an overworld cake or apple so you can come back easily.

The spell system can be a little difficult to understand, but the gist is:

To learn a spell, you need to first make its spell dust in a Mortar. Next, make an imbuer and then place the spell dust inside it.
After that, simply place the gramary on top of the dust in the imbuer and wait. You will eventually receive a message that a new spell has been added to
your Spell Library.

To open the spell library, press K (default keybind) while holding a staff. This will allow you to select the spell!
Grants access to Arcane Archives.

Roots also has a Spell System. Spells are like tiny rituals; they cost a certain amount of herbs, which must be placed in a Component Pouch.
Spells are indexed in a Gramary, and cast by a Staff.

Thaumcraft is gated behind Botania. Gather ore from Essentia deposits and convert it into Salis Mundus...

Coralium deposits contain Alkimvite and Aquivite, and also Coralium/Rich Coralium.

Essentia deposits contain all the rest of the ores.
Poke yourself with it near an Altar to get blood in the altar.

With Tungstensteel, you can make the most peak multiblock in all of gregtech; The Processing Array. 

It can do machine processes in parallel, and it can do multiple at once with the Machine Access Interface.
These are some PGM metals that you should make + smelt if you haven't made them already.
HSS-S does not actually exist IRL, it is an alloy of some PGM metals and HSS-E.

More IV components, more efficient covers..
Have we been here before?
You know the drill. New voltage, new machines.

For Indium, you will need Galena and Sphalerite.
Process this with Sulfuric Acid (at this point, you should know how to do this already..)
Mix this into Indium Gallium Phosphide to progress toward the HPIC.

The power substation is a power storage multiblock that is Â§3modularÂ§f and can support a lot of energy storage. Useful for the center
of your power grid.
This is required for the main material for LuV, Rhodium-Plated Palladium.

Welcome to IV! the main material here is Tungstensteel, which is Tungsten and Iron. Not too hard if you have a decent Ore Laser setup
on one of the more iron-rich planets/started an asteroid mission.

Iridium and Osmium are also required in high amounts.

HSS-G Coil Blocks are required for HSS-S ingots.

A mouthful, i know.
This is required for the new tier of circuits, Quantum Circuits! :D

Binnie's Mods also have a large variety of alcohol, food, drink, saplings, and more.

Pro tip: Â§2Forestry'sÂ§f farms can be used for a lot of earlygame food instead of the GT Greenhouse. They are more expensive to run compared
to these farms.

The Earthen Basin can be used for two things; smashing things into juice with your *feet?* FDA Violation. anyway, it can also be used to made crude versions
of products like Salt and Sugar by heating water and scane juice respectively.

you can use the other basin for juicing shit.
Can be used to cook meats. I generally recommend you process your meat here.

Welcome to the food and survival chapter! this will give you some in-general tips on how to survive in the harsh environment
that is this post-apocalyptic wasteland of a modpack.

We will be covering Â§2 Plant growth, Nutrition, and much more.
In order to grow crops, you of course need tilled dirt. I recommend getting either a GT or a Tinker's Hoe.

The Greenhouse is the most efficient way of making sticky resin in this modpack. You can also use a number of different saplings for different
yields.

The Sprinkler cover can be attached to any GT Tank which holds fluids; (Super Tanks for example) when supplying the tank with
water (or any other sprinkler fluid) it will boost the growth exponentially.
The jar can be used to make Pickles, which are a very good source of nutrition + negate bad effects! Love to see it.

The Chopping Block is a workstation used for dicing/chopping/shredding food items into their respective forms.
This works with a lot of things, so feel free to experiment! Check JEI.

This modpack also contains Â§4Simple DifficultysÂ§f, which is a survival mod that adds a Â§6thirstÂ§f and Â§4temperatureÂ§f bar.

These bars are very difficult to maintain in the earlygame, so that is why i highly recommend getting the Canteen as soon as possible.

Heat is also an issue earlygame, standing near a furnace or other machines in an enclosed cave will make it very hot and thus hard to
survive in.

Some crops can only grow when in season; this means you can't just grow any crop at any time of the year.

You can view what season it is using the Season Clock.

You can also see what season a plant requires (if integrated) by looking at its tooltip.

Vanilla trees usually can grow in any season.

Â§2RusticÂ§f also has some options for Â§6ApicultureÂ§f (bees)

Finding a wild beehive and breaking it will get you some bees. Making an apiary and putting bees in it will slowly generate Â§5BeeswaxÂ§f and
Bees over time. 

Keeping an apiary near your farms will Â§2boostÂ§f the production!

For the magic players, Â§2RootsÂ§f provides some special soils that can be used for harvesting crops easier.

There is of course the faming station for the tech players, also with the Â§2Greenhouse.

Â§2RusticÂ§f also has some options for better soils.

With the crushing tub, you can jump up and down on it with an item placed inside to produce the Oil of that respective item. This also
extends to other things like sugarcane and grapes.
The more you cook, your level gets higher. Which means you get a lower chance of bad effects, and generally your food is more nutritious.

Â§2Pam's HarvestCraft Â§f is an extremely diverse food mod that has a lot of different foods for you to eat and thus keep your diet varied 
with.

As this modpack has the Nutrition mod, you need to take care of your diet as well. Eating one kind of food all the time will both
Â§5reduce the value of your current foodÂ§f and make your diet worse.

So you should probably make an underground farm of sorts to grow crops easily.

Alcohol! perfect for washing away your troubles after a bad day at the industrial complex.

Don't drink *too* much though, or you'll die of liver poisoning..
You need the mill to make many things, like Flour, Rice, but it can also be used to make Edible Oil, which is a great seasoning for food.
The Spatula is unlocked after Iron, and it helps in stir-frying the food to make it more cooked. Get it? No? Sigh.
The mortar is used to crush down things. Obviously. Pestle included!
RIGHTCLICK ON THE WOK TO GET YOUR FOOD. THE RENDERING IS A BIT BORKED.

Rustic is a vintage themed medieval mod based on brewing beers, elixirs, and doing alchemy.

The elixirs in question are very powerful and can grant III-IV level potion effects while also being a few minutes long! this is a massive
boon in bossfights.

You can also make oils to season your food.

As i mentioned before, Â§2RusticÂ§f not only has Alcohol, it has Â§5AlchemyÂ§f as well! the Alchemic Condenser is used for this very purpose;
to distill and use different ingredients to produce Â§8ElixirsÂ§f for buffs!

There is also an Â§5AdvancedÂ§f version which requires steel.

You need to attach the Â§2RetortÂ§f in order for the condenser to function.

GTFO is a GTCEu Addon that provides you with a large amount of new foods to consume and manufacture. this mod also changes the recipes
of some other mods recipes..

Cooking for Blockheads is a utility mod that helps you cook food easier. It can help you craft complex foods like Pizzas or Sausage rolls
in Â§2one click!Â§f essential for the time leading up to the midgame.

Food Overhaul makes it so that bigger meals like Steak don't give you as much hunger, but can also grant the Well Fed buff which
increases your stats, sort of like in terraria.

Foods cannot stack above 16!
Spices generally increase the chance of making your food more nutritious and reduce the chances of making it harmful (i.e giving you harmful effects)

Welcome to Cuisine! This mod is incredibly useful for early-game food and is HIGHLY recommended *by me, the packdev!~*

To get started, you need a Wok. This needs a heat source, so craft the Firepit and combine them to get your finished station.
You can input fluids and items in this, and when you get Iron you can make a Spatula to stir-fry it.

Using bees to produce items for you is not only tedious, but also has low rewards compared to other resource generating mods. Kinda like GregTech. Thats why it was included in this pack. What are you waiting for? Go catch some bees.

Bigger! Faster! Multifarm can be up to 27 block wide Rhombus (that's a real word btw).
Very effective (especially in MV).
Check the manual for building instructions.

Even faster and bigger Apiary.
Check the manual for building instructions.
Makes honey. Honey is yummy.

Put bees inside. Bees work. Bees die. Repeat.
(Putting a Drone with a Princess creates a Queen)
Makes bees out of Liquid Protein and Liquid DNA.
Welcome to Forestry! This is a large farming/resource generating mod that has many types of automation to explore.
You have probably notice that a "slight" portion of your inventory is being occupied by collected bees. To combat this issue you will certainly want to make these items.

There are two ways of producing Mutagen. One of them is expensive, the other one won't be unlocked untill IV. Fortunatelly Gregech makes redstone WAY more plentiful then it used to be. If you survive the trip back to the Overworld, that is.
Applies the Genetic Templates onto the bee and turns it into the template's bee. Collective would be proud of you.

Upgraded version of an Apiary.
Gendustry is a Forestry addon that adresses the issue of the SLOW and uncertain nature of beebreeding. If you want to live to see resource generation from Forestry, it's a must.

Gregor Mendel was a Czech biologist whose pea plant experiments established the rules of heredity. Mainly recessive and dominant genes.
Get your desireble Gene Samples from bees and add them on a Genetic Template using a Crafting Table.
Put bees inside. Bees work. Bees breed. Bees mutate.
No more random beebreeding. Finally, inner peace. Time to get every useful bee possible.
betterquesting:10.name:8: The End or a New Beginning

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
No, not like that.
Squeeze some seed oil out of stuff and use the oil to make casings.
Forestry is an old school mod - everything needs its own crafting table!

Thermionic Fabricator is used to make many Forestry items. The most useful ones are Electron Tubes. When soldered on Circuit Boards, they act as upgrades for machines.
There are many variants of Electron tubes, each with different effects on machines.
Check JEI for further info.
Analyse the bees to get their genetic traits.
Duplicates your Gene Samples and Genetic Templates so you don't have to repeat yourself. Very handy.
They're just Frames, but for an Industrial Apiary
Forestry adds many different farm types. When supplied with energy, water and fertiliser, they produce stuff fairly quickly. At leats for MV anyways.

This has nothing to do with either of them.
Frames act as Apiary and Alveary upgrades.
There are many variants of Frames, each with different effects and durabilities.
Check JEI for further info.

Welcome to RFTools! I assume you've read the quest in the LV Chapter, but to get started, you will need to be in LV, and also have access
to the Assembling Machine.

Machine Bases are in MV, so don't think about doing Redstone till then.

The Storage Scanner is an extremely useful machine created by using a TON of LV circuits. It's worth the investment, though, as it functions
as an Interface to other storage solutions, including crates and chests! It can also be used to loot chests, and it also connects to Modular
Storages easily, allowing quick and easy access to a lot of them at once.

Crafters come in a few tiers, 1-3. 
They are very, very fast and can be used for non-ae2 passive lines..
Modules allow you to do Digital Storage, at the cheap cost of a chest, a circuit, and some plates.
Modules can be inserted into screens to change the displayed data.

RFTools has an excellent Digital Storage option, very similar to AE2.
Since i am a kind soul, i made this available in LV. However, you will need a higher tier to get the T2 and T3 Storage Modules.
For now, you can worry about getting this; the Modular Storage.

It has a single slot for storage, and acts similar to an ME Chest. It can insert and export items, and it also has a useful crafting grid that works
similar to Forestry's Worktable.

Remote Storage is an insanely OP system that can be used in MV onwards. How it works is that you take your regular storage module,
and put a Remote Storage Module beside it. That will link it to the Remote Storage Module. Next, you leave the regular storage module
inside the block, and then put the new Module in the Modular Storage; This will allow you to interact with it as far away as you want,
and with 2 or more you can make interdimensional logistics networks, even better than AE2!
Screens are a useful way of displaying information. They need to be linked to a Screen Controller.
Filing Cabinets are a useful method to sort and do automatic storage. I recommend these for Bonsai Pot tree farms.

Drawers are an excellent storage solution, till way into lategame. They are very modular, and can be upgraded easily. You can use a Drawer Controller
to control large amounts of drawers at once.
Traveller's Backpacks may be used for sleeping, crafting, and also containing fluid.

Some legend ported Sophisticated Backpacks, so here you are! These have a multitude of upgrades and can be very OP. I recommend these over 
Traveller's.
AA Storage Crates offer good storage but not much utility. I recommend you use this with something like RFTools or something.
Handy Chests enter into digital storage, as they need "Memory Cards" which can hold items. There are a wholebunch of other features too.

For early-game, one of the best storage solutions is Arcane Archives. It has convenient storage, as well as the ability to manage storage easily, and you
can make a pseudo-ae2 system as well!
Crates are hardly the best option for storage, but their main point comes in being buffers for GT and also having the ability to have COVERS on them.
Compartments have about 2 Double Chests of space in a single block, and you can also organise them easily.

Welcome to Storage! Storage is an essential part of any playthrough. 
This chapter deals with Physical storage methods specifically, though digital methods will be dealt with later on.
Barely the most convenient, but it's early-game and decent for it.
This is Post-Iron, but arguably even better than crates, and MODULAR! how cool is that?
Strongboxes are USUALLY impractical for storage, but they can be secured against intruders using a Lock.
This armor is modular and can be inserted with various types of modifications, in the Engineer's Workbench.
Quite literally the first tools you'll get. The only weapon here is the Â§2SpearÂ§f, so make one as soon as you can!

After you get Masonry bricks, you can carve those on a chopping block to get Carved Masonry. 

These are your FIRST Â§2GT Tools!Â§f They will be very useful for making plates, rods, bolts, screws, etc.

Most gear has a Rarity attached to it. Basic, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, etc. with their own buffs. (Similar to apotheosis)

Gear also has Experience, which levels up to how much you use it. You can spend the experience points on Abilities, which grant you passive buffs unique
to the tool.
Vanilla stone tools.
This only works on VANILLA ARMORS! sucks.

Â§2GreatwoodÂ§f and Â§6SilverwoodÂ§f are both wood types found in-world, from Thaumcraft. They can be used to make a wide variety of GT Tools.
These are both stronger and faster than Carved Masonry and acquired earlier so, if you can, why not?
Or, if you're a magic mod main, you can also craft Amethyst Tools, which are the BEST for this tier.
Ice armor! Keeps you cold!
Wool armor! Keeps you warm!
Advanced GT Tools.
These include starter gear you can make earlygame.
Your first NTM armor!
This quest only contains the parts.
You should get ozzy liner under this, or you'll overheat.
As soon as you can mine gravel, switch to these. These tools will be able to get you till Masonry. They also give Â§2better dropsÂ§f from Gravel and other blocks.
This chapter is all about Â§2GearÂ§f. This will include Guns and stuff too.
Â§5Tinkers ConstructÂ§f tools are acquired quite late, but are worth the investment. These are the final tools for this tier.

Don't want to eat? Want to fly at insane speeds? Want to do insane amounts of damage in one hit?
This mod is for you!
Vampirism is a mod about being either a Vampire or a Vampire Hunter; each with its own detriments and benefits.

The HV Assembling Machine is the next step in progress, unlocking many new recipes as well as
some utility items.
You may unlock this in MV, but there is a long way to go for Space...
To Enter HV, You'll need these two things. So, that is why i have added these two in one Quest!
You will need this to cool down Titanium to make it usable!

PTFE is an important plastic required for the Large Chemical Reactor and also as a stand-in for PE in many places, allowing for much more efficient
recipes.
Though the quest says "Optional", sadly, these are very much NOT optional.

The Multismelter is basically a better Steam Oven. It's a furnace with many more parallels.. 

The coil tier also increases the amount of max parallels!

Titanium Tetrachloride is acquired by reducing Rutile down in a HV Chemical Reactor. It must be smelted with Magnesium to get the Titanium Ingots!

All the byproducts of this reaction can be 100% recycled, allowing you to infnitely process Rutile without any loss of chemicals!
To unlock the next tier of energy hatch, you'll need to make LPIC (Low-Power IC) which take an Orange Lens made only from Chemical Dye.

Boules have a property in which if you dope them with certain impurities they will make a better yield. A prime example is the P-Doped Boule,
Yielding 8x more components per wafer! As you go on, you will NEED to dope boules in order to get certain components.
The material for the next tier!

Workstations will be your first EV Circuits, made in the Cleanroom. Technically, these can be made with an MV Circuit Assembler, but the Cleanroom is
HV, so it is customary to make them at this point.

Ahh.. wait, POLYETHYLENE??!

Yes, Polyethylene. If you haven't somehow done it already go do it!

Anyway, HV machines take almost 4x the power of MV machines, so upgrading your power grid is ESSENTIAL!
The Macerator is pretty good in early game, but the HV Macerator unlocks 3 extra slots for additional byproducts.
This machine turns gem dust into gems directly, and also is REQUIRED for making Rockets!
The HV Chemical Reactor unlocks many more recipes, to feed into HV.

Fluix is quite an in-depth line.

For starters, you'll need access to Destabilized Redstone. It can be made in the Â§6TiCon Smeltery Â§for
by simply heating up redstone with a catalyst, this time being Thorium Dust.
This is the next step in progression- and also required for many HV recipes such as the Energy Hatch.
The HV Autoclave allows you to make Energium Crystals.
SMD Components are much cheaper than their regular counterparts but need more advanced infrastructure to use.

Nitric Acid is used in a multitude of different applications.

You use it in-

Cetane-Boosted Diesel
Nitrobenzene
PBI (IV)
PGS (IV)

SMD Components are much cheaper than their regular counterparts but need more advanced infrastructure to use.
These are the Diodes and Inductors, unlocked slightly later.
The new Circuit Assembler will allow you to make your first Mainframe- or the first IV Circuit!

Rutile is made through processing Bauxite! Bauxite is an aluminium based ore and can be found in the End..

However, an even better source of Rutile is Ilmenite, found on the Moon! The moon contains very large and dense Ilmenite deposits.
Nichrome Coils are the new coil tier. They require cooling down in the VF, as will most metals in higher tiers.

The Cleanroom is a multiblock structure, that is similar to a real cleanroom; 

Some recipes may require a clean and non-contaminated environment. The Cleanroom is the source of this environment.
Providing power to it will clean the insides over time, and at a point it will be 100% functional, and Muffler hatches/Generators are NOT allowed.

To do logistics, the best way is to use passthrough hatches.
For energy, Diodes may be used.

(Note: When you reach AE2, you can use Machine Hulls for passing ME signals through.

Check JEI for the structure!

the LCR is a Multiblock that can do multistep Chemical Reactor recipes in one go. It can also do certain exclusive recipes (mainly Radon)
Using 2 Energy Hatches makes it run at the next tier.

Remember those chemical dyes you could make using Sulfuric Acid? Well, now you can use those to dye lenses.
Lenses will be useful as each different color gives you a unique output!

NOTE: If you are uninterested in Magic or Exploring so far, your only way to make endereyes is in this machine.

Before you unlock the LCR, the way to get PTFE involves a few steps.

You'll need Chloroform and Hydrofluoric Acid, both of which are relatively simple.
Chloroform is just Methane and Chlorine (With a byproduct of HCl, Yeah!)
Hydrofluoric Acid is just Hydrogen and Fluorine. Very easy.

To get the Rocket Launch Pad, you'll need a little something called Space-Grade Steel. This is made using Dark Steel and Enderpearl dust, so you'll
want to venture into that a little bit before launching! Space Grade Steel is also required for making the heavy-duty plates.

In order to actually run your rocket, you'll need fuel. and a lot of it at that!
Fuel is made in MV, and its in the questline. You'll also need a fuel loader to load the fuel onto the rocket!
The TIER 1 rocket will only allow you to go to the Moon.

Welcome to the Space chapter! Here we will be covering all things related to Galacticraft and Space.

First thing you'll need is your tier-1 rocket.. to get that, you'll need a NASA Workbench.

Welcome to Â§2Â§lGregTech: The Community ModpackÂ§r.

This modpack features Â§2Â§lGregtech: Community Edition UnofficialÂ§r (also known as Â§2GTCEuÂ§r or Â§2CEuÂ§r), a continuation of GTCE. This mod provides a lot more content through all the tiers and up to Â§dUltimate VoltageÂ§r, and a non negligible amount Quality of Life.

This is a pure Â§4TechÂ§r modpack, focusing on GregTech and its progression.

You will find no better place to learn about this mod and all the features it adds!

Â§6This questbook is very informativeÂ§r, so check it out to learn anything new about the mod. Click on the EyeÂ§r icon to toggle Â§9View ModeÂ§r to read any quest ahead of time. This is one of many features added by Â§2Better Questing UnofficialÂ§r, yet another great port of a mod.


Â§bLore:Â§r At the time of writing this, a few players have already completed the modpack. They thoroughly enjoyed it! GTCEu really is what GTCE should have been.

Â§4Â§lBe sure to properly read this quest to not get lost during your playthrough.Â§r


Informative Quests such as this will appear in both the chapter it is unlocked, and the Information chapter. Regularly come back to the Â§9"Tips and Tricks" TabÂ§r if you feel like you forgot something.


Quest outlines are merely the main goals. Â§6Every single Quest is extremely important or provides crucial InformationÂ§r. Â§cIf something is optional, it will be statedÂ§r.


Modpack can be played on Â§dPeacefulÂ§r, and we recommend you to do so. You may also use the keepInventory Gamerule and abuse minimap teleport as you see fit. This modpack is not focusing on survival.


Make good use of Â§2JEIÂ§r. Items have several recipes, so do not stop at the first displayed. Identify patterns in autogenerated recipes (example: all the Iron related items macerating into Iron Dusts). When complex recipes arise, we will make sure to Â§6guide youÂ§r through the best path to a product.

Â§oA minecraft adventure starting with Wood!? This is truly unoriginal, I want a refund...Â§r

If you're familiar with Â§2GregTechÂ§r, you may be aware of nerfed vanilla recipes. We have a few of them. However Wood to Planks is unchanged, rejoice!

Here, get some food. If you're playing on Peaceful, put it on a display.

Here's a list of some of the things you'll be needing for early game. Collect more than in this quest, you will need more.

I would advise doing this quest first and take the Â§6RewardÂ§r. That way you can do a little bit of main Progression Â§obeforeÂ§r being required to go mining.

Rubber Trees are found in Â§2ForestÂ§r, Â§2JungleÂ§r or Â§2SwampÂ§r Biomes.

EightÂ§r Furnaces might seem excessive. But trust me, you will want them.

Â§oGlass, at last!Â§r

Use Mortars or a Macerator (your choice!) to microcraft your way to Glass Dust, which you can then turn into a Â§aGlass blockÂ§r.
Glass will be easier later on. I am certain you have noticed that juicy Arc Furnace recipe.

Glass tubes will be required for Electronic Circuits, so make some!

Â§oSome of the details are repeated from the introduction quest, but we feel like we needed to expand on the explanation if you want to know all the details!Â§r

The veins and their details can be found in Â§2JEIÂ§r. They contain up to four different ores.

Â§dSurface rocksÂ§r indicate the type of veins that are below them. In Â§2JEIÂ§r, press U on the Tiny Dust you mined from the rock and navigate to the Â§aOre PageÂ§r. This page contains details on what types of ores generate, their generation patterns, their spawning dimension and Y-level range, and their spawning weight, which is the chance it spawns.

Ore veins generate in a Â§4GridÂ§r. Every vein is spaced by 3 chunks from one to another in a cardinal direction.
They spawn at the Â§4CenterÂ§r of the Chunks which have both their X and Z coordinates be at Â§b1 plus a multiple of 3Â§r (-8, -5, -2, 1, 4, 7, ...).

It will be simpler if you simply rely on Â§2In Game InfoÂ§r displayed in the top left corner. In most cases there will be a Â§dSurface RockÂ§r in the Center of the Chunk, which provides completely accurate information for the Ore Vein.

However Ore veins may be deleted by caves, Oil deposits, or from trying to generate above the ground.

It's a good practice to make Â§dWaypointsÂ§r to every vein you find, and to label their type. You may want to come back to it several times.

This modpack also includes the mod Â§dVisualOresÂ§r, which will mark discovered veins on your map. Â§9Right ClickÂ§r an ore block in the vein to add it to the map. You can toggle the ore vein view in the lower left corner of the fullscreen map.


Each Ore vein is always Â§d7 blocksÂ§r tall, and ores generate in 4 different patterns:
- The Â§9Top OreÂ§r generates in the higher 4 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Bottom OreÂ§r generates in the lower 3 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Between OreÂ§r generates in the middle 3 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Sporadic OreÂ§r generates anywhere in the vein. There will be the least amount of this ore in a vein.
The same ore type can be in 2 different generation patterns, such as in Cassiterite veins.
Â§


In Â§6LVÂ§r Age, you can craft an Ore Prospector to assist yourself in finding ores.

Â§oDid you know GregTech has tools equivalent to vanilla tools? Did you know some of them are actually better?Â§r

Here, the Â§aAxeÂ§r for example, this one is a beast! Mine a Wood Log and it will Â§6fell the entire treeÂ§r for you! Who needs Ore Excavation? Not me, not you!

Their durability wears down really fast, so you may want to make them out of Diamond (but not the vanilla diamond Axe, no!).

Take these spruce saplings to grow 2x2 giant trees. There's a lot of smelting coming up, and wooden planks are a surprisingly very effective fuel source.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.
betterquesting:10.name:8: I must Axe you two Questions

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oWrought Iron has a very low carbon content, but that's enough to make it tougher than regular Iron.Â§r

GregTech Tools made of Â§aWrought IronÂ§r are Â§650% more durableÂ§r than with regular Iron.

You can make it from Â§asmelting Iron NuggetsÂ§r, and Â§arecombining the NuggetsÂ§r. Do not convert all your Iron as it is not interchangeable.

Here's your Introduction to GregTech tools. Something that may confuse you is how JEI displays iron tools. But in fact you can make the tools off Â§dmany materialsÂ§r. The first one is Iron, or Wrought Iron if you read that quest.


Â§9Â§lHammer:Â§r A crafting tool used to for a lot of early game recipes. It also works as a mining tool for ores to crush them, more information on that later. Its last function is to mute machines by Â§msmackingÂ§r right-clicking them.

As an additional on Â§lallÂ§r GregTech tools. You can Â§6repairÂ§r them in an Â§6AnvilÂ§r using the material of the tool itself, like any vanilla tool! Â§dBottles o' EnchantingÂ§r are craftable too.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oThis hammer is very different. It's a pickaxe, but also not. It's a Â§dÂ§o3x3 pickaxeÂ§rÂ§o!Â§r

Make good use of this! You want it, I know it! This bad boy will give you so many ores in no time, given you are in a vein.

Â§3DrawersÂ§r are configured to Â§6keep their InventoryÂ§r when broken, so you can use them for your mining expeditions.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oIron is very abundant! And not just in the form of pure Iron Ore. In reality, Iron is found in a lot of oxide forms or minerals.Â§r

The Â§dOre GenerationÂ§r tab in this questbook tells you which types of materials come from which ore veins. The Ore Spawn Information and Ore Byproduct List tabs in Â§2JEIÂ§r list them as well.

Take a look at those tabs for Â§bÂ§aIronÂ§r. Any of the Ores listed here can be smelted directly to Iron. That is Â§dfour different veinsÂ§r that virtually have Iron Ore.

Do not bother about ore processing yet. Â§aDirect smelting will be the most efficient for a whileÂ§r, given how easy it is to obtain a lot of ores.


Gather Â§eanyÂ§r of the Iron yielding Ores to complete this quest.

More GregTech tools are required for progression, here are the most important of them all.

Â§9Â§lWrench:Â§r A crafting tool. But also a mining tool for GregTech machines (perfect if you think using pickaxes is unethical). Is that it? Certainly not! It has right click functions to double as a Forge Â§6Wrench for other modsÂ§r. Right Click also allows you to set the output side of GregTech machines. Shift right clicking allows you to rotate GregTech machines.

Â§9Â§lFile:Â§r A crafting tool. And that's it. Yes.

Â§9Â§lSaw:Â§r Another crafting tool. If we were evil, we would force it to obtain 4 Planks and 4 Sticks from their respective crafting recipes. That said you can still use it to get Â§a6 Planks per LogÂ§r, if you wish.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

More tools, not important right now, but required later on.

Â§9Â§lScrewdriver:Â§r A crafting tool. It is used for special configuration of machines and Covers.

Â§9Â§lWire Cutter:Â§r A crafting tool. It is needed to connect wires together. Right-clicking on wires will enable or disable connection to other blocks.

Â§9Â§lMortar:Â§r A crafting tool, to grind various things into dust form.

Â§9Â§lKnife:Â§r A mediocre weapon, but also... you guessed it, a crafting tool!

Â§9Â§lSoft Mallet:Â§r A tool to pause machines from working with right-click. Right-clicking again resumes working.

There are a few Â§dother ToolsÂ§r which are less important, but deserve a mention.

Â§9Â§lCrowbar:Â§r A niche tool to remove Covers from GregTech machines with a right-click.

Â§9Â§lScythe:Â§r A powerful farming tool, automatically breaks and re-plants crops in a large area. Also works as a good weapon!

Â§9Â§lPlunger:Â§r A tool to clear stuck fluids from GregTech machines.

Â§9Â§lButchery Knife:Â§r A weapon pre-enchanted with Looting III. Useful for getting extra food, Leather...

Â§eNote:Â§r This quest's reward is Â§9Damascus SteelÂ§r. A rare material which is only found in Â§ddungeon/worldgen lootÂ§r. It is much better than the materials you have access to right now, so be sure to use it!

Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oMaybe you thought forcing crafting with tools would make your life painful. I shall present you the solution: the Crafting Station.Â§r

The Â§3Crafting StationÂ§r is a highly Â§9advanced Crafting TableÂ§r, with inventory slots for item and tools. Put the recipes either by dropping ghost items, or using the Â§a+Â§r in Â§2JEIÂ§r. Crafting the items will use the items and tools in the inventory. The 9 slots on the right are saved up recipes so you can re-use them without re-opening Â§2JEIÂ§r.

What makes the Â§3Crafting StationÂ§r amazing, is the fact that Â§6it can use adjacent inventoriesÂ§r in addition to its own inventory. If you are familiar to playing with Applied Energistics, the Crafting Station is essentially a mini ME Crafting Terminal.


Â§bLore:Â§r The reason Nomifactory had Forestry in its modlist was primarily due to its Worktable, which serves a similar function to the Crafting Station. A couple more Forestry items were used, otherwise the whole mod's functionality was disabled!

Â§oThis will be the first Project, or will it be?Â§r

The Â§3Coke OvenÂ§r makes Â§aCoke from CoalÂ§r, or Â§aCharcoal from WoodÂ§r, in addition to Â§dCreosoteÂ§r as bonusÂ§r output.
Â§dCreosoteÂ§r can be used as furnace fuel toÂ§6 smelt 32 itemsÂ§r, and is required for making Â§dTreated Wood PlanksÂ§r (rings a bell?).

The amount of resources required is listed in the first Â§eoptionalÂ§r task.
Check the Â§2JEI Multiblock PreviewÂ§r for the structure pattern.

Â§9Note:Â§r Â§lAnyÂ§r Brick block can be replaced with a Â§3Coke Oven HatchÂ§r as seen in the last Â§eoptionalÂ§r task. You can have up to five of them.
The Hatch allows for automation. It will Â§dauto-exportÂ§r both Fluid and Items with it! It also works for insertion into the Coke Oven (you can use Hoppers).


If the Coke Oven happens to fully fill up on Creosote that you are not using, break and replace the Coke Oven block. Automated fluid voiding is available later in the game.


Â§bLore:Â§r The concept of Multiblocks is very old in modded Minecraft. Think of IndustrialCraft 2's Nuclear Reactor, or Railcraft's Coke Oven; they were revolutionary at the time.

Gather more resources, namely Â§aCopperÂ§r and Â§aTinÂ§r.

Check the ore tab to find out which veins they come from.

You can tell at a glance the element types within most ores (and most other materials) with the Â§emolecular formulaÂ§r in the tooltip. Copper is Â§dCuÂ§r, Tin is Â§dSnÂ§r, Iron is Â§dFeÂ§r, and you can consult a Â§dperiodic tableÂ§r for most of the others.

This quest can be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r metal, so you can claim as the reward the metal you're missing. Be sure to find a source of both soon though, as you will need a lot of both to get through the Steam Age.

Â§oHumanity's first Alloy, and yours too!Â§r

Â§6BronzeÂ§r is an alloy of Â§aCopperÂ§r and Â§aTinÂ§r. Grind down 3 parts Copper and 1 part Tin into dust, then combine and smelt them. You will need a Â§5MortarÂ§r from the "More Tools" Quest.

Make many more Â§aBronze IngotsÂ§r than what is called for here. This will be your main material for the Steam Age, and you will need lots of it.

Â§6The progression now continues in the Steam Age chapter.Â§r


Â§bLoreÂ§r: Bronze in real life is closer to 7 parts Copper and 1 part Tin. Here (and in most of the rest of modded Minecraft) it sadly has to be changed for game balance. Many more such cases!

Â§oThe bucket recipe is changed, it now requires Plates. #realismÂ§r

Â§dPlates are used everywhereÂ§r in GregTech. You make them Â§ausing two IngotsÂ§r thanks to your newly made Â§5HammerÂ§r. Better recipes for Plates will be unlocked later.


Here, take this Wooden Barrel full of Water as a reward. You may ask why? No reason! Ah, just as a way to teach you that all GTCEu tanks are portable!

Why is this chapter called Steam Age again?
Anyways, you have access to three types of boilers. I recommend you start with the Coal Boiler as it is the cheapest to make, and is easy to maintain (the fuel consumption is tiny!).

Craft Â§eanyÂ§r of the boilers to complete this quest.

Â§oWhy is this chapter called Steam Age again? It can't be due to this machine, can it?Â§r

Anyways... The Â§3Solid BoilerÂ§r is the only available Boiler for now, as the Glass needed for the others is not available. Make one, or two.

Â§cImportant:Â§r Boilers can Â§cexplodeÂ§r! Water does not mess too well with high temperatures, and a steam explosion may occur under the following conditions:
Â§9-Â§r The Boiler is hot, shown by the red bar in the GUI
Â§9AND
-Â§r The Boiler has no water, signified by the absence of blue bar
Â§9AND
-Â§r The Boiler receives waterÂ§r

You can be perfectly safe by filling the boiler with water before heating it up, and making sure it has water constantly. The drain is slow - Â§a1 mBÂ§r of Water boils into Â§a160 mBÂ§r of Steam - so you don't have to worry too much.

The Boiler will auto eject steam on all faces except bottom. For automated Water input, use the bottom face.


Â§9Note:Â§r In this modpack, explosions are configured to not damage any block or entity, but you still lose your machine!

Â§oThe Alloy Smelter makes alloys... The name didn't state it clearly enough.Â§r

Use it for more Â§6efficient BronzeÂ§r, and for future alloys.
