In general, it is better to prioritize placing down more machines over overclocking the recipes. That way, you end up losing less energy processing the resources.


Â§aBenzeneÂ§r is burned in a Â§3Gas TurbineÂ§r. This power source starts weaker than its Â§eDieselÂ§r cousin, but gets a big boost when refined to Â§6NitrobenzeneÂ§r in Â§6HVÂ§r Age. Ultimately, your power source is your choice.

Â§oI was scared of having to explain in details on how to make Diesel, but thankfully you already made Light Fuel... phew.Â§r

Â§aDieselÂ§r is a Â§9Combustion FuelÂ§r. It is Â§dOil basedÂ§r.

To mix Â§aLight FuelÂ§r and Â§aHeavy FuelÂ§r, the right ratio for Â§3DistilleriesÂ§r is Â§63:2Â§r from Â§dOilÂ§r or Â§dRaw OilÂ§r.
3 Distilleries for Light Fuel.
2 Distilleries for Heavy Fuel.

You may cut the amount of Â§dOilÂ§r Â§6drasticallyÂ§r by using Â§dHeavy OilÂ§r for Â§aHeavy FuelÂ§r specifically. Â§dOilsandsÂ§r is great to use for this!
(For the math nerds, you go from 8.33 Oil -> 6 Diesel, to 5 Oil + 0.4 Heavy Oil -> 6 Diesel) 

Â§cNote: Do Â§cnot attemptÂ§r to put Oil in the Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r, thinking it's a good idea because it gives both Light Fuel and Heavy Fuel right now. This requires a lot of overclocking and you will lose more energy than what the byproducts are worth for power generation.
In general, it is better to prioritize placing down more machines instead of overclocking the recipes for power generation. That way, you end up losing less energy processing the resources. Later on this will change when you have the power generation to keep up with energy-intensive processes.


Â§aDieselÂ§r is burned in a Â§3Combustion GeneratorÂ§r. It can be further refined to Â§6Cetane-Boosted DieselÂ§r in Â§6HVÂ§r Age. Compared to the other power sources, it is generally more efficient, but more demanding. If you take the Â§eOilÂ§r route for Â§aPolyethyleneÂ§r, this can work great with existing infrastructure. Ultimately, your power source is your choice.

Â§oLPG (Liquid Petroleum Gas) is a mix of hydrocarbons typically used in heating appliances.Â§r

Â§aRefinery GasÂ§r, Â§aLPGÂ§r and Â§aMethaneÂ§r are Â§9Gas FuelsÂ§r.

Refinery Gas is obtained either through Â§dNatural GasÂ§r or Â§dLight OilÂ§r, the latter yielding more yet requiring a distillation step.

The Â§3CentrifugeÂ§r step to separate into Â§aLPGÂ§r and Â§aMethaneÂ§r should always be done, as it is extremely free.


Â§aÂ§aLPGÂ§r and Â§aMethaneÂ§r are burned in a Â§3Gas TurbineÂ§r. Among the other fuel options, they are the easier to set up which makes them excellent to get started. However they cannot be refined further, so upgrading the Â§3Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r may be a top priority if you stick to this fuel source.

Â§aMethaneÂ§r can also be obtained from a few Â§anatural sourcesÂ§r. Between you and me, they are memes, but you can explore them if you wish. Ultimately, your power source is your choice.

Â§oFinally, Fluid Drilling Rigs in GTCEu!Â§r

It is quite an investment to get to run a Â§3Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r, but it is by far the most prominent Â§6source of OilÂ§r.
It pumps fluids from underneath Bedrock. Note that the fluids aren't actually there, instead they are simulated.

Fluid veins are stored within regions of Â§48x8 chunksÂ§r. Each vein has a different fluid, but they are mostly types Oil.
You are not able to do prospection for fluid veins Â§oyetÂ§r, this will come in the Â§6HVÂ§r Age.

Each vein generates with a different base yield. This is typically between Â§d150LÂ§r to Â§d300L per secondÂ§r.

When drained, fluid veins will slowly deplete. This will cause the fluid yield to decrease over time, until it reaches its depletion yield. At that point you should move the Rig to somewhere else.
A Â§3Basic Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r will last for 100,000 operations (with 1 second per operation) until depletion. This is enough for Â§6well over 10,000Â§r buckets of Oil. Higher tier Rigs will massively increase the yield, while also decreasing the depletion rate.


What you can find in the Â§2OverworldÂ§r:
Â§9Oil:Â§r richer in Â§aLight FuelÂ§r, the most appreciated variant.
Â§9Light Oil:Â§r richer in Â§aRefinery GasÂ§r, usable for power.
Â§9Heavy Oil:Â§r richer in Â§aHeavy FuelÂ§r, which has uses that are more niche.
Â§9Raw Oil:Â§r richer in Â§aNaphthaÂ§r, the best source of the early-game oil products.
Â§9Natural Gas:Â§r grants Â§aRefinery GasÂ§r with no distillation required.
Â§lÂ§9Salt Water:Â§r grants Â§aSodiumÂ§r and Â§aChlorineÂ§r, useful later.

Â§rWhat you can find in the Â§cNetherÂ§r:
Â§9Natural Gas:Â§r grants Â§aRefinery GasÂ§r but with higher yield than the Overworld vein.
Â§9Lava:Â§r you know what this is.


For starters you may have to tap randomly until you find something you like. Whatever you pump can be used to refuel your Fluid Rig.

Â§oI hope at no point you made the LV Extruder, because only the MV Extruder is actually useful. If you did, I suggest you recycle it through the Arc Furnace.Â§r

The Extruder shapes solid materials into (almost!) any form using Â§aIngotsÂ§r. This is a great way to reduce the amount of microcrafting, as well as keeping a high conversion ratio.

The Extruder can make Â§6BoltsÂ§r, Â§6Â§6Small GearsÂ§r, Â§6GearsÂ§r, and Â§6Â§6RingsÂ§r at the highest efficiency in a single step!
You may also like to use it for Â§dPipesÂ§r, Â§dLong RodsÂ§r, and Â§dRotorsÂ§r.

Â§oA LV Battery Buffer and two LV Energy Hatches are not so convenient, let's remedy that!Â§r

Upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace with a Â§3MV Energy HatchÂ§r, so you can run it off MV Generators without using Â§3TransformersÂ§r.

Â§oThe Cutting Machine... cuts... thanks to lubrification.Â§r

For now, you may use Â§9WaterÂ§r over trying to acquire Lubricant.

The Â§3Cutting MachineÂ§r enables converting Â§6Rods into four BoltsÂ§r.

This machine is the only way to obtain Â§dGem PlatesÂ§r, which are needed to craft Filters, and by extension the Â§3Gas CollectorÂ§r.

Â§oNow you might wonder, why is every machine duplicated across all tiers? Because you might want them for overclocking.Â§r

Overclocking is a mechanic that happens when you try to run a recipe in a machine Â§dthat is higher tier than the recipe itself.Â§r
Each tier above the recipe tier allows one overclock. Each overclock implies:
Â§9-Â§r 2x recipe speed
Â§9-Â§r 4x power consumption
Â§9->Â§r 2x total energy cost

As you can see there are upsides and downsides. It is a game of balancing decisions: if you want to cut time duration at the cost of greater consumption.
You and only you can answer this question.
Â§9However I will tell you this:Â§r for automated setups, overclock as little as possible!


Machines have a button to set the maximum voltage tier it will Overclock to. Click on it to cycle through all the available Voltages, and set it on Â§dXÂ§r to disable Overclocking.


Â§bLore:Â§r GTCE overclocking was extremely awkward... If the recipe consumed 16EU/t or below, it would do a classic overclock. However if the recipe consumed more than 16EU/t, every Overclock would be 2.8x faster!

Â§oAutocrafting at last!Â§r

Â§aPatternsÂ§r are used for AE2 autocrafting. Using Â§aPolyvinyl ChlorideÂ§r increases the yield by Â§64 timesÂ§r, and higher-tier polymers have higher yields.

Â§3Molecular AssemblersÂ§r aren't available for a little while more, but you can still automate machines with Â§9ME InterfacesÂ§r.
Â§r
When using Â§9ME TerminalsÂ§r, you can input mathematical expressions into the amount field when requesting crafts, so you don't need a calculator.

When a craft is finished, you will get a Â§etoastÂ§r notifying you. This can be disabled in the config.

Â§3TransformersÂ§r allow you to step up and down Voltage tiers safely. Transformers change the power they receive into an equivalent amount of power 1 voltage tier above or below the input voltage.

Apart from running machines on different voltage tiers, Transformers are useful for transporting power across longer distances. Cable loss has less of an effect at higher voltages.

Transformers have 5 low voltage sides, and 1 high voltage side.

The Â§9normalÂ§r Transformer can only do 1A <-> 4A conversion, but Â§9AdjustableÂ§r Transformers can be changed between 1A <-> 4A, 2A <-> 8A, 4A <-> 16A, and 16A <-> 64A conversions. 

Use a Â§aSoft HammerÂ§r to change between transform up and down, and a Â§aScrewdriverÂ§r on Adjustable Transformers to change the amperage.

Higher tier Transformers require Â§9CoilsÂ§r.

In theory, Crates are better than chests. A single block space that stores more items.

The sad truth however is... they do not support item movement shortcuts well. We are planning on making them great again.

Where they shine however is the fact that they Â§6accept CoversÂ§r, making them perfect candidates for buffers in automation.

The underground has pure Oilsands ore veins. You may Â§3centrifugeÂ§r the Dust to get Â§aHeavy OilÂ§rÂ§r.


Â§9Â§lNote:Â§r Â§lThe Oil path is one path towards Â§9Â§lEthyleneÂ§rÂ§l. The other paths involve Trees and Plants.Â§rÂ§r
For now, Oil is Â§doptionalÂ§r. But it will become mandatory starting with Â§5EVÂ§r Age, much later.

Oil can also be refined in the form of Â§aLight FuelÂ§r, Â§aDieselÂ§r or even Â§aGasolineÂ§r, which are excellent power options.
If you chose this path, you should use it for both Power and Ethylene. 

Heavy Oil is best used for making Â§aHeavy FuelÂ§r for producing Â§aDieselÂ§r in combination with another oil type for Light Fuel. Other oil types are also better for producing products such as Ethylene.

Aluminium Cells, a big upgrade over the Steel Cells or Universal Fluid Cells.

They can hold any fraction of Fluid, up to Â§d32 bucketsÂ§r.

An Iron Gold vein hybrid.

This should be your primary destination for Iron expeditions, so you can get that bonus Gold.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Magnetite - Source of Iron, Gold, Vanadium

betterquesting:10.desc:8: A standard Iron vein, good target when you need to refill.

Your number one vein for sources of Chlorine.

Lithium can be obtained from Lepidolite Ore Processing.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Gamer Rage - Source of Salt, Chlorine, Lithium, Fluorine

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Your classic Redstone vein.

Ruby is very important for the Chrome it contains.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Redstone - Source of Redstone, Ruby, Chrome, Mercury

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Both Sapphires are your primary source of Aluminium until you can unlock other electrolysis recipes in MV.

The other two gems are mediocre at best.

This vein is only ever good for Magnesium starting in the mid game.

... And maybe some Olivine as it can substitute Emerald.

Good source of Â§6Heavy OilÂ§r, which is useful for Â§6DieselÂ§r setups early on.

If you don't want to process the ore entirely, you can Â§bCentrifugeÂ§r it directly.
Your one and only trusty source for Nickel.
The worst Iron vein, good in the early game, that's about it.

A source of Bauxite for your first ever source of Titanium.

Kyanite and Mica have decent decompositions, but there are better options.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Mica - Source of GT:NH Hatred, and some Aluminium, Fluorine, Titanium

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Pyrolusite is what you are here for. It smelts directly into Manganese which is needed for the HV Age.

Tantalite eventually becomes extremely valuable thanks to Niobium byproducts.

A decent alternative to the pure Tin vein, if you did not find it.

The other ores are as good as decoration.
It's shiny, you wish you could make jewelry out of it.

Did you know Lazurite and Sodalite can be used as Lapis in enchanting?

Sodalite is the most valuable Ore here, thanks to its electrolysis in the MV Age.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Lapis - Source of Lapis Lazuli, Aluminium, Sodium, Chlorine

betterquesting:10.desc:8: This one's nothing but a meme. Seriously, check the vein name in JEI.
The most consistent source of Lead and Silver.

Your only source of Diamond!

Diamond has Â§6five times more durabilityÂ§r than Iron for tools. However you may need Diamond Plates for some of them, which is locked behind the Cutting Machine.

Diamond and Graphite both electrolyze to a lot of Carbon.

Â§cNote:Â§r Avoid macerating Diamonds in the early game. Recovering gem dusts into the actual gem cannot be done for a while.

An excellent Iron Copper hybrid vein.

Chalcopyrite will play an essential role in the late game for Platinum Group Sludge.

A great vein for the early game. Copper and Tin to make Bronze, Realgar for your first source of Arsenic, and Zeolite for... nothing much.

Â§bLore:Â§r Due to auto-generated recipes, Zeolite used to be electrolyzed in batches of 141. Oops!
Coal as an ore is barely worth it, because of the additional step(s) required to get it as usable fuel, but this is a classic.
A pure, very rich Tin vein, excellent for early game.

Â§oYour Forestry compatibility mineral, Apatite!Â§r

This is pretty much the one vein you want to tap in for Phosphorus, which requires quite a few steps of processing to obtain.

Pyrochlore will eventually become extremely valuable, as it is a source of Niobium.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Apatite - Source of Calcium, Phosphorus, Niobium

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Both Topaz ores are absolutely excellent for electrolysis.

The best Fluorine source.

Electrotine is important for progression in the HV Age. It centrifuges into Electrum, a source of Gold and Silver, and Redstone.

Saltpeter is used in a few reactions, and the other two are pretty bad.

Â§bLore:Â§r Does Nikolite ring a bell? It was the ancestor of Electrotine, in RedPower.

Your classic Nether Quartz vein.

Silicon is never really hard to obtain, but this can be one of the ways through Quartzite.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Quartz - Source of Nether Quartz, Silicon

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Your first Nether expedition will be for Sulfur, which is found in this vein!

Sphalerite is extremely valuable, as its ore processing gives Gallium. It also smelts directly into Zinc.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Sulfur - Source of Sulfur, Iron, Zinc

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Rare Earths vein, for progression in the EV age and onwards.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Bastnatite - Source of Rare Earths, Neodymium, Fluorine

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
This vein is very rare!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Certus Quartz - Source of Applied Energistics, Barium

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Emerald is the useful ore here. It's used in small quantities in MV Age, and is a part of the Crystal process for Crystal and Wetware circuits much later on.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Emerald - Source of Beryllium, Emerald, Thorium

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oShredding your Ores with Byproducts.Â§r

The Â§3HV MaceratorÂ§r finally unlocks more of the slots shown in JEI. With this the first Â§9threeÂ§r slots are now available. This allows you to receive the Â§6unique ore ByproductÂ§r from macerating Â§dThermal Â§dCentrifuged OreÂ§r.

Macerating Ores costs Â§a32 EU/tÂ§r with Â§5both overclocksÂ§r, which makes this machine able to fit in LV lines, convenient!

Despite the significant improvements this machine provides, it is still not completely worth it to do advanced processing for your all ores. Energy and time are a huge factor to never neglect, so select only the ores that you care for the Â§6ByproductsÂ§r.

Â§bLore:Â§r In GregTech 5u, the HV macerator only gave two slots. Who needed that stone dust anyways?

When your power generation allows for it, Â§3HV machinesÂ§r are well worth using for your on demand processing. The total 4x energy cost compared to Â§7LVÂ§r shouldn't bother you too much.

Â§9Note:Â§r Crafting Hulls in the Â§3AssemblerÂ§r is slightly more efficient. Prioritize it.

Â§oVacuums actually make things hotter... No questions asked.Â§r

The Â§3Vacuum FreezerÂ§r is a multiblock used to cool down Â§eHot IngotsÂ§r. All ingots made in the EBF with a temperature above Â§d1750KÂ§r will need it.

Most of the time, your Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r will be the bottleneck, so you don't need to worry about overclocking your freezer.

Since Â§eHot IngotsÂ§r Â§churt youÂ§r when held, item routing will be very useful. More information on the next quest.

Â§oIs it getting hot in here?Â§r

Â§3Kanthal Heating CoilsÂ§r are the next major step in progression. This increases the temperature of your Â§3Blast FurnaceÂ§r to Â§d2,700KÂ§r, allowing you to process new materials. They may also Â§eaccelerateÂ§r less hot recipes - check the next quest for details.

You will need Â§a128 IngotsÂ§r, which will take easily over an hour. You can move on to other projects while your Â§3EBFÂ§r is hard at work.

An Â§3MV Chemical BathÂ§r is required to cool Â§cHot IngotsÂ§r down. They're Â§chotÂ§r when held, as the name implies. Â§oMaybe you should save your hands and automate this...Â§r

With the construction of a Â§3Kanthal EBFÂ§r, you're now able to make Â§dSilicon IngotsÂ§r!

Â§oLet's get cracking, shall we?Â§r

The Â§3Oil Cracking UnitÂ§r is a multiblock meant to make cracked fluids. It has all the recipes of Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r Cracking, but it is Â§6losslessÂ§r.

A great way to save a lot of Fuel in the long term!

Higher Coil tiers provide small energy discount, up to 70% with the best Coils available.

Â§oTime for a real oil refinery.Â§r

The Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r is a multiblock meant for producing huge amounts of products. In Â§3DistilleriesÂ§r, you had to pick only one product to output. DTs output Â§6all of it at onceÂ§r!

Â§9Note the special placement rules:Â§r Energy, Items, and Fluid Inputs can only be placed on the bottom layer. Maintenance can be placed anywhere. Fluid Outputs can only be placed starting on the second vertical layer, and only allow one per layer as well.

The Â§3DTÂ§r can form at any height from Â§cÂ§c3Â§r to Â§c13Â§r blocks, allowing 2 to 12 Fluid Outputs. Fluid will always output on the layer corresponding to the recipe in Â§2JEIÂ§r.
The Â§3DTÂ§r has one more Â§9specialÂ§r rule. You can deliberately build it too short, and it will Â§cvoidÂ§r whichever Fluid should have been output at the top layers that were removed. Useful in niche situations.

It is a good idea to use Â§3Super TanksÂ§r as the output for every layer.

Â§cNote:Â§r Using the Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r for Oil -> Fuel -> Diesel is Â§cnotÂ§r worth it! You will spend more energy Overclocking the Multiblock, than what the extra outputs will provide. You may instead look at the Â§3Processing ArrayÂ§r (Â§1IVÂ§r) for large scale Diesel production.
It is however Â§6very worthÂ§r for Cracked Fuels and Pyrolyse products.

Â§oDoping is the process of intentionally introducing impurities into semiconductors to change their properties.Â§r

Â§7SiliconÂ§r can be doped with small amounts of Â§ePhosphorusÂ§r to make a better Â§eSilicon BouleÂ§r.

Phosphorus-doped Silicon Boules typically yield Â§68 timesÂ§r more wafers than their non-doped counterparts. However, they are not strictly needed until the Â§5EVÂ§r age, where they will be used in more complex wafers.

Â§9NoteÂ§r: All processing of Phosphorus Boules and Wafers requires a Â§dCleanroomÂ§r!

The next Â§3Circuit AssemblerÂ§r. This tier of Circuit Assembler is only required for one type of Circuit! It is used to make your first ever Â§aMainframeÂ§r.

You can put this off until Â§5EVÂ§r.

The first Â§1IVÂ§r circuit. Congratulations on making it this far!

This will be used in the Â§5EVÂ§r tier.

Â§bLore:Â§r The texture for the Mainframes is taken from an image of an IBM zEnterprise mainframe. https://www.datacenterknowledge.com/archives/2010/07/22/roundup-ibms-new-zenterprise-mainframe
The Â§3HV Assembling MachineÂ§r is the next step in progression, but it also unlocks a handful of useful utilities.

Â§oAlternate components! Smaller, better, cheaper!Â§r

The Â§eSMDÂ§r (surface-mount device) Â§aComponentsÂ§r are required for the next tier of circuits (Â§5NanoÂ§r). They can also be used in place of their non-SMD counterparts in most Circuit recipes.

Of course they are more complicated to make, this is GregTech! What did you expect?

Â§oTrying to match the heat of the Sun huh? But still a long way to go.Â§r

Â§3Nichrome Heating CoilsÂ§r increase the temperature of your Â§3Blast FurnaceÂ§r to Â§d3,600KÂ§r.

Despite not being required Â§oyetÂ§r, it still is a good idea to upgrade your primary Â§3EBFÂ§r for the sweet Â§6Coil bonusesÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r In original GregTech 5, there were only three types of coils. This was the last tier.

Â§oDo you notice a pattern?Â§r

The Â§aLow Power Integrated CircuitÂ§r requires an Â§3HV Cutting MachineÂ§r inside your Â§3CleanroomÂ§r.

Â§3HV Energy HatchesÂ§r will be nice to run your Multiblocks (mainly Electric Blast Furnace and Large Chemical Reactor) off Â§6HVÂ§r directly.

This time around, you won't need to upgrade your EBF with 2 Energy Hatches to progress to Â§5EVÂ§r, phew!

The Â§3HV Chemical ReactorÂ§r unlocks new recipes, for the ever growing demand on more advanced Chemistry!

Â§9Note:Â§r A lot of content is unlocked by the Â§6HVÂ§r Age. However not all of them are useful just yet! It would make HV too dense to include all of them here.
Go check out the Â§5EVÂ§r Chapter for what you have available!

Â§
Â§oThis is what you may know as Teflon!Â§r

Â§aPolytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE)Â§r is a Â§7CarbonÂ§r-Â§bFluorineÂ§r polymer. Similarly to PVC, PTFE can be used to increase the yield of Plastic Circuit Boards and other crafts.
Presently, it is used to make the walls of Â§3Large Chemical ReactorsÂ§r.

Â§3ChlorineÂ§r is required in the process, which is fully recycled if you electrolyze the Â§aHydrochloric AcidÂ§r waste.

You may check the Ore tab to see which ores are valuable for Â§bFluorineÂ§r. Â§bFluorineÂ§r will also be used in Â§aUraniumÂ§r and Â§7NaquadahÂ§r refinement processes.

Â§9Tip:Â§r From this point onwards, I would recommend solidifying Polymers as Â§dBarÂ§r (Ingot) form, as they can easily be shaped to whichever form you will need, using the Â§3ExtruderÂ§r.

The Â§3Large Chemical Reactor (LCR)Â§r is a multiblock Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r with more input/output slots, which can handle more recipes thanks to Teflon.

The Â§3LCRÂ§r can perform some exclusive reactions which allow you to combine multiple normal Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r steps into a Â§6single stepÂ§r. Examples below:
Â§9-Â§r Â§aNitrogen DioxideÂ§r (for Nitric Acid and Dinitrogen Tetroxide)
Â§9-Â§r Â§aSulfuric AcidÂ§r
Â§9-Â§r Â§aPhenolÂ§r
Â§9-Â§r Â§aEpichlorohydrinÂ§r (you need it for EpoxyÂ§r!)
Â§9-Â§r Â§aEpoxyÂ§r


There are also Â§3LCRÂ§r exclusive recipes. For example Â§aRadonÂ§r requires it.

All Â§dOverclocksÂ§r in the Â§3LCRÂ§r are Â§6100% efficientÂ§r; each overclock will Â§5quadruple the speedÂ§r, as opposed to doubling it.


Â§9Tip:Â§r Given the amount of LCRs you may end up using, I would recommend using the Â§dwallsharingÂ§r to its full potential.
You may share one 2A (standard) Â§3Energy HatchÂ§r with 2 LCRs.
You may share Â§3Input/Output HatchesÂ§r, but be careful to not make them run the wrong recipes.
Keep in mind Maintenance is not sharable.


The Â§3LCRÂ§r has yet another Â§6advantageÂ§r. You can use Â§32 Energy HatchesÂ§r to make it run recipe of the Â§5next tierÂ§r, similarly to how you did it with the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r.

Â§oTitanium has the highest corrosion resistance and strength-to-density ratio of any metallic element.Â§r

Â§aTitaniumÂ§r is the main material for Â§5EVÂ§r machines. Be sure you build your closed loop for Rutile and prepare to run a dedicated Â§3EBFÂ§r for hours.

It also is the first material requiring an Â§6HVÂ§r Â§9Vacuum FreezerÂ§r to cool. You won't need to upgrade your freezer's power inputs as often as your EBF, but power requirements will still slowly go up, so keep that in mind.

The Â§5EVÂ§r Age is the end for single block generators! You will need to run several Â§3HV GeneratorsÂ§r! And later upgrade to Multiblock Generators.
While Multiblock generators are much more expensive, they have the ability to be much more energy efficient!

If you've killed a Blaze before, you may have noticed it dropped Â§eSulfur DustÂ§r instead of a Â§cBlaze RodÂ§r.

In order to get Â§6Blaze PowderÂ§r, you must instead combine Â§7Carbon DustÂ§r and Â§eSulfur DustÂ§r in an Â§6HV Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§=.

The Â§3Implosion CompressorÂ§r turns the Dust form of Gems into their Gem form.

It is required to get Â§aEnder PearlsÂ§r.
Â§cTNTÂ§r, Â§cDynamiteÂ§r, Â§cPowderbarrelsÂ§r, or Â§cIndustrial TNTÂ§r can be used for the Implosion.

If you've killed an Enderman before, you may have noticed it dropped Â§aEnderpearl DustÂ§r instead of an Ender Pearl. In order to get Â§aEnder PearlsÂ§r, you must make them from Enderpearl Dust in the Â§3Implosion CompressorÂ§r.

Â§9Pro tip for non-PeacefulÂ§r: Trapping Endermen in Boats makes them much easier to kill! Use a Â§dButchery KnifeÂ§r to kill Endermen for the Looting 3 bonus.

In the long term, Â§aEnderpearl DustsÂ§r should be made in an Â§3HV MixerÂ§r.

This quest serves the purpose of equipping you with the extra stuff you need for running the Â§3Implosion CompressorÂ§r. As such, you can complete it by making Â§cPowderbarrelsÂ§r, Â§cTNTÂ§r, Â§cDynamiteÂ§r, or Â§cIndustrial TNTÂ§r, listed from least to most complex.
The more complex the explosive, the smaller the amount the Â§3Implosion CompressorÂ§r needs per recipe, with Â§cIndustrial TNTÂ§r requiring onlyÂ§9 1Â§r, while Â§cPowderbarrelsÂ§r a whoppingÂ§9 8Â§r!
Below are instructions for making "regular" Â§cÂ§cTNTÂ§r, but you should check out the recipes of the other three before you commit.

Â§cTNTÂ§r (Trinitrotoluene) can't be prepared with the usual Gunpowder and Sand anymore. Instead, make Â§aGelled TolueneÂ§r and react it with Sulfuric Acid to make TNT.

The Â§3HV Chemical ReactorÂ§rÂ§r recipe will double the yield of Â§aGelled TolueneÂ§r, at cost of additional inputs. Not strictly required.

I do not have any strong tips to give you for Â§aTolueneÂ§r. No matter what you do, it will be painful!
Don't miss out on the direct Â§aHeavy FuelÂ§r to Â§aTolueneÂ§r recipe in the single block Â§3DistilleryÂ§r.

Â§aTolueneÂ§r can also optionally be used in the Â§5EVÂ§r Age to make Â§dGasolineÂ§r..

Regardless of whether you're playing on Peaceful or not, you will have to defeat the Â§4Ender DragonÂ§r to return to the Overworld safely.
Prepare yourself with a bow, a few arrows, a blade, and some beds (speedrunner strats!). 
Or abuse Â§7MC-123081Â§r and place an Â§dEnd CrystalÂ§r immediately upon spawning in the End to skip the fight. We won't judge in this tech-focused pack!

Â§9The EndÂ§r has even more new veins and materials to harvest, such as Â§ePlatinumÂ§r and Â§7NaquadahÂ§r! Also, like Nether ores, End ores are Â§6worth two Overworld oresÂ§r.

Â§aEyes of EnderÂ§r are additionally used in crafting certain components, or for creating Â§5Quantum EyesÂ§r.

This quest will print the Â§alocation of the nearest StrongholdÂ§r in chat. Note it, or don't note it and locate the Stronghold the vanilla way...
Â§a4 AmpsÂ§r MV energy transmission may be appealing, but you probably don't need these at this point. The option is there though.

By this point, normal Cables with insulation have a near insignificant loss.

You can use those for good looks!

Superconductors are still required to craft Â§aField GeneratorsÂ§r.

The Â§3Central MonitorÂ§r is an Â§doptionalÂ§r yet extremely charming structure.

It acts as a Â§6display screenÂ§r for machine information, machine GUI, and more!
Using it, you can also Â§9remotely accessÂ§r machines, given the right configuration.

Its mechanics are explained in the Â§4TerminalÂ§r.

Â§oAn alternate Rubber, for use in Cable insulation, Conveyor recipes, and more...Â§r

I can hardly recommend this now, it is a pretty severe Â§dChlorineÂ§r sink.

Collect Â§eanyÂ§r of these forms of Rubber to complete this Quest.

Â§9Note:Â§r Rubber will have to be replaced with either Â§aÂ§aSilicone RubberÂ§r or Â§aStyrene-Butadienne RubberÂ§r for Â§1IVÂ§r Cables.
Both Â§aSilicone RubberÂ§r and Â§aStyrene-Butadienne RubberÂ§r will be required in Â§dLuVÂ§r.

Â§aAmmoniaÂ§r is Â§doptionalÂ§r in the Â§6HVÂ§r Age.

You may use it in the production of:
Â§9-Â§r Nitric Acid, although unrecommended.
Â§9-Â§r Rocket Fuel, required for Nether Stars, in Â§1IVÂ§r Age.
Â§9-Â§r Polybenzimidazole (almost bit my tongue), in Â§1IVÂ§r Age.


The recipe that will give you the least headaches is the one in the Â§3HV Chemical ReactorÂ§r.
Make sure your Â§aHydrogenÂ§r production (mostly from Â§aWater electrolysisÂ§r) is keeping up.

It will also be obtained as a waste product from the Â§dPlatinum Group SludgeÂ§r processing.

Â§oNitric Acid does not eat your skin unlike most acids, but its fumes are extremely toxic! It is also a very potent oxidizer. Extremely dangerous.Â§r

Â§aNitric AcidÂ§r is used in:
Â§9-Â§r Cetane-Boosted Diesel, a better Diesel fuel presented in a next Quest.
Â§9-Â§r Nitrobenzene, a better Gas fuel presented in a next Quest.
Â§9-Â§r The optional gem slurry chains.
Â§9-Â§r The Platinum Group Sludge chain, in Â§1IVÂ§r Age.
Â§9-Â§r Polybenzimidazole (almost bit my tongue), in Â§1IVÂ§r Age.


There are two main ways to make Â§aNitric AcidÂ§r. Â§oThe good way and the bad ways!Â§r

So naturally I will present the best method:
Get a Â§3Large Chemical ReactorÂ§r and use it to make Â§aNitrogen DioxideÂ§r.
From there, react it in a regular Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r with more Â§dOxygenÂ§r and Â§dWaterÂ§r and you got yourself some Â§aNitric AcidÂ§r!

This requires a lot of Â§dOxygenÂ§r. Refer to its own Quest in Â§7LVÂ§r for the most efficient ways to obtain in large amount. Notice that this is Hydrogen free!

How to get Platinum:
Â§9-Â§r From Â§aNickel OreÂ§r byproduct, either Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r of Â§3HV MaceratorÂ§r (be sure to remember to check the ore byproduct JEI page!)
Â§9-Â§r From Â§aSheldonite veinÂ§r in the End
Â§9-Â§r From Â§aPlatinum Group SludgeÂ§r, a complicated chain granting all Platinum Group metals. Highly Â§cunrecommended until IV AgeÂ§r, but eventually required, as with many chains.


Platinum is needed in small amounts for Â§dSMD DiodesÂ§r, and for diverse recipes starting in the Â§5EVÂ§r Age.


Â§bLore:Â§r Mekanism's primary material was planned to be Platinum. However GregoriusT complained about it being such a rare material that would be spread all over the world.

The Â§aPlatinum Group MetalsÂ§r are six rare metals with useful catalytic properties. They are Â§3RutheniumÂ§r, Â§dRhodiumÂ§r, Â§7PalladiumÂ§r, Â§9OsmiumÂ§r, Â§bIridiumÂ§r, and Â§ePlatinumÂ§r.
You will need to Â§4automateÂ§r this entire process, as all these metals are used extensively in the late game.

To begin, treat various PGM-bearing Â§aPurified Crushed OresÂ§r with Â§dNitric AcidÂ§r to produce Â§aPlatinum Group SludgeÂ§r.
Then, centrifuge it with Â§dAqua RegiaÂ§r to produce the various PGM salts.

Â§dChlorineÂ§r is perfectly recycled from the Â§eRaw Platinum PowderÂ§r.
Â§dNitric AcidÂ§r is sort of recycled from Â§7Raw Palladium PowderÂ§r through Â§dAmmoniaÂ§r, though I would recommend to keep that Ammonia for other uses (Rocket Fuel and PBI).

The other PGM salts have their mini-chain associated to them, more or on the next quests.

Â§9Note:Â§r Â§ePlatinumÂ§r and Â§7PalladiumÂ§r can also be obtained from The End or through normal Ore Processing.

Â§bLore:Â§r Have you heard of the infamous "Platline" from either Gregicality of GregTech: New Horizons? The extremely daunting chain was added in GT:NH through Bartworks. The concept is amazing, but we had to tune it down significantly to make the entry point to late game in GTCEu much smoother.

You now have access to two Â§3new Maintenance HatchesÂ§r. Both start with Â§6no Maintenance requiredÂ§r.

The Â§3Automatic Maintenance HatchÂ§r is pretty simple, it eliminates the need for Maintenance, Â§6foreverÂ§r.

The Â§3Configurable Maintenance HatchÂ§r is more interesting. You can configure it to cut off Â§a10% durationÂ§r on recipes, at the cost of making Maintenance happen three times as fast. That is Â§d16 real hoursÂ§r of activity.
Â§9Reminder:Â§r You can put Tape in the maintenance Hatch to automatically fix problems. Â§mBut do not do it, that's very uglyÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r The Automatic Maintenance Hatch texture and mechanic comes from TecTech, an addon mod originally made for GregTech: New Horizons. I will be honest with you: that mod is excessively cool!
More TecTech references coming up, if you stick with us with the late game!

Time to throw away your Â§4Primitive Water PumpsÂ§r.
Place this on the side of a machine to give it Â§616 bucketsÂ§oÂ§rÂ§r of Water every second!

Â§aEnder Fluid Link CoversÂ§r are Â§dGregTechÂ§r's Â§rÂ§3Ender TanksÂ§r. Each Cover sends their fluids through a frequency defined by an Â§68-digit hexadecimal numberÂ§r (0-9, then A-F for each digit). That gives you Â§64.29 billionÂ§r channels to work with! Ender Fluid Link Covers work as long as their chunk is loaded - regardless of distance or dimension.

They don't come cheap though, so consider a way to farm Â§3Ender PearlsÂ§r.

Setting the mode to Import will Â§oÂ§cÂ§opullÂ§r fluids from the world location it is attached to, while Export will Â§oÂ§9Â§opushÂ§r fluids to the world. You must turn the I/O to Enabled for it to start working. Each channel has a buffer of Â§d64 bucketsÂ§r.

The "Virtual Tank Viewer" app in your Â§4TerminalÂ§r allows you to see the contents of all Ender Fluid Link channels. Regardless, I recommend you set up a system to organise all those channels. I would also advise against using the default channel (FFFFFFFF) in all cases.

Â§oAutocrafting at last!Â§r

Â§3Molecular AssemblersÂ§r automate table crafting recipes, which now implies you can automate just about anything.

To maximise the number of recipes a single Molecular Assembler can do, make a 3D matrix of Molecular Assemblers and ME Interfaces - where each component is surrounded on 6 sides by the other.

Using higher-tier materials yields more Molecular Assemblers.

Â§cWarning:Â§r Do not use GT tools in AE2 autocrafting! It does cause quite a few bugs... You may or may not destroy the TPS, or end up having thousands of tools being crafted as soon as one of them breaks.
If you Â§oreallyÂ§r want to use GT tools in AE2 autocrafting, dump some of them with high durability, but do not setup autocrafting for the tools themselves.
Instead, use the alternate Â§3Assembling MachineÂ§r recipes.

Â§oThe Cleanroom is a well isolated space, with little to no airborne particles, bacteria and other contaminants.Â§r

The Â§3CleanroomÂ§r is a hollow multiblock free of contaminants. Going forward, most new Â§acircuit-related recipesÂ§r, as well as some unique things like Â§3Fusion CasingsÂ§r, will need to be run in machines inside a Cleanroom.

Creating it will put a test to your Â§aPolyethyleneÂ§r automation for all the Â§dPlascreteÂ§r and/or Â§dCleanroom GlassÂ§r you will make.


Â§2Â§lThe Structure:Â§r

Be sure to check the Â§9tooltipÂ§r (a lot of information in there!).
The Controller always has to be in the center. The rest of the top layer has to be Â§dFilter CasingsÂ§r.
All edges have to be Â§dPlascreteÂ§r, and the sides can be Â§dCleanroom GlassÂ§r.
Placing Â§3GeneratorsÂ§r or Â§3MufflersÂ§r inside is Â§cnot allowedÂ§r. The Cleanroom will unform.
Do not forget the Â§3Maintenance HatchÂ§r.
If the structure refuses to form, rotate or replace the Controller, it can be a bit finicky.
We will start off with a 5x5x5 Cleanroom, but you should upgrade its size when you start feeling cramped inside. It does not have to be a cube.

Â§2Â§lGetting things in and out:Â§r

Transfer EU using Â§3HullsÂ§r or Â§3DiodesÂ§r.
Item and Fluid transfer can be done using Â§3Passthrough HatchesÂ§r.
Â§3Machine HullsÂ§r count as Â§6ME CablesÂ§r to extend your ME Network inside your Cleanroom.
The Â§dDoor(s)Â§r can remain open (not very realistic, but convenient).

Â§2Â§lThe Mechanics:Â§r

The Cleanroom starts Â§4contaminatedÂ§r. While contaminated, machines will not be able to operate.
The Cleanroom will drain 30EU/t and slowly increase the cleanliness.
Once Â§9CleanÂ§r, recipes can run. At that point it will only draw 4EU/t. Keep it powered at all times or it will get dirty again!
The bigger the Cleanroom, the longer it takes to become Clean.

Â§9NoteÂ§r: When the time comes, Multiblocks must also be put into Cleanrooms in order to run cleanroom recipes! Â§5

Â§9Â§eConfigs:Â§r If you dislike the Cleanroom mechanics, it can be toggled off in the config file with Â§5"B:enableCleanroom"Â§r. Multiblocks can be made to ignore cleanroom requirements with Â§5"B:cleanMultiblocks"Â§r. We encourage you to try it out before deciding.
Â§

Â§bLore:Â§r The Cleanroom comes from GregTech 5. But as with many features, it is more punishing in that version. The recipes would simply run, but had a % chance of completion equal to the cleanliness of the Cleanroom. This caused a lot of accidental voiding! Furthermore, if the Cleanroom had a maintenance issue, the cleanliness would cap out at 90%, which means voiding 10% of items!
GTCEu Cleanroom will Â§6never voidÂ§r recipe outputs.

Â§oThe Â§3Â§oMulti SmelterÂ§oÂ§rÂ§o might be the Â§6Â§omost powerful FurnaceÂ§rÂ§o in modded Minecraft.Â§r

At its lowest power (Cupronickel coils and LV Voltage), it smelts 32 items in just 12 seconds - equivalent to Â§926.7 FurnacesÂ§r, or 3.3 Steam Ovens!

Not to mention, standard Â§aoverclocksÂ§r are in effect.
And more importantly higher tier Â§3CoilsÂ§r increase the amount of items it can smelt in Â§dparallelÂ§r!

The Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r, Â§3Pyrolyse Oven, Â§bÂ§aMulti SmelterÂ§r, and Â§3Cracking UnitÂ§r all require heating Coils. But what are the advantages of using higher tier coils?

The latter three are quite straightforward. Higher tier coils reduce the Â§eprocessing timeÂ§r of the Pyrolyse Oven, reduce the Â§9energy usageÂ§r of the Cracking Unit, and increase the Â§anumber of parallel smeltsÂ§r and reduce the Â§9energy usageÂ§r of the Multi Smelter.

For the EBF, things get slightly more complicated. The EBF smelts items at a certain Â§dtemperatureÂ§r. This is mainly determined by the tier of heating coil used - Â§6Â§rÂ§6CupronickelÂ§r is Â§d1800KÂ§r, Â§bKanthalÂ§r is Â§eÂ§d2700KÂ§r, etc. Additionally, starting from Â§6HVÂ§r, each tier of energy adds Â§d100KÂ§r to the temperature.

Each EBF recipe has a certain base temperature, for example, Â§bAluminiumÂ§r is smelted at Â§d1700KÂ§r. If the EBF temperature is not high enough, the recipe can't be done. If the EBF temperature is high enough, 2 different bonuses are applied:
Â§9-Â§r For every Â§d900KÂ§r above the recipe temperature, the amount of energy required is multiplied by Â§a0.95xÂ§r, which stacks.
Â§9-Â§r For every Â§d1800KÂ§r above the recipe temperature, one additional overclock will be Â§6100% efficientÂ§r; in other words, it will Â§5quadruple the speedÂ§r, instead of doubling it.

Making Â§aNitrobenzeneÂ§r will boost the energy efficiency of Â§aBenzeneÂ§r roughly Â§6fourfoldÂ§r! What a deal, right?

The catch here is that it takes Â§dDistilled WaterÂ§r and consumes a bit of Â§dSulfurÂ§r every step.

Â§oBatteries are cool, but you know what's cooler? Science-fiction Batteries!Â§r

Â§aEnergium CrystalsÂ§r store a significant amount of Â§9EUÂ§r. They are also arguably cheaper!

Â§aCetane-Boosted DieselÂ§r is Â§650% more energy denseÂ§r than regular Â§aDieselÂ§r, and only requires 1 part Â§dTetranitromethane (TNM)Â§r for every 50 parts Â§aDieselÂ§r. What a deal, right?

The catch comes in the complexity of making Â§dTNMÂ§r. In order to make it, you must react Â§aNitric AcidÂ§r with either Â§dEthenoneÂ§r or Â§aMethyl AcetateÂ§r, both of which have quite an involved process themselves.

Â§oThis is a guide on how to automatically route Â§lallÂ§rÂ§o your Hot Ingots to your Vacuum Freezer while keeping everything automated perfectly fine.Â§r

You already know the drill from the Chemical Bath, so let's get right to the chase.


Install an Â§aOre Dictionary FilterÂ§r Cover on the Â§3Input BusÂ§r of your Â§3Vacuum FreezerÂ§r, open it and set to Â§eÂ§lingotHot*Â§r whitelist. The slot is to Â§dtestÂ§r items to make sure you configured the Filter properly in case your forgot. Drag ingots from JEI!

From here, you now have the option to route either with Â§9Item PipesÂ§r or Â§9AE2Â§r.

Â§2With Item PipesÂ§r, connect the output of your Â§3EBF(s)Â§r to the input of your Â§3Vacuum FreezerÂ§r and the output dump (Chest, Crate, or ME Interface).
You can also have a Â§dRestrictive PipeÂ§r in front of the output dump to ensure the Vacuum Freezer will be prioritized.

Â§2With AE2Â§r, place a Â§3ME Storage BusÂ§r on top of your Cover and set to very Â§dhigh priorityÂ§r. Any hot ingots entering your ME system will automatically be moved into the Vacuum Freezer.


Â§lÂ§9Note:Â§r If you wish to know more Ore Dictionaries for more automation setups, they will display if you press Shift when hovering over an item. This is due to an enabled config in JEI Integration.

Â§9Other Note:Â§r The Ore Dictionary Filter partially supports Â§dregexÂ§r, hover over the info icon for more information.

Just like in Â§bMVÂ§r, more higher-tier components.

The painful Â§dFlawless GemsÂ§r have been replaced with painful Â§dEyes of EnderÂ§r.

Notice that the Â§aMotorsÂ§r require Â§d2x Silver CablesÂ§r.
Â§aHullsÂ§r and Â§aMachinesÂ§r use Â§dGold CablesÂ§r.

Â§9Tips:Â§r
Consider using Â§dElectrotine decompositionÂ§r and Â§dOre ProcessingÂ§r for Â§eElectrumÂ§r.
Consider using the Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r with Â§dMercuryÂ§r for Â§eGoldÂ§r, from a wide variety of ores.
This is a much more sane vein to mine to get Aluminium and Titanium over the Overworld Mica vein.

Naquadah from the TV series Stargate! An essential material from LuV Age onwards.

Naquadah can be processed in LuV Age for Titanium, Trinium, Barium, Gallium, Indium, Phosphorus, Enriched Naquadah, and Naquadria. Versatile!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Naquadah - Source of Naquadah, Enriched Naquadah, Naquadria, Trinium, Titanium, Barium, Gallium, Indium, Phosphorus, Plutonium, Radon

Your one and only Tungsten source! (You could technically get Tungstate from macerating End Stone... but the yield is tiny.)

Platinum starts getting used in EV.

The Platinum Group Sludge chain starts being required in IV, and Sheldonite is the best ore for that.

Â§bLore:Â§r The actual name for Sheldonite ore is actually Cooperite. GregoriusT thought it was haha funny to make jokes about Sheldon Cooper, despite Â§lnotÂ§r being the person the ore was named after! And so we kept the haha funny joke going.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§5Player:Â§r Â§oI hate mining!Â§r

Â§5Writer:Â§r Â§oBut I gave you Mining Hammers!Â§r

Â§5Player:Â§r Â§oI hate mining!Â§r

Â§5Writer:Â§r Â§oA solution for you, is the Â§3Â§oMinerÂ§rÂ§o!Â§r

This kind soulÂ§r will mine ores for you when placed above a vein.
Vertical range is unlimited. Horizontal range is written on the tooltip.

The Â§bMVÂ§r variant may not have the range to mine a full vein. However the Â§6HVÂ§r variant does! So you may hold off on it for now. Get Â§eeitherÂ§r to complete this Quest.

You will need Â§9PowerÂ§r. Â§aCharged BatteriesÂ§r may work but they may also run out which is a bit inconvenient.
My top suggestion is to use a filled Â§3DrumÂ§r of some kind of fuel (if you are using Steam, out of luck!) and a Â§3GeneratorÂ§r. Place the Drum above your Generator and right-click it with a Â§5ScrewdriverÂ§r to auto-output into the Generator. Â§oYou had forgotten about that feature didn't you?Â§r


Â§cNote:Â§r Do not forget to Â§dchunkloadÂ§r all 9 chunks of the ore vein with FTB Utilities (open the map in the top left corner, claim the chunks with left-click, and enable force loading with shift-left-click).


Â§9Tip:Â§r You can either a Â§3ME ChestÂ§r or a Â§32x2 DrawerÂ§r as the output inventory to make transporting the ores back home a simple task. The Â§3ME ChestÂ§r can be powered with EU directly.

With LV power, the only way of getting Â§aAluminium DustÂ§r is by electrolyzing Â§9SapphireÂ§r or Â§2Green SapphireÂ§r. Aluminium is the main Â§bMVÂ§r material.

I could advise to get enough Sapphire to electrolyze into one full stack of Â§aAluminium DustÂ§r, that Â§lwillÂ§r be helpful. Plus the bonus Oxygen is always nice.

Â§oRutile, a form of Titanium Dioxide, cannot be electrolyzed directly! What's even better? It has to be obtained from other Ores!Â§r

Titanium requires a slightly more involved process than the previous materials to process. First you need Â§aRutileÂ§r, obtained from Â§aBauxiteÂ§r.
The next steps are described in the next Quest. No need to rush things.

Bauxite is also an Â§6excellent source of AluminiumÂ§r.

Going to Â§dThe EndÂ§r will give you access to a better Bauxite vein, as well as Â§9IlmeniteÂ§r, an even better source of Rutile.


Â§9Tip:Â§r Ore processing for Â§aBauxiteÂ§r is ridiculously good! Doing the Â§3Thermal CentrifugeÂ§r step will easily Â§6tripleÂ§r your Â§aRutileÂ§r yield.
Â§aRandom Access MemoryÂ§r is required for more advanced Electronic Components.

Â§oThe Tablet device you spawned with is very valuable to do plenty of tasks in GregTech.Â§r

This Quest explains how you can use the Â§4TerminalÂ§.. Â§bThis is merely basic information, you can skip this for a while as the Terminal isn't used much in the early gameÂ§r.

The Terminal runs on Â§4GregOSâ¢Â§r (not an actual Trademark), an operating system which works with Â§5ApplicationsÂ§r.


Â§9Machines GuidesÂ§r, Â§9Multiblock GuidesÂ§r, Â§9Item GuidesÂ§r, Â§9Â§9TutorialsÂ§r are what they sound like. Note that they are currently still being worked on.

Â§9Guide EditorÂ§r is used to write Guides! Just as above. The GTCEu wiki has some small instructions for how to write them. If you are feeling like helping us with filling up guides, please go ahead and message us on our Â§8DiscordÂ§r (link is in the Curseforge page) with the work you've put, or contribute to our Â§7GitHubÂ§r.

Â§9System SettingsÂ§r changes... settings (duh) related to the Terminal. You can Â§bset your own background pictureÂ§r, remove the double confirmation on exit, and more. Most of the keybinds apply to the Â§5HomeÂ§r button. Double clicking by default exists any open Application.

Â§9Multiblock HelperÂ§r is split into two functionalities.
A couple devices are required to be mounted, which enable Â§bVR visualizationÂ§r of multiblock structures.
The upgrade unlocked at Â§6HVÂ§r allows you to Â§6debugÂ§r and Â§6auto-buildÂ§r.

Â§9Battery ManagerÂ§r, assuming you have a Battery mounted, checks the Energy level and indicates energy usage of other Apps.

Â§9Hardware ManagerÂ§r is used to mount Hardwares, such as Battery, to enable other Apps.

Â§9App StoreÂ§r (not exactly a Store) adds Apps to your collection, and allows upgrades for some of them. Keep in mind Apps may still require specific mounted devices to function.

Â§9PongÂ§r, Â§9Theseus' EscapeÂ§r, Â§9MinesweeperÂ§r are minigame Apps. Don't forget to play GregTech, too!

Â§9Ore ProspectorÂ§r works the same way as the portable Â§dProspectorÂ§r and can be upgraded several times.

Â§9Fluid ProspectorÂ§r works the same way as the portable Â§dProspectorÂ§r (but for fluids!) and can be upgraded several times.

Â§9Recipe ChartÂ§r is a wonderful chart planner to build Recipe Chains and visualize them.

Â§9GT ConsoleÂ§r configures machines as if you were using regular tools, but without using them! This is similar to the remote access from the Â§3Central MonitorÂ§r.

Â§9World ProspectorÂ§r is a Â§dX-Ray VRÂ§r for filtered blocks.

Â§9Virtual Tank ViewerÂ§r is used in combination with Â§3Ender Fluid CoversÂ§r. It stores information about all your Â§dVirtual TanksÂ§r.

Â§9Cape SelectorÂ§r lets you become fancy! You can have your characters wear a fancy Â§dCapeÂ§r.

Â§9TeleporterÂ§r is what it sounds like. It creates a portal frame to teleport from anywhere to anywhere. This is a lategame toy, though.

Â§oWho likes meteor hunting anyway?Â§r

Making Â§aAE2 PressesÂ§r will unlock all the Â§9ProcessorsÂ§r from AE2. This opens up Â§9ME DrivesÂ§r, Â§9ME Interfaces,Â§r Â§9ME Crafting CPUsÂ§r... almost the rest of AE2!

AE2 Â§9Printed CircuitsÂ§r are made in the Â§3Forming PressÂ§r.

Look in the Â§eÂ§dAE2 quest tabÂ§r for more details on how to use each piece (once it's done).

Explaining Â§2Applied EnergisticsÂ§r mechanics would almost need its own entire Quest Book, which is too much effort for what it's worth.

There are great resources online and excellent video tutorials for all the mechanics in Â§2AE2Â§r, which I invite you to check out.
The Quests focus on on major milestones, and tricks that are not widely known.

Make sure to use Â§aJEIÂ§r for all the expert-style modified recipes, which remain fairly accessible.


Â§9Note:Â§r In this modpack, Channels are Â§4disabledÂ§r.
This means there is no need for a ME Controller or to manage channels in any way whatsoever.


Â§bLore:Â§r This version of AE2 is a fork originally made for Omnifactory. Notice "Unofficial" in the mod name? It comes with a lot of performance improvements and QoL over the original version.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
This prospector has a Â§6higher rangeÂ§r than the Â§7LVÂ§r one. You definitively want this!

Shift right-clicking on it will change the mod to Â§6Fluid ProspectionÂ§r.
This will tell you the base Â§dyieldÂ§r of Fluid veins, along with how full they are.

The Â§dVisualOresÂ§r mod also tracks these fluid veins. Hit the toggle in the bottom left of the fullscreen map to see what veins you've found!

Â§9Reminder:Â§r The yield of Â§3Fluid Drilling RigsÂ§r is proportional to the fullness of the vein. When low enough, it defaults to yield defined in the json file.

Â§9Tip:Â§r When the fullness drops below 30% (rough estimation), you can consider moving to another vein for the sake of power to yield efficiency. Aiming for the Â§3Advanced Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r in Â§5EVÂ§r will be a nice goal, as not only it boosts the output significantly, but it also reduces the drain rate.
Â§oYou know the drill.Â§r

The Best Battery-like item, for Â§5EVÂ§r!

The Â§aLapotron CrystalÂ§r requires quite a bit of nested crafting, so craft it in bulks or automate it with AE2 patterns.

Â§bMVÂ§r Batteries will be convenient to buffer Energy, just like it was useful for Â§7LVÂ§r.

The cost in Â§aSodiumÂ§r or Â§aLithiumÂ§r bumps to 8 dusts, so you may use whatever you have the most of.
The difference in storage is not that huge after all...

Get Â§eeitherÂ§r Battery to complete the Quest.

Â§o250 Million EU in a Battery, 25Min of Power when drained constantly!? That's amazing!Â§r

The Â§aLapotronic Energy OrbÂ§r should be the beginning of the end of your energy storage struggles.
This Energy Storage is perfectly suited if your Power Generation is inconsistent, or if you need to buffer large amounts due to the nature of Â§3Large TurbinesÂ§r.

It does not come quite cheap though. The Â§dEngraved Lapotron Crystal ChipsÂ§r are worth Â§a8 Lapotron CrystalsÂ§r.

Â§oTungsten in Swedish is translated directly into "Heavy Stone"... which is quite silly. You may know of this element as Wolfram too, hence the W as the formula.Â§r

Â§aTungstenÂ§r will be the main Â§1IVÂ§r Cable material, but will also be used on some other ways!

The main Â§1IVÂ§r Material! Â§9

Â§aTungstensteelÂ§r will be the new Â§dSteelÂ§r, and is composed half of Steel... suffice to say you will need a lots of both Â§aIronÂ§r and Â§aTungstenÂ§r!

Presently, you will need it for Â§3Energy & Dynamo HatchesÂ§r... one step closer to move away from pesky single block Generators...

Boosting the smelting recipe in the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r will require Â§eHeliumÂ§r.
You can get an initial supply from Â§aextracting MonaziteÂ§r or Â§acentrifuging EndstoneÂ§r.
In the long term, you will want Â§aLiquid Air DistillationÂ§r.

Â§9Note:Â§r If you haven't found a Jungle yet, you can Â§acentrifuge Stone DustÂ§r for Â§dMetal Mixture DustÂ§r which doubles as a Brown Dye.

The Â§3Large Combustion EngineÂ§r is a multiblock able to burn Â§dCombustion FuelsÂ§r for even more Power Generation!

Its default production outputs 2048 EU/t, which is simply the same as 4 Â§3Turbo Combustion GeneratorsÂ§r.

Where it shines is the ability to Â§6boostÂ§r it with Â§aOxygenÂ§r.
This will double the fuel consumption, but Â§9triple the power generationÂ§r for 6144 EU/t!
This results in Â§6150% Fuel efficiencyÂ§r.

It also requires a small amount of Â§aLubricantÂ§r, nothing too crazy.

The Â§3LCEÂ§r is also void-free, unlike Large Turbines. Any energy that cannot be output will momentarily pause the multiblock.


Â§9Note:Â§r This Quest requires Â§eanyÂ§r task to be completed, but you should still need all the parts.
To harness the 6144 EU/t Power output, you will need a Â§34A EV Dynamo HatchÂ§r, or an Â§3IV Dynamo HatchÂ§r.

Â§oAgain, this was quite a journey to get here. Consider yourself deeply rooted in EV Age once you reach this point.Â§r

The Â§3EV Circuit AssemblingÂ§r enables the next tier of Circuits, Â§5NanoÂ§r.

Â§oThe Processing Array does nothing... except that it does a lot!Â§r

The Â§3Processing ArrayÂ§r is a power Â§6automation toolÂ§r.
It combines several single block machines into one single multiblock.
Place up to Â§d16Â§r Machines into the Â§3Machine Access InterfaceÂ§r.

The Â§3PAÂ§r will now Â§asimulateÂ§r all the machines you put inside, as if they were running at the same time.
This means recipes can now be performed up to Â§d16Â§r at a time, this is called Â§4parallelÂ§r.

Power cost is based on the current recipe being run, times the number of Â§4parallelÂ§r being performed.
As an Â§9exampleÂ§r, Â§316 LV DistilleriesÂ§r will require an Â§3HV Energy HatchÂ§r in order to run effectively.


Â§eWhere or why is the Processing Array useful?Â§r
Â§9-Â§r Â§4Parallelization is superiorÂ§r to overclocking. Use it for passive setups such as Ore Processing or Oil Distilling.
Â§9-Â§r Â§6Distinct busesÂ§r: a Â§3PAÂ§r can accept up to 10 Â§3Input BusesÂ§r. Use it for your pattern automation with Â§3ExtruderÂ§r, Â§3EngraverÂ§r, and many other.


Â§9Note:Â§r With Â§2Gregicality MultiblocksÂ§r installed, the Â§3PAÂ§r can be fully replaced with all the specialized Multiblocks instead. That's for you if you hate 3x3 blue cubes, or if you hate crafting numerous low tier machines.


Â§bLore:Â§r In GregTech 5, the Data Orb was used to Matter Replicator to store data of the material you wanted to replicate. There is no replication here, the Orb is just a crafting component.
Additionally GregTech 5's PA and other Multiblocks acted as a Cleanroom. There is no such thing here. You will need to place Multiblocks in the Cleanroom.

The Â§3Large Gas TurbineÂ§r may not be so impressive in the Â§5EVÂ§r Age, but it has the ability to scale really well, to Â§9better productionÂ§r than the base 4096 EU/t, and Â§9greater efficiencyÂ§r.

Each Large Turbine will require a Â§aTurbine RotorÂ§r and a Â§3Rotor HolderÂ§r. More on the Turbine mechanics in the Â§lnextÂ§r Quest.

Â§9Note:Â§r This Quest Â§eonlyÂ§r requires the Controller, but you still need all the multiblock parts.

If a multiblock is formed, but you are having troubles figuring out why it does not run:
Â§9-Â§r Check if the Multiblock is properly plugged in (we all make these mistakes!).

Â§oThis quest will cover all the units you will encounter in GregTech.Â§r

- Â§dFluidsÂ§r are measured in millibuckets, or mB. 1 mB is equivalent to 1 L (Litre), which is sometimes used.
One nugget or tiny dust of material is 16 mB, one ingot is 144 mB, one gem is 250 mB, one bucket is 1000 mB, and one block is 1296 mB. 

- Â§dTimeÂ§r is measured in ticks, or t, each of which is 1/20 of an in-game second.
Very occasionally hours (h) will be used, which is 3600 seconds, or 72k ticks.

- Â§dEnergyÂ§r is measured in Energy Units, or EU. 1 EU is equivalent to 4 RF or 2 mB of Steam. Energy is transferred in Â§dPacketsÂ§r, or p.

- Â§dPowerÂ§r is measured in EU per tick (EU/t). Â§dVoltageÂ§r is measured in volts (V), which are EU/p. Â§dAmperageÂ§r is measured in amperes (A), which are p/t.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: Before EU and RF, there were Minecraft Joules (MJ), the native energy system for BuildCraft. When EU was introduced, it was calculated that 2.5 EU = 1 MJ based on how much energy their coal generators made. Then when RF was introduced with Thermal Expansion 3, it was defined that 10 RF = 1 MJ. Therefore 1 EU = 4 RF by default.

You surely have realised by now the Energy system in Â§2GregTechÂ§r is Â§cnot as simpleÂ§r as the Â§1RFÂ§r you may be used to using in modded Minecraft!
Â§1EUÂ§r mechanics have a depth to them and are not dissimilar to real electricity. It can also be Â§4dangerousÂ§r if mishandled. But it also gives a lot of Â§6satisfactionÂ§r, if harnessed well.

This Quest tackles the Â§9AmperageÂ§r mechanics. As for the Â§dVoltageÂ§r mechanics, that will be explained once you reach Â§bMVÂ§r.

Each single-block Generator in GregTech is configured to produce Â§91 AmpÂ§r for its voltage tier. For Â§7LVÂ§r, that results in Â§232EU/tÂ§r.
If a machine requires 16EU/t, one packet of 32EU is sent every other tick (assuming no cable loss).

A Battery Buffer with Â§94Â§r Batteries can produce up to Â§94 AmpsÂ§r, for Â§2128EU/tÂ§r as Â§7LVÂ§r, which is important for the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r, or to run multiple machines simultaneously.
Generic machines are configured to draw up to Â§92 AmpsÂ§r when less than Â§950%Â§r full to account for cable loss, but otherwise draw Â§91 AmpÂ§r. Other machines have specific Â§9Amps INÂ§r, described in the tooltip.

Â§aCablesÂ§r have an Â§9Amperage Â§climitÂ§r. Attempting to transport more Amps than the limit will Â§4burnÂ§r them.

Â§9AmpsÂ§r are drawn Â§oonlyÂ§r through the Â§aCablesÂ§r connecting the Producers and Consumers directly, and Â§oonlyÂ§r if the Consumers are active.
This means you can safely step down your Cable Amperage in certain places, feel free to experiment!

Â§bLore:Â§r GregTech 5's Â§3Fusion ReactorÂ§r stores EU you feed it internally. The maximum amount is determined by the amount of Â§3Energy HatchesÂ§r.
Recipes can only start if the Â§9EU to startÂ§r is stored internally, which is Â§cconsumedÂ§r. Then, the reactor can keep running recipes until it goes idle. At this point it will need the EU to start again.
Shadow of Greg's Â§3Fusion ReactorÂ§r (which is now GTCEu's Fusion Reactor) has an added mechanic called Â§4HeatÂ§r.
When the reactor runs, the Â§9EU to startÂ§r is converted to Â§4HeatÂ§r. That Heat is preserved until the Reactor goes idle, at which point it will slowly go down.
Next time a recipe is found, it will use all possible Heat and deduct it from the Â§9EU to startÂ§r, allowing you to save Energy for short pauses.

The Â§3Fusion Reactor IÂ§r can only run recipes up to 160MEU required EU to start. The maximum voltage tier this reactor can run recipes at is Â§dLuVÂ§r. It will also only overclock up to Â§dLuVÂ§r at best, even if you upgrade to ZPM Hatches, no need to attempt it.

The Â§aFusion Reactor Mk2Â§r is even more expensive than the Mk1! The key difference is that it has a higher Â§6Energy To StartÂ§r than the Mk1, allowing you to run new recipes.

It can also overclock lower voltage recipes, such as those in the Mk1 reactor.

Â§6Fusion Reactor OverclockingÂ§r works a bit differently compared to most machines. Instead of the traditional 4x power and 2x speed boost, the Fusion Reactor only does Â§a2x power for a 2x speed boostÂ§r. You may be thinking this is the same as the LCR's perfect overclocking, but it's not. 
Remember how machines get one overclock for each voltage tier past the recipe's required tier? This means your Â§cZPMÂ§r Fusion Reactor Mk2 will still only overclock Â§etwiceÂ§r with an Â§9IVÂ§r recipe, meaning a total of 4x the power consumption for a 4x speed boost.

Â§oI want my particle acceleratorÂ§r

Â§aDarmstadtiumÂ§r is the main material for Â§3UVÂ§r hulls. It is yet again made with Fusion.

Â§bFun FactÂ§r: Arsenic does not exist as a liquid at standard conditions. It sublimates directly into a gas!

Â§oFusion, but the most expensive!Â§r

Build the structure taking Fusion Glass in Â§aJEIÂ§r.
To save on Fusion Casings, fit Input & Output Hatches wherever you can (as displayed in the structure).

The Â§aFusion Reactor Mk3Â§r is even more expensive than the Mk2! The key difference is that it has a higher Â§6Energy To StartÂ§r than the Mk2, allowing you to run new recipes.

It can also overclock lower voltage recipes, such as those in the Mk1 or Mk2 reactor. See the Mk2's quest for how these mechanics work.

Â§oPure NeutronsÂ§r

Â§aNeutroniumÂ§r is made entirely from Neutrons, and is found in the center of Neutron Stars. It is the final primary material in GTCEu.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GCYL, Neutronium is unlocked at UMV-tier (called UXV in CEu). There is also Cosmic Neutronium, which is equivalent to Avaritia's Neutronium in GT5u, which was unlocked even later in GCYL!

Â§oConsider touching some grass.Â§r

The amount of EU stored is the max value of a Long Integer in Java.
Don't try to win Minecraft, you can't.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: You're probably tired of this by now, but things are different with the battery lore this time. I promise. GTCEu's ultimate battery uses 16 UV orbs. GTNH's only uses 8. However, GTNH also has a Â§lReally Ultimate BatteryÂ§r made of 8 Ultimate Batteries! It's not useful at all, but still exists... They recently added an Â§lExtremely Ultimate BatteryÂ§r made of 8 Really Ultimate Batteries, which is ludicrously expensive.

A goal if you like memes.
It takes almost real 10 days in an UV machine.
If you overclock a Gregicality Multiblock to UEV (4A UHV hatch), it will still take 2.5 days!

Â§bLore:Â§r The NAN Certificate comes from Crops++, a GT5u addon that adds a wide variety of IC2 crops.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Certificate of Not Being a Noob Anymore

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Â§aPortable ScannerÂ§r, or Â§aTricorderÂ§r, is GTCEu's debug tool.
It shows you a block's details, the details of the energy network, its current status and contents, and its impact on performance.

Using this anywhere will also display a percentage of fluid remaining in the fluid vein, for the Â§3Fluid RigsÂ§r.

Â§oTo use if you are curious!Â§r


Â§bLore:Â§r This little useful device comes from GregTech 5. It was extremely useful in the early days, because very little information was given by GUIs or Waila.

Â§oIf you're still running off Steam, here is a solution for you! But if I wanted to be honest... Steam as a power option really isn't worth it at this point anymore. Stay tuned for when/if we rework it.Â§r

The Â§3Large Steam TurbineÂ§r is a multiblock Steam Turbine for Â§6HVÂ§r power. It is a quite expensive multiblock to generate 1024 EU/t, but it also the ability to scale to Â§9higher Power Production and higher EfficiencyÂ§r.

The Turbine will output Â§dDistilled WaterÂ§r given an Â§3Output HatchÂ§r, so you can loop it back to your Â§3Large BoilersÂ§r.
Not completely recommend, as your Boilers will end up exploding if the system fails...

Each Large Turbine will require a Â§aTurbine RotorÂ§r and a Â§3Rotor HolderÂ§r. More on the Turbine mechanics in the Â§lnextÂ§r Quest.

Â§9Note:Â§r This Quest Â§eonlyÂ§r requires the Controller, but you still need all the multiblock parts.
Turbines Â§cvoidÂ§r energy that they can not output. If you plan on using this with HV power, use a Rotor with close to 100% Power stat.

Â§oThe Large Turbines are the most complex Multiblock Generators there exists in GTCEu in the present day.Â§r

Let's start with the Â§4drawbacksÂ§r of Â§3Large TurbinesÂ§r:
Â§9-Â§r They work off Â§eInertiaÂ§r, which requires continuous running to achieve maximum Power.
Â§9-Â§r Any excess unconsumed Energy produced will be Â§cvoidedÂ§r. You Â§lwillÂ§r want to use large Energy Buffers, and an Â§3Advanced Energy DetectorÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r They require a Â§aRotorÂ§r which loses durability over time and eventually Â§cbreakÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r A little bit of Math is required to get the expected results.


Now, with the Â§6upsidesÂ§r:
Â§9-Â§r They can scale Â§9PowerÂ§r production substantially higher than the base output thanks to tiered Â§3Rotor HoldersÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r The Â§aRotorÂ§r can give a huge boost to Â§dFuel efficiencyÂ§r, and Â§9PowerÂ§r production.
Â§9-Â§r Self satisfaction for setting them up properly (yay!).


Â§3Rotor HoldersÂ§r above the tier of the Â§3Large TurbineÂ§r will Â§6doubleÂ§r the production for every tier, multiplicatively.
Â§3Rotor HoldersÂ§r above the tier of the Â§3Large TurbineÂ§r will increase the efficiency by 10% for every tier, additively.

Â§aRotorsÂ§r have a Â§9PowerÂ§r, Â§dEfficiencyÂ§r and Â§4DurabilityÂ§r that are based on tool stats.
Â§9PowerÂ§r multiplies the production of the Â§3TurbineÂ§r. This stacks multiplicatively with the Â§3Rotor HolderÂ§r.
Â§dEfficiencyÂ§r reduces the fuel consumption. This stacks multiplicatively with the Â§3Rotor HolderÂ§r.
Â§4DurabilityÂ§r is the lifetime of the Â§aRotorÂ§r in seconds, when the Â§3TurbineÂ§rÂ§r is active.


Â§2Â§lIn summary:Â§r

The Â§9PowerÂ§r output affects both the fuel consumption and the EU/t generation. It is calculated with the following formula:
Â§eproduction = baseEUt * rotorPower * 2^(rotorHolderTier - turbineTier)Â§r

The Â§dEfficiencyÂ§r reduces the fuel consumption, but does not alter the EU/t generation. It is calculated with the following formula:
Â§eefficiency = rotorEfficiency * (1 + 0.1 * (rotorHolderTier - turbineTier))Â§r


Â§2Â§lSome examples:Â§r

Large Steam Turbine, with Ultimet Rotor and EV Rotor Holder:
Production = 1024 * 1.60 * 2 = 3276 EU/t
Efficiency = 1.30 * 1.10 = 143%
(Steam consumption = 4582 L/t, this is above a Titanium Boiler, or a TungstenSteel Boiler with ~70% throttle)

Large Gas Turbine, with Chrome Rotor and EV Rotor Holder:
Production = 4096 * 1.70 * 1 = 5325 EU/t
Efficiency = 1.55 * 1.00 = 155%
(The same fuel consumption would produce 3435 EU/t using 6.7 Turbo Gas Turbines)

Large Plasma Turbine, with HSS-S Rotor and ZPM Rotor Holder:
Production = 16834 * 2.50 * 4 = 168340 EU/t
Efficiency = 1.80 * 1.20 = 216%
(This is more than a ZPM Amp!)

Â§bDigital fluid storageÂ§r is pretty cool. Each Â§b1k ME Fluid Storage CellÂ§r holds up to Â§d5 typesÂ§r of fluid, and can hold Â§6over 8,000 bucketsÂ§r of those 5 fluid types! That's more than a Â§3Super Tank 2Â§r!

Higher tier Â§aFluid Storage CellsÂ§r hold even more fluid, but are only available quite a bit later.

You may want to Â§4formatÂ§r Fluid Storage Cells to certain types, to prevent the network from clogging. Make a Â§3Cell WorkbenchÂ§r to do so.

Â§4BewareÂ§r! Â§aFluid Storage ComponentsÂ§r require EV circuits, that means you need a Â§3CleanroomÂ§r!

A completely Â§doptionalÂ§r Multiblock (Â§oin playtesting, I kept using HV singleblock miners and was content with themÂ§r).

The Â§3Larger MinerÂ§r is ridiculously good to collect ores from veins!

Ores are mined as if they were Â§amaceratedÂ§r, but they yield Â§6three timesÂ§r as many Â§dCrushed oresÂ§r.

You will need Â§aDrilling FluidÂ§r automation to run this.

You might also want to use a Â§3Quantum TunnelÂ§r from AE2 and Â§3GTEU P2P TunnelsÂ§r to transfer the items and to power it up.


Â§bLore:Â§r There were some interesting side effects from porting this over from Gregicality, as the multiblock originated from GregTech 5... It's not perfect, as there isn't really any advantage on upgrading this miner to the advanced versions. We were thinking of rebalancing the energy costs and yield per tier, so there may be rework for this miner at some point!

The ore generation in Â§2GregTechÂ§r is very different to vanilla or normal modded Minecraft. All ores generate in Â§6huge veinsÂ§r which can contain Â§dthousandsÂ§oÂ§r of ore blocks!

The full extent of ore generation is explained in the Tips and Tricks tab, but here is what you need to know:

Â§9-Â§r Ore veins generate in a Â§4GridÂ§r. Every vein is Â§9spaced by 3 chunksÂ§r from one to another in a cardinal direction. We have added Â§2In Game InfoÂ§r to display if you are located in an Ore vein in the top-left corner of your screen, as seen in GregTech: New Horizons.

Â§9-Â§r Â§dSurface RocksÂ§r indicate a nearby type of vein. Pick one up and check Â§cÂ§rÂ§5JEIÂ§r (press U) to see the types of ores beneath it.

Â§9-Â§r It's a good practice to make Â§dWaypointsÂ§r (default Â§4BÂ§r, keybind conflicts with Baubles) to every vein you find, and to label their type. You may want to come back to it several times.

Â§oLiquids, Gases... It's all the same here.Â§r

Â§3Fluid PipesÂ§r will transport Steam between machines for you.

Each Pipe has a certain Â§dthroughputÂ§r in L/t (mB/t), and a Temperature Limit (this is only relevant right now for Steam, as it will burn Wooden Pipes). Some pipes have other attributes you don't need to worry about for now.

Each material has several Â§dsizesÂ§r for Pipes. The bigger the Pipe, the higher the throughput.

For example, a normal Bronze Fluid Pipe transfers 120 L/t. It also has a 1,200 L internal buffer.

Â§9Reminder:Â§r 1 second = 20 ticks. Assuming the server does not lag.


Get Â§eeitherÂ§r a Small, or Normal Bronze Fluid Pipe to complete this quest. Both are used in crafting.

Â§9Note:Â§r GT6-style Pipes are Â§denabledÂ§r. It means that placing Pipes connect them only to the block they were placed against. To open more connections, use your Â§5WrenchÂ§r on the grid.
You can also shift-right click with your Â§5WrenchÂ§r to disable input from a side. This can help counteract sloshing.

The Â§9Digital Interface Cover (DIC)Â§r is a visual Cover. It can show useful things like the status and progress of Machines, or the amount of fluids stored in a Super Tank.

It can be upgraded to a Â§dWireless Â§9Digital Interface CoverÂ§r in order to link the Cover and machine to the Â§3Central MonitorÂ§r.

The full extent of the Â§9DICÂ§r's capabilities are listed in the GTCEu Wiki and the Â§4TerminalÂ§r.

Higher-tier Generators will increase their fuel consumption proportionally to their Generation rate, keeping the duration of fuels and the specific amount of energy from fuels the same. The Â§3Advanced Steam TurbineÂ§r will use Â§d5,120 mB SteamÂ§r per second, equivalent to Â§d256 mB/tÂ§r.

Get Â§eanyÂ§r of the generators to complete this quest, but you may prefer starting off with the Â§3Advanced Steam TurbineÂ§r.

There are a few new power options available for the Â§9Â§bMVÂ§r age. Selecting the Generators and pressing Â§4UÂ§r will let you see which fuels count as Â§aCombustionÂ§r or Â§aGasÂ§r.
Quests in the top left corner of this Chapter are for the valuable Power options.

If you stick to Â§9SteamÂ§r Power generation, you will probably need a Â§3Large BoilerÂ§r.

Â§oA higher-tech backpack! Also seriously undervalued.Â§r

The Â§9Portable CellÂ§r can hold items for you! It holds up to Â§a27Â§r types of items.

What's more, it acts just like a regular AE2 Storage Cell. Once you get an ME System running, you can simply drop it into an Â§aME DriveÂ§r or Â§bÂ§aME IO PortÂ§r for convenience.

The Portable Cell's energy only drains when it's open. With Â§6167 minutesÂ§r of juice stored in it thanks to changed config, you shouldn't worry about it running out of energy.
Regardless, you will be able to Â§dchargeÂ§r it in Â§7LVÂ§r Age in Â§3machine Charger slotsÂ§r, Â§3Turbo ChargersÂ§r or Â§3Battery BuffersÂ§r.

Â§
Â§cWarningÂ§r: Attempting to store items with very large NBT Tags may result in them getting Â§cstuckÂ§r. So far it seems that the Building Gadgets, Terminal and Clipboards are Â§lsafeÂ§r, but we never know what could happen.
If something gets stuck, build a simple AE2 Network with just an Energy Acceptor, an IO Port and a Storage Bus on a chest. Then place your Portable Cell inside the IO Port. This will spit out items into the chest.
Â§8ULVÂ§r Circuits are used in some AE2 recipes, such as the Â§aAnnihilation CoreÂ§r and Â§aFormation CoreÂ§r.

Â§oPut your micro-crafting talent to the task. Don't worry, you are not wasting anything crafting this, and they are gonna be required very soon.Â§r

In general, it is worth Â§9bulk-craftingÂ§r more than you need, so you will have the intermediates ready for more crafts.

I will give you a nice Â§6RewardÂ§r for achieving this task.

Â§dBone MealÂ§r can be used on Sugar Canes thanks to Random Tweaks.

Â§oSadly, offering a questbook refresh as quest reward crashes on dedicated servers... so read this through.Â§r

Whenever you Â§dupdate the modpackÂ§r, run the Command Â§9Â§l/bq_admin default loadÂ§r.
This quest Â§cdoes Â§cnot run itÂ§r, you have to type it yourself.

Be sure to Â§4not forgetÂ§r it, as there are frequent changes to the Questbook.

Â§oYes, I repeated myself several times, I know. But that way you won't forget... right? *pleading_face*Â§r

Â§oThe name of the quest implies nothing dangerous with bathing and electricity... (it does)Â§r

The Â§3HV Chemical BathÂ§r is used to Â§ddye LensesÂ§r using Â§aChemical DyeÂ§r.
This will let you engrave more types of Wafers!

This is also required for Â§aEyes of EnderÂ§r.

If you're still running off the Â§3Large Bronze BoilerÂ§r, you may want to upgrade to the Â§3Large Steel BoilerÂ§r.

It is slightly more efficient than the Â§3LBBÂ§r, and produces Â§d900 EU/t worth of SteamÂ§r.

Other Power options are more advisable at this point, though.

Â§oIn this lightweight modpack, we essentially included enough QoL to fit your needs, and it is perfectly playable as is. But maybe you require more?Â§r

If you're playing singleplayer, feel free to add mods to your instance. For more QoL, more Tech, maybe Magic...?
Just be sure to not add anything that breaks progression... promise?


Since we're part of the Â§2GregTech: CEuÂ§r community, I will plug some of the Â§9addonsÂ§r here that you can safely add to your instance (running list):

Â§9-Â§r Â§dGregTech Food OptionÂ§r Â§6(released)Â§r adds various food chains and machines, to make... food! Making Bread won't be too easy, and will require some lovely automation. A nice alternate challenge.

Â§oPlacing Blocks manually for Multiblocks is tedious? We got something for ya!Â§r

The Â§dMulitblock ToolÂ§rwill enable you to Â§6auto-buildÂ§r Multiblocks!

Â§9How to auto-build:Â§r With your Â§4Multiblock ToolÂ§r in hand, shift-right-click the Mulitblock Controller that you placed in World, and the structure will be built according to the blocks in your inventory.

Note that the Hatches may not always end up being on the positions you wanted, but at least it placed all the other Blocks for you!

You can also use this tool to Â§6debug structure issuesÂ§r. If you're not sure why a multi won't form, right-click it with the tool and you'll recieve some potentially useful information.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: The texture for this item was originally from the GCYL Freedom Wrench.

Regular Â§oÂ§dGregTechÂ§r Fluid Pipes can only transport one fluid type at a time. But don't cave and install EnderIO yet!

Â§3Quadruple Fluid PipesÂ§r can transfer four different types of fluids. Â§3Nonuple Fluid PipesÂ§r can transfer nine different types! Useful for compact setups.

Â§3Nonuple Fluid PipesÂ§r will be useful in Â§5EVÂ§r Age for handling the many Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r outputs.

Get Â§eeitherÂ§r to finish this quest.

Â§oIV Age is truly the Age of automation, and finally this should be worth to automate all the ores... if you wish, that is.Â§r

What you will Â§4Â§lneedÂ§r to automate Â§6Ore ProcessingÂ§r on a large scale:
Â§9-Â§r One or few Â§3IV MaceratorsÂ§r (or higher tier).
Â§9-Â§r A few Â§3Processing ArraysÂ§r (PA), to place your low tier machines inside, Â§eorÂ§r use the Â§2Gregicality MultiblocksÂ§r variants.
Â§9-Â§r 16 LV Â§3Thermal CentrifugesÂ§r in a PA (upgradable to 64 with the Advanced PA).
Â§9-Â§r One or a few MV Â§3ElectrolyzersÂ§r, possibly in a PA.
Â§9-Â§r A Â§3Multi SmelterÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r A Â§3PackagerÂ§r of any tier.
Â§9-Â§r Inventories acting as a large buffer, such as Â§3TungstenSteel CratesÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§3ME Storage BusesÂ§r or a lot of Â§3Item PipesÂ§r + Â§aFiltersÂ§r covers, Â§aOreDict FiltersÂ§r and possibly Â§aSmart FilterÂ§r.

What you may Â§eoptionallyÂ§r add:
Â§
Â§9-Â§r A few LV Â§3Ore WashersÂ§r for quick washing purposes.
Â§9-Â§r Up to 16 LV Â§3Ore WashersÂ§r in a PA, accompanied with a set of Â§3DistilleriesÂ§r for Â§dDistilled WaterÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Up to 16 LV Â§3CentrifugesÂ§r in a PA, for impure/purified dusts.
Â§9-Â§r Â§3Â§3Chemical BathsÂ§r for the special Byproducts using Â§dMercuryÂ§r or Â§dSodium PersulfateÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§3SiftersÂ§r of any tier (higher tier = better chanced output), for gem ores.
Â§9-Â§r Â§3Electromagnetic SeparatorsÂ§r.


To answer questions:

Â§d-Â§r Why Â§7LVÂ§r Machines? Overclocking is not energy efficient, which is why it is generally better to go for low tier machines in passive setups. One could also argue they are cheaper.
Â§3Processing ArraysÂ§r make up for the sheer amount of machines you are making. If you wish, you can still use higher tier machines, but the power draw will be bigger.
If you have Â§2Gregicality MultiblocksÂ§r, just use those instead.

Â§d-Â§r Optional things? Yes. Obtaining most Byproducts or getting better yields are completely up to you.
Â§3Thermal CentrifugesÂ§r are close to mandatory, as they unlock a Â§6unique ByproductÂ§r from the maceration step.

Â§d-Â§r What ores should I prioritise? There are crucial ores and Byproducts to not miss out.
Chalcopyrite, Chalcocite, Bornite, Tetrahedrite, Pentlandite and Sheldonite ores should all be turned into Â§dPurified CrushedÂ§r and sent to the Â§6Platinum Group MetalÂ§r chain.
Purified Crushed Galena and Sphalerite may be reserved for Indium, until you have the Naquadah chain.
Â§aGalliumÂ§r, Â§aChromeÂ§r, Â§aNiobiumÂ§r, Â§aRare EarthsÂ§r, Â§aGlowstoneÂ§r are Â§6ByproductsÂ§r you want to prioritise (Â§oif I am missing any, hit us up on Discord and I may add it!Â§r).

Â§d-Â§r Storage Buses? As you may know, automating with AE2 is very powerful.
Â§3ME Storage BusesÂ§r can route items effortlessly. They also have a huge whitelist or blacklist configuration. Put them on the Â§3TungstenSteel CratesÂ§r, to buffer the items... or use a dedicated AE2 network, you choose.


More things to note:
The Â§aSmart FilterÂ§rÂ§r can be used for Electrolyzable items (refer back to the "200 IQ Quest" with the Smart Filter), but you may prefer setting up filter Â§emanuallyÂ§r for that.
The Â§aSmart FilterÂ§r can also be used to be configured to filter Â§dsiftable Purified Crushed OresÂ§r.
For ores that you want to process but don't want the Byproducts as it would take too long in the machines, prioritize filtering them for quick washing.
The typically "best" path is: Macerator -> Ore Washing -> Thermal Centrifuge -> Macerator. If you deviate from it for various reasons, you will have to set filters Â§emanuallyÂ§r.

Perhaps you never noticed the Â§9"chance per tier"Â§r when hovering over the bonus outputs in Â§2JEIÂ§r?
Each overclock above the required tier will add that bonus to the chanced output!

This means the Â§3EV MaceratorÂ§r yields Â§6more ByproductsÂ§r!

You might ask: is it time to setup ore processing on large scale perhaps...? Nope!
Well... Running all the ores with a maceration step into this EV Macerator is fair.
But I would still recommend cherry-picking whatever ores you want byproducts of.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Shredding your Ores with more Byproducts

betterquesting:10.desc:8: ZPM Circuits that aren't mainframes!
Cheaper Â§dLuVÂ§r circuits! This will make those Robot Arms much cheaper.

The first circuit of the Â§9CrystalÂ§r line.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: The concept of a Crystal Circuit has existed since very early versions of GregTech. However, no one knows what their real life counterpart is!

The third circuit of the Â§4wetwareÂ§r line.

This is also the best Â§3UVÂ§r circuit!

The second circuit of the Â§4wetwareÂ§r line.

This is also the best Â§cZPMÂ§r circuit!

The first Circuit of the Â§4WetwareÂ§r line.

Â§6Congrats!Â§r

Â§oNeurons for computationÂ§r
