The Â§aNeuro Processing UnitÂ§r serves as the CPU for Â§4WetwareÂ§r. It also takes a circuit board in its recipe, but pay it no mind.

Â§oCreative Items in IV? What madness is this?!?Â§r

Likely no one will ever make this item, but it gives you Â§6unlimitedÂ§r construction paste for Building Gadgets. It's useful for building... maybe.

This is really only here to tell you that this exists. Enjoy or something...

Â§oStar Trek strikes again!Â§r

Â§aTritaniumÂ§r is a material from Star Trek, and is used for a few other things in GT. It, like Â§9AmericiumÂ§r, requires two fusion steps!

You'll need this to get the next tier of circuits, and for Â§3UVÂ§r components.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In some versions of GT5u, only Tritanium fluid was red. The material was otherwise white. In GTCEu, we decided to make the whole thing red instead. Much better looking!

Â§4Charcoal smelting in Furnace is disabledÂ§r, you will need the Â§3Coke OvenÂ§r.
Â§dWooden PlanksÂ§r are still pretty good as Furnace Fuel, especially since you get four from one log.

If you want to enable Charcoal smelting regardless, you can head to GregTech configs.

Â§oAll in one! This Quest describes the Tungsten Chain.Â§r

Â§aTungstenÂ§r is obtained from either Â§eTungstateÂ§r or Â§eScheeliteÂ§r, which are part of the same vein in the End.

Just like the Â§dRutileÂ§r chain, you will only need to input one item type, and everything else will be looped perfectly!

You will need:
Â§9-Â§r One Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r, to make Â§dTungstic AcidÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r One Â§3ElectrolyzerÂ§r, to electrolyze Â§obothÂ§r Bath outputs.
Â§9-Â§r One Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r, to loop back Â§dHydrogenÂ§r and Â§dChlorineÂ§r into Â§aHydrochloric AcidÂ§r.

You will be granted either Calcium or Lithium as Byproduct, that's free of charge!


Â§bLore:Â§r In GTCE, Tungstate or Scheelite took 40sec and 4 Hydrogen buckets at 1920 EU/t to electrolyze into 1 Tungsten Dust. Even if it was simpler, it was much more ridiculously expensive! This new chain is great.

Â§oAre you noticing a pattern? It's not just my imagination...Â§r

The Â§3EV MixerÂ§r is required for more alloys. The most important being Â§dTungstensteelÂ§r and Â§dRTM AlloyÂ§r.

Â§oHigh-Speed Steels (HSS) are more resistant Steel Alloys typically used in Rails.Â§r

If you previously made Â§dUltimetÂ§r for any reason, you have already acquired Â§aMolybdenumÂ§r. It is found in a Nether vein.

I hope you have a lot of Â§9TungstenSteelÂ§r, because you're still gonna need more!
It is used for the creation of Â§aHSSÂ§r alloys, presently Â§aHSS-GÂ§r.

Â§oThe Ultimate Combustion fuel Generator!Â§r

To run the Â§3Extreme Combustion EngineÂ§r, you will most likely want to boost it (Â§oelse why would you bother...Â§r).
You will want a Â§34A IV Dynamo HatchÂ§r as the output, and one Â§3Vacuum FreezerÂ§r for Â§aLiquid OxygenÂ§r.

You can now harness the equivalent of 1 Â§dLuVÂ§r Amp, while burning fuel at Â§6200% efficiencyÂ§r!

Don't forget to keep it supplied with a small amount of Â§aLubricantÂ§r.

The Â§3ECEÂ§r is also void-free, unlike Large Turbines. Any energy that cannot be output will momentarily pause the multiblock.


Â§bLore:Â§r The ECE comes from GT:NH. However... the story is not so great. The stats on the tooltip looked similar to this one, so far so good.
However if you made calculations, you ended up realizing you needed to run around 16 whole HV Vacuum Freezers to keep up with Liquid Oxygen...
The one and only fuel it would accept is High Octane Gasoline, which was stated to be burned at 300% efficiency when boosted, but it was a lie! The efficiency remained 100%!
The GT:NH team recently decided to rework the ECE among other power options, phew!

Â§oWho needs Stargate when you have Star Trek!Â§r

Â§aDuraniumÂ§r is a material from Star Trek, and is used for a few things in GT. It makes some pretty awesome pipes, but otherwise you won't need much of this quite yet.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In some versions of GT5u, this material was entirely white. In fact, most fusion materials and later were like this. Boring!

Â§oPlasma? Turbine? What!? That's not even possible!

Use this turbine to extract very large amounts of power from plasma!

Â§aHelium PlasmaÂ§r is the best fuel for its cost.

Do not question how little sense a Plasma Turbine actually makes... look up Magnetohydrodynamic Generators if you want the real-deal.
Required for Â§dLuVÂ§r+ cables.

Â§oWhy can't these items I mine behave and enter my inventory!? This magnet should solve it, even if it makes no sense!Â§r

Charge the Magnet while you would with a Â§9BatteryÂ§r, and Â§dsneak right-clickÂ§r when in hand to activate it. Do it again to deactivate. It will work from anywhere in your inventory.

Â§9Note:Â§r If are you worried about getting overwhelmed by Cobblestone or Netherrack, open the trash can from FTB:Utilities in the top left corner to void them.

Â§oThe best mechanic, making an item or fluid disappear, poof!Â§r

Â§3Voiding CoversÂ§r can be attached to GregTech Machines, Crates or Drums. They will void stuff you don't want, fancy!

For machines, it will only void in the Output slots. The Input slots are ignored.
You can attach a Â§aFilterÂ§r for more precise voiding.

An advanced version also exists, which requires a Â§dMV CircuitÂ§r. It enables voiding above a set threshold (great for for overflow control).

Â§9Note:Â§r They default as being turned off, to prevent accidental voiding. Right-click them with a Â§5Soft MalletÂ§r to activate them.

Obtaining Â§eanyÂ§r Voiding Cover will complete this Quest.

This Jetpack takes most Â§aCombustion FuelsÂ§r (excluding oils) to enable a primitive form of flight.

Fill it like you would fill a Drum, or with a Â§3Canning MachineÂ§r.

Press Â§4HÂ§r (default) to enable Hover Mode.

This jetpack enables flight, and requires energy. Â§oWhat do you mean a jetpack is supposed to work off propellants?Â§r

Charge it like you would charge a Battery.

Press Â§4HÂ§r (default) to enable Hover Mode.

Â§oQuite a bit of a microcrafting project, but this is worth it!Â§r

The Advanced Nano Chestplate combines protection, a personal battery and an Â§6enhanced JetpackÂ§r, all in one.

To Â§denable chargingÂ§r, shift right-click it when it is in your hand, then equip it (Note that there is a bug when it sometimes does not want to charge... you will forgive it, right?).

Note that this stores Â§oa lotÂ§r of energy, and uses it fairly fast. You may want to invest in a Â§3HV Turbo ChargerÂ§r.

Â§oNot an actual TradeMark.Â§r

You probably don't have mobs to fight, but this armor provides nice QoL that you may enjoy!

Â§9Helmet:Â§r Provides Â§dNight visionÂ§r (default keybind Â§4MÂ§r but check for conflicts)

Â§9Chestplate:Â§r Provides nothing interesting, but can be further upgraded into the Â§aAdvancedÂ§r version at the very end of Â§6HVÂ§r Age.

Â§9Leggings:Â§r Provides nothing special, perhaps we should have given it a small speed boost?

Â§9Boots:Â§r Provides Â§dStep AssistÂ§r. You read that right!


Â§bLore:Â§r This armor is originally inspired by IndustrialCraft, but its first implementation within the GTCE environment came with Nuke Powered Utils, an addon mod to GTCE.

This Nether Limonite vein variant is not to be slept on.

Thanks to the 2x yield, this is an excellent source of Iron and Gold.

Â§oGregTech cannot yet provide ways to farm plants or trees, so here we come with a custom multiblock for the modpack!Â§r

The multiblock Â§3GreenhouseÂ§r will be your source of Â§aWoodÂ§r, and other plants if you wish.

The Â§aWoodÂ§r production is enough to keep running Â§32 Pyrolyse OvensÂ§r at their lowest Power.
You can also use this for automated Â§aResinÂ§r. The yields are kept low to incentivize other rubber sources, later in the game.

Â§9Note: Â§rWith Â§d40EU/tÂ§r recipes, it needs either 1 Â§bMVÂ§r energy hatch or 2 LV energy hatches. Multiblocks will Â§cnotÂ§r use 2A of one tier to reach the next one for recipe voltage minimums. 
In other words, the controller needs to say at least "Â§bMVÂ§r" in the gui to run recipes which say "Â§bMVÂ§r" in JEI, even if they can draw enough EU/t with a lower tier hatch configuration.

Â§9Note:Â§r The structure requires a lot of Â§9Wrought IronÂ§r. Make sure you have an Â§3Arc FurnaceÂ§r for that.


Â§bLore:Â§r We originally implemented a Chemical Reactor recipe for wood in the modpack to give options to the players. However they turned out to be completely busted, so we decided that a rebalance was due. I wonder if that's still busted? Probably less than the Fluid Rig!

Â§aBlue AlloyÂ§r is an excellent Cable material for Â§6HVÂ§r voltage.
Nothing prevents you from using it for Â§bMVÂ§r voltage too! Beware of not overvolting your machines, though.
Superconductors for both MV and HV are unlocked... much later.

Â§aElectrotineÂ§r is obtained from the Â§cNetherÂ§r, so don't craft it in the Mixer!

Â§aElectrotineÂ§r can be separated for Â§dElectrumÂ§r and Â§dRedstoneÂ§r. If you need 8 whole dusts as input, that's for balance reasons.

Early game Circuits are hand craftable.

Get the Â§3Circuit AssemblerÂ§r to make them a lot more efficient.

The Â§9IntegratedÂ§r Circuit line is not a strict upgrade in terms of cost, but works as a stepping stone towards the next tier.

They require a MV Â§3Laser EngraverÂ§r and a MV Â§3Cutting MachineÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r In Omnifactory, and in previous Gregicality, this circuit line was called Â§9RefinedÂ§r and was standardized like further tiers.

This Circuit line does not quite have a name. But they are all made off plastic boards, so you may call them that way.

This is where the Â§3CleanroomÂ§r starts being required.

The Â§aMainframeÂ§r requires a Â§3HV Circuit AssemblerÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r In Omnifactory, and in previous Gregicality, this circuit line was called Â§9MicroÂ§r and was standardized like further tiers.

This is the Â§9NanoÂ§r Circuit line.

Starting from here all circuits follow a similar pattern:
Â§9-Â§r Processor
Â§9-Â§r Assembly
Â§9-Â§r Supercomputer
Â§9-Â§r Mainframe

This is the Â§9QuantumÂ§r Circuit line.

You may want to invest in Â§aPBIÂ§r at this point, for the Â§dAdvanced SMDsÂ§r.

This is the Â§9CrystalÂ§r Circuit line.

It is locked behind Â§3FusionÂ§r.

This is the Â§9WetwareÂ§r Circuit line.

It will be the biggest automation challenge to face in this modpack.

Â§2Gregicality ScienceÂ§r will offer 5 new tiers of Circuits after this (subject to change):
Â§9-Â§r Bioware
Â§9-Â§r Optical
Â§9-Â§r Exotic
Â§9-Â§rÂ§r Cosmic
Â§9-Â§r Supracausal

Â§oNothing to see here... just normal progression.Â§r

Starting from here, Â§3EnergyÂ§r and Â§3Dynamo HatchesÂ§r can be upgraded to a Â§d4AmpsÂ§r variant.
This is extremely useful for Multiblock Generators.
On this line you can see the Steam, or Â§8Â§8ULVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§7LVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§bMVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§6HVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§5EVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§1IVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§dLuVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§fZPMÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§3UVÂ§r equivalents.
On this line you can see Â§4UHVÂ§r equivalents, formerly known as MAX in GTCE.

Â§oChannels may be disabled, but P2P Tunnels are still extremely important automation tools! Especially the Item P2P and the GTEU P2P.Â§r

Â§9Note:Â§r There are great resources online to explain how P2P Tunnels work. The short description is that they allow transfer of things from one input to endless outputs, with the Unofficial Extended Life version of AE2 (which we are using) allowing any number of inputs to any number of outputs. They are linked using a Memory Card.
This Quest acts as a tutorial on how to use the P2P Tunnels to your own benefit.


Â§2Â§lThe GTEU P2P Tunnel:Â§r

To turn a P2P Tunnel into a Â§aGTEU P2P TunnelÂ§r, right-click it in the world with a Â§dWireÂ§r or Â§dCableÂ§r.

This is ideal in lategame situations, to avoid spamming Cables or Transformers. You can also use them in conjunction with the AE2 Quantum Bridge to power your high tier Miners and Drills outside your base.

There is a Â§45% Voltage TaxÂ§r on the output side of the P2P, resulting in 5% energy loss.


Â§2Â§lThe Item P2P Tunnel:Â§r

To turn a P2P Tunnel into an Â§aItem P2P TunnelÂ§r, right-click it in the world with a Â§dvanilla ChestÂ§r.
Item P2P Tunnels are useful in a more abstract way so let's start with an example.

Â§eExample:Â§r Making a Â§9HV Machine HullÂ§r in the Â§3AssemblerÂ§r also requires an Â§3ExtractorÂ§r for the Fluid. That is two machines, hence two inventories.
You could passively fill the Assembler with Polyethylene, Â§lorÂ§r you can also include it in your Â§dPatternÂ§r, in the form of 2 Bars (Ingots).

Now, you may think the next step is just to dump the items in a Buffer and route the items with Pipes, however this system will eventually Â§4jamÂ§r due to the incompatibility with AE2 Interface blocking mode! Trust me.
Place the input of the Â§aItem P2PÂ§r on your Â§3ME InterfaceÂ§r, and one output on the Â§3ExtractorÂ§r, one on the Â§3AssemblerÂ§r.
Then, use Filter covers where the outputs are connected. Â§dOre Dictionary FiltersÂ§r are better, since you can configure them to Â§9ingot*Â§r. Have them on Â§ewhitelistÂ§r for the Â§3ExtractorÂ§r, and on Â§eblacklistÂ§r for the Â§3AssemblerÂ§r (no Assembler recipe ever requires Ingots, that's an intentional design decision in GregTech). 
Do not forget Â§dBlocking ModeÂ§r on your Interface.


Â§oYes, that's another reason why it is good to store polymers (Polyethylene, PTFE, PBI) as Bars!

Â§oWow this made it this far, that's great!

If you want to make your late game richer, I will recommend Â§2Gregicality MultiblocksÂ§r addon.
Utilizing this mod is completely Â§doptionalÂ§r, but the Multiblocks it adds are very unique and useful.

Without the addon, you will look at the Â§3Processing ArrayÂ§r for large scale production.
With the addon, you will have a Â§6wide variety of MultiblocksÂ§r, replacing all available single block Machines.

It also adds a lot of Â§9alloysÂ§r to build the new Multiblocks with. It's content!

Â§oIf you get the reference in the name of the Quest, yeah, you don't need that mod.Â§r

The Â§3Extended Pattern TerminalÂ§r has Â§616 slotsÂ§r instead of 9 slots.

Thanks to it, you can automate all the Â§3Assembly LineÂ§r recipes using Â§2AE2Â§r.

If you use Â§aAE2 Fluid CraftingÂ§r, there is also a fluid version of this. It's quite expensive!

To get yourself Titanium, Â§aRutileÂ§r must first be reduced to Â§aTitanium TetrachlorideÂ§r in an Â§3HV Chemical ReactorÂ§r, and then reduced again in the Â§3EBFÂ§r with Â§dMagnesiumÂ§r to finally arrive at the TitaniumÂ§r metal.

The Â§dCarbonÂ§r, Â§dChlorineÂ§r, Â§dOxygenÂ§r, and Â§dMagnesiumÂ§r used in the process can be Â§6perfectly recoveredÂ§r from the byproduct Â§dCarbon MonoxideÂ§r and Â§dMagnesium ChlorideÂ§r with no loss. Setup a system to recover them and you can process an indefinite amount of Rutile in a closed loop!


Â§aTitanium TetrachlorideÂ§r also acts as a catalyst in Plastics production. A small amount of Â§aTiClâ Â§rin the polymerisation process increases the polymer yield to Â§6133%Â§rÂ§r. This is totally and completely optional, though.

Â§oFluorine is the most rare gas to obtain from electrolysis in this game.Â§r

You may obtain it from Â§aLepidoliteÂ§r, Â§aBastnatiteÂ§r, and Â§aMicaÂ§r, but the best source is from Â§aTopazÂ§r.

Â§oDon't worry it's simplified enough, you won't end up on a watch list or anything...Â§r

Â§aUraniumÂ§r has very few uses in Â§2GTCEuÂ§r right now, as we have Â§4not yetÂ§r implemented the Â§3Nuclear ReactorÂ§r (it is planned!).

Make Â§dUranium HexafluorideÂ§r from Â§aUraniniteÂ§r, this will allow you to seperate the isotopes between U238 and U235.

Â§9FluorineÂ§r is fully recycled in the reaction, but you will need around maybe 40 buckets to bootstrap.
Â§9HydrogenÂ§r is consumed, you will need quite a lot of it. Either electrolyze a lot of water using several Â§3LV ElectrolyzerÂ§r for the best energy efficiency, or recycle your unused Â§dhydrocarbonsÂ§r such as Methane.

Â§9Tip:Â§r You can make this setup compact by having one single Â§3CentrifugeÂ§r and using a Â§6Fluid RegulatorÂ§r set to Â§dSupply Exact 1,000Â§r.

Â§o200 seconds what!? Don't worry this is nothing compared to running an EBF.Â§r

Hopefully for you, the Â§3LCRÂ§r recipe in Â§2JEIÂ§r for Â§aRadonÂ§r should be self explanatory on how to set it up.

Input some Â§aUraniumÂ§r, loop back the Â§dPlutoniumÂ§r using a Â§3Electric FurnaceÂ§r, and let the magic happen.


Â§bLore:Â§r This cursed, yet charming "chain" is inherited from GregTech 5.
Plutonium 239 existing as an ore is a sort of a placeholder to avoid having to obtain it through complicated means.

Â§aLiquid AirÂ§r is a great way to get large amounts of Â§aNitrogenÂ§r and Â§aOxygenÂ§r, at the cost of using more energy than Â§3LV CentrifugesÂ§r.

However, this will also give you both Â§6HeliumÂ§r and Â§6ArgonÂ§r which are great to boost smelting in the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r.


Â§cNote:Â§r You will need at least Â§3HV Input & Output HatchesÂ§r to be able to run this recipe.

This Quest requires the Â§3Pyrolyse OvenÂ§r and is Â§doptionalÂ§r, yet convenient.

The upper part are the important products of Â§aWood TarÂ§r Distillation:
Â§9-Â§r Phenol: useful for Epoxy and PBI
Â§9-Â§r Benzene: an important hydrocarbon
Â§9-Â§r Toluene: useful for TNT
Â§9-Â§r Dimethylbenzene: useful for PBI

Unlike Oil, putting Â§aWood TarÂ§r in the Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r for the byproducts, and using Â§dNitrobenzeneÂ§r for power is arguably worth it.


The bottom part are the important products from Â§aWood VinegarÂ§r Distillation:
Â§9-Â§r Acetic Acid: useful to make more Acetone
Â§9-Â§r Methanol: a moderately important hydrocarbon
Â§9-Â§r Acetone: useful for Epoxy and Gasoline

Complete Â§eeitherÂ§r task to validate this Quest.


It is also possible to go for a full combo of 4 Â§3DTsÂ§r. One for Â§aCharcoal ByproductsÂ§r as the whole input, splitting into Â§aWood TarÂ§r, Â§aWood GasÂ§r and Â§aWood VinegarÂ§r.
Not the most efficient cost to production ratio, but an option nonetheless if you are interested in that.

Â§6Multiply the energy density by 2Â§r and you have Â§aHigh Octane GasolineÂ§r.

Â§9Note:Â§r Automating this requires a lot of Â§3Distillation TowersÂ§r! A huge portion of your base would be dedicated to producing this constantly without anything bottlenecking.
If you have a base successfully running on Â§aHOGÂ§r, feel free to brag and share some screenshots on our Â§8DiscordÂ§r.

Â§oEven MORE power!Â§r

The Â§aLuV Lapotronic OrbÂ§r is even better than the Â§9IVÂ§r one! It of course comes at a price...

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In older versions of GT, such as GTNH in the past or in GCYL, these orbs were ludicrously expensive! They required 8 orbs of the previous tier! Thankfully, those days are long past.

Â§oA power signularity!Â§r

The Â§aZPM Lapotronic OrbÂ§r is even better than the Â§dLuVÂ§r one! It of course comes at a price...

Â§bLoreÂ§r: Imagine making 64 IV or 8 LuV Orbs for just one of these! See the Lore for the LuV orb for details.

Â§oIt holds way too much power!Â§r

The Â§aUV Lapotronic OrbÂ§r is even better than the Â§cZPMÂ§r one! It of course comes at a price...

Â§bLoreÂ§r: Imagine making 512 IV or 64 LuV Orbs or 8 ZPM Orbs for just one of these! See the Lore for the LuV orb for details.

The Â§3HV AutoclaveÂ§r - despite being optional - is a machine you will definitively want.

This unlocks unique Batteries that are Â§6far superiorÂ§r to standard Batteries.

Better Ore Processing for Â§6chanced ByproductsÂ§r, only at the cost of this Â§3MaceratorÂ§r! A must have.

And now, is it finally time for mass ore processing automation...? Â§oYes?Â§r
The next Quest will help you with that!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Shredding your Ores with further more Byproducts

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oExtreme is very apprioriate this time around, and you will see why.Â§r

At the cost of 4x the drilling Power, the Â§3Advanced Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r will be gaining Â§616x the outputÂ§r in Fluid.
The depletion of veins is also halved. This means you will get a total of Â§632xÂ§r as much Oil (or whatever fluid) from a bedrock fluid vein until depletion!

Even when depleted, you can still use this and be very power positive.

One single Â§3Advanced Fluid Drilling RigÂ§r should be enough to supply Power for a base up to Â§dLuVÂ§r Age and possibly beyond!

As a Â§9reminderÂ§r from the Quests that appeared in Â§bMVÂ§r:
Â§9-Â§r Â§aLight OilÂ§r can be used for Â§dLPGÂ§r and Â§dMethaneÂ§r, to run in Â§3Large Gas TurbinesÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aOilÂ§r can be used for Â§dDieselÂ§r and Â§dCetane-Boosted DieselÂ§r, to run in Â§3Large Combustion EnginesÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aHeavy OilÂ§r can be used for Â§dNitrobenzeneÂ§r, to run in Â§3Large Gas TurbinesÂ§r.

Â§oIndium has uses as a semiconductor.Â§r

Getting Â§aIndiumÂ§r requires a lot of Â§dSulfuric AcidÂ§r, and two different ores: Galena and Sphalerite.

Â§dSulfuric AcidÂ§r can be produced in large scale in the Â§3Large Chemical ReactorÂ§r, or obtained as a waste from the Â§9Platinum Group SludgeÂ§r process.

In Â§dLuVÂ§r, the mandatory Â§9Naquadah chainÂ§r will grant Â§aIndiumÂ§r too, which means this setup will have a limited life.

Use the Â§5Â§dÂ§kÂ§1Â§3Â§5Â§9Circuit 4Â§r recipe to avoid having to deal with Small Dusts.

Â§bLore:Â§r Another small chain inherited from GregTech 5. However this used to yield one tiny Dust instead, which was very painful.
Amperage goes up, now 6A per Superconductor.

Remotely expand your AE2 network, if you desire to move your base or set up Large Miner or anything else away...

The Â§3Quantum TunnelÂ§r is rather expensive, so you will have work for it if you want it!

Â§oAlmost as hot as the surface temperature of the Sun!Â§r

Â§aHSS-G CoilsÂ§r bring up the Heat Capacity to Â§d5,400KÂ§r.

Sweet Â§6Â§6Coil bonusesÂ§rÂ§r should be the incentive to make those early, as they become mandatory only during the Â§dLuVÂ§r Age.

At this point, you may go back to using only one Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r for your entire base, powering with the highest available Voltage you have.
Hot Metals will start taking longer to cool down as they don't get perfect overclocks. For that you will probably want a dual or quad Â§3Vacuum FreezerÂ§r.

The next board material is as easy as Â§aEpoxyÂ§r, plus an added extra step in the Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r.

Â§oHOORAY!Â§r

Â§1IVÂ§r Components - fortunately for you - are not a big step up in terms of complexity.

The amount of required Â§dTungstenÂ§r is huge.

Â§aEmittersÂ§r and Â§aSensorsÂ§r are another topic though... as they require Â§dNether StarÂ§r and Â§dIridiumÂ§r, both of which have their own dedicated Quests.

Â§oRocket Fuel mostly exists for compatibility with other mods. Modpack devs love it!
As an actual fuel for power though? Terrible!Â§r

Â§aRocket FuelÂ§r in this modpack is required to obtain Â§dNether StarsÂ§r (Â§oplease don't farm Withers!Â§r).

Automating it may be a big sink for your resources, but you can safely batch craft using an overclocked Â§3Large Chemical ReactorÂ§r, if you desire.

Â§oHey look! It's the default icon for BetterQuesting Quests... this time used accordingly.Â§r

Â§aNether StarsÂ§r are used for high tier Â§dSensorsÂ§r, Â§dEmittersÂ§r and Â§dField GeneratorsÂ§r.

You can also use them for Â§dBeaconsÂ§r, if you desire the permanent potion effects. Vanilla for you!

On the topic of Â§aNether AirÂ§r which is required in the recipe: you can consider Â§9Liquid Nether AirÂ§r Distillation if you wish, it's... decent.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GTNH, you need a Nether Star Block in HV to get to the moon! You could also duplicate them with magic, and mine an ore for nether star dust much later on.

Â§oDid you know the vanilla Nether Star texture isn't centered?Â§r :)

This part of the chain starts with Â§aRarest Metal ResidueÂ§r.

You will need an Â§1Â§1IVÂ§r powered Â§3Large Chemical ReactorÂ§r, but the average power is not too bad.

Â§dChlorineÂ§r is fully looped, and Â§dHydrogenÂ§r is slightly negative (Â§ounless you put Acidic Osmium Solution in the Distillation Tower and electrolyze the water back... no, don't do thatÂ§r).


Â§aIridiumÂ§r is required to progress in the Â§1IVÂ§r Age, so... automate the PGS line!

Â§oWoah! Let's be honest, this was tough to get here, I'm sure you thought the same! You will appreciate not having to make a new polymer for Circuits Boards.Â§r

The Â§3IV Circuit AssemblerÂ§r unlocks the Â§1QuantumÂ§r Circuit line.

This also unlocks the Â§6best recipeÂ§r for Â§dMV CircuitsÂ§r.

This part of the chain starts with Â§aInert Metal MixtureÂ§r.

Â§dSulfuric AcidÂ§r can be perfectly recycled. You will produce excess Â§dOxygenÂ§r and Â§dHydrogenÂ§r.

Â§aRutheniumÂ§r is a gate to the Â§9IVÂ§r age. You'll need it for the next coil!

Â§aRhodiumÂ§r is the gate to the Â§dLuVÂ§r Age. But you should still automate it so you won't need to do it later!

Doping Â§9SiliconÂ§r with Â§9NaquadahÂ§r will give a better Â§aSilicon BouleÂ§r.

Use it for higher yield on Â§dWafersÂ§r.

This will also unlock the Â§6best recipeÂ§r for Â§6HVÂ§r Circuits in the Â§3LuV Circuit AssemblerÂ§r, which you will most likely want to mass produce for Â§dLapotronic Energy OrbsÂ§r.

Better Â§aSMDsÂ§r to make Circuits more complex, but cheaper.

You will require Alloys that you have not made yet, most of which are used in Â§dLuVÂ§r Age and onwards.

Â§aAdvanced SMDsÂ§r are required for the Â§dCrystalÂ§r Circuit line.

Â§oNot much of these CPUs is Quantum related... you know. The name is just fancy.Â§r

I know, I gated this behind Â§dIndiumÂ§rÂ§r, I'm unfair... But it's the better recipe you know!

Â§aQubit CPUsÂ§r are used in the production of Â§1QuantumÂ§r Processors.

The Â§aHPICÂ§r unlocks Â§3IV Energy HatchesÂ§r and Â§3DynamosÂ§r... You know the drill!

Making an Â§3IV Chemical ReactorÂ§r is Â§doptionalÂ§r. You can craft this with a Â§3Large Chemical ReactorÂ§r if you wish.

If you wish to automate your LCR with patterns, head back to the P2P Tunnel Quest for more information.

This Quest will be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r an Â§3IV Energy HatchÂ§rÂ§r... or an Â§3IV Dynamo HatchÂ§r for your Multiblock Generators.

Don't forget that Â§d4 AmpÂ§r variants exist! However they require Â§aNiobium-Titanium CablesÂ§r, which needs Â§9Polyphenylene SulfideÂ§r.
Look down in the Â§dLuVÂ§r Chapter for that (spoiler: it's easy to obtain!).
betterquesting:10.name:8: Upgrading your EBF for the millionth time

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oHotter than the surface temperature of the Sun!Â§r

Â§aNaquadah CoilsÂ§r bring up the Heat Capacity to Â§d7,200KÂ§r.

These coils are required for progressing to the second half of Â§dLuVÂ§r, and beyond.

Â§oIt's over 9000!!Â§!Â§


Â§aTrinium CoilsÂ§r bring up the Heat Capacity to Â§d9,001KÂ§r.

These coils are required for progressing to the second half of Â§cZPMÂ§r, and beyond.
Â§aSystem on ChipÂ§r unlocks the Â§6best recipeÂ§r for Â§dLV CircuitsÂ§r.

Â§oTechnically HSS-E does not have Manganese, but close enough... as some other HSS alloys do have Manganese.Â§r

Â§aHSS-EÂ§r has very few niche uses required in progression.

This alloy has great durability and damage property for tools. It has the best Power multiplier (until Neutronium!) as a Â§dRotorÂ§r for Â§3Large TurbinesÂ§r, though less efficient than Â§aHSS-SÂ§r.

Â§oAnother High Speed Steel, completely fictional, alloyed with Iridium and Osmium.Â§r

Â§aHSS-SÂ§r will be necessary to craft Â§dLuV MotorsÂ§r.

This alloy has a great mining speed, which translates into extremely good Â§6efficiencyÂ§r when used as a Â§dRotorÂ§r in Â§3Large TurbinesÂ§r.
This Superconductor will be required for progression during Â§dLuVÂ§r (if you guessed why, congratulations, you are an expert with Â§2JEIÂ§r!).

If you already made and centrifuged Â§aRare EarthÂ§r, that's great! If you did not, obtain it as Â§9ByproductÂ§r from various ores, or from centrifuging Â§dMonaziteÂ§r.

To extract the Â§aRare EarthsÂ§rÂ§r, you should use Â§3CentrifugeÂ§r Â§4as high tier as possibleÂ§r, due to the chanced output increasing.

The elements you can obtain are:
Â§9-Â§r Â§aLanthanumÂ§r is used in Â§3FusionÂ§rÂ§r, you will eventually want a lot of it!
Â§9-Â§r Â§aYttriumÂ§r is used in Â§dYttrium-Barium-Cuprate-OxideÂ§r (YBCO), a wire material for Â§3UVÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aCeriumÂ§r is not particularly useful.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aSamariumÂ§r is used for Â§dIV SuperconductorsÂ§r and Â§dMagnetic RodsÂ§r for Â§dLuVÂ§r+ Motors.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aNeodymiumÂ§r normally makes the strongest magnets, but gameplay balance... you know.
Â§9-Â§r Â§aCadmiumÂ§r is not particularly useful.


Â§bLore:Â§r Rare Earth Elements (REE) contain a lot more metals than these, but we are struggling enough as is to give them use. Gregicality Science will have a proper REE chain!

Â§oWhat even requires this temperature?Â§!Â§


Â§aTritanium CoilsÂ§r bring the Heat Capacity to Â§d10,800KÂ§r.

These coils aren't needed for much, but they'll provide another perfect overclock for most recipes!

Â§oThe chances you are having TPS issues playing this modpack are slim, this Quest is more suited for late game bases with GregTech and AE2, and the tips apply to other modpacks.Â§r

If you run the command Â§9/forge tpsÂ§r, you will be given the current Â§4TPSÂ§r and the Â§4tick timeÂ§r in milliseconds.
If the tick time exceeds 50ms, the server is under too much load, and won't be able to keep up with a steady 20 TPS.

Any machine will add up to the tick time, but don't be too scared of adding machines. Most of the lag usually comes from things that are unoptimized.

Things to Â§cavoidÂ§r in general:
Â§9-Â§r Entities are pretty bad. Ground items or mob entities should be kept as low as possible at any given time. Thankfully this should not be an issue in this modpack.
Â§9-Â§r Building everything packed together in a small space. Note that this does Â§onotÂ§r affect TPS, but you will suffer FPS drops instead.
Â§9-Â§r Huge walls of drawers, as iterating through every single one of them for insertion and extraction can be pretty taxing.

Things toÂ§c avoidÂ§r with AE2:
Â§9-Â§r ME Import and Export Buses on large networks. Use ME Interfaces instead.
Â§9-Â§r Crafting Cards to passively do large requests. Note that this is not as bad as it used to be, thanks to the optimizations from AE2 Unofficial.
Â§9-Â§r Recursive insertion and/or extraction through sub-networks. If you use sub-networks, make them do very specific things rather than interacting with another AE2 network.

Things to Â§cavoidÂ§r with GregTech (GTCEu has received a lot of improvements over GTCE, but it is possible to destroy your TPS, as with any mod):
Â§9-Â§r Many EU Producers connected to many EU Consumers in the same line. Instead, use a Diode or Battery Buffer to separate your line of generators to your line of machines.
Â§9-Â§r Large amounts of Fluid Pipes. They are Â§onotÂ§r laggy individually, but they can add up if you have thousands of them.
Â§9-Â§r Big Item Pipe networks. Small networks are better, to reduce the number of iterations over inventories.

Â§oBy this point I should be rambling on how important it is to automate everything and... yeah, do it, embrace the pain!Â§r

Â§aLaminated GlassÂ§r is the Glass tier for Â§1IVÂ§r and onwards. It is made in the Â§3Forming PressÂ§r using a new Polymer: Â§dPolyvinyl ButyralÂ§r.

None of the steps should be particularly difficult if you already have the Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r for Cracked Fuels, and you have also automated Epoxy.
If you do not have both, you know what to do!


Â§9Note:Â§r Â§dPolyvinyl AcetateÂ§r (required for the Glass) can also be used for Â§aGlueÂ§r, if you ever care about that...

Most AE2 facades are hidden in Â§2JEIÂ§r to prevent clutter, but they still exist!

To craft them, place any solid block surrounded by 4 Â§aCable AnchorsÂ§r. These work with AE2 parts to cover things up.

Â§eAnyÂ§r facade wil do. I simply decided to add the magic hazard for fun.


GregTech also has its own facades, crafted with a solid block and an Â§aIron PlateÂ§r. They work as covers and can be placed on machines and pipes.

You may notice that some fluids say they are "Acidic", with Â§9Sulfuric AcidÂ§r being one of them.

This means that many fluid pipes will not be able to transport them safely!
At Â§bMVÂ§r, the cheapest pipes for acid transportation are probably Â§aGoldÂ§r, with the more expensive Â§aVanadium SteelÂ§r or Â§aChromeÂ§r pipes taking second place and third place.
Â§aStainless SteelÂ§r or Â§aPolytetrafluoroethyleneÂ§r will be valid options once you are in Â§6HVÂ§r.

You have three options for acid storage at around this point: Â§dGlass VialsÂ§r, Â§dGold DrumsÂ§r, or Â§dSuper TanksÂ§r. Glass Vials are like Â§9Fluid CellsÂ§r, and are made to store acids. Gold Drums are self-explanatory. Super Tanks will be unlocked after Â§9PolyethyleneÂ§r, and can store any fluid without restriction.

Â§cWARNING:Â§r Acids in the wrong pipes will cause Â§cvoidingÂ§r, Â§cpipe burningÂ§r, and high rates of Â§cdeathÂ§r! Be careful!

Â§bLore:Â§r The acid transportation and storage mechanics originate from GregTech 6. Fun!

Some specific fluids are Â§dCryogenicÂ§r, which are too cold for ordinary pipes. 

You need to pick the right pipe for the job!

Not many pipes support cold fluids, so give Â§aStainless SteelÂ§r or Â§aIridiumÂ§r a try. Later on you can use Â§aNaquadahÂ§r or most of the fusion materials when you get there.

Â§cWARNING:Â§rÂ§r Cryogenics in the wrong pipes will cause Â§cvoidingÂ§r, Â§cpipe freezingÂ§r, and high rates of Â§cdeathÂ§r! Be careful!

Â§bLore:Â§r This is the first time GregTech has cryogenic mechanics, a GTCEu-original feature!

Â§cWarningÂ§r: Â§9PlasmasÂ§r are Â§cextremely hotÂ§r, with temperatures exceeding Â§d30 kKÂ§r! 

However, this does Â§6Â§lnotÂ§r mean that you need pipes to support that heat! Plasmas are treated slightly differently and break the rules a bit.

Fluid pipes supporting plasmas, such as Â§aTungstenÂ§r, Â§aNaquadahÂ§r, or Â§aDuraniumÂ§r can hold any plasma Â§6regardless of temperatureÂ§r! This means they will Â§lnotÂ§r melt under the heat of the plasma!


WARNING:Â§r Plasmas in the wrong pipes will cause Â§cvoidingÂ§r, Â§cpipe burningÂ§r, and Â§lvery highÂ§r rates of Â§cdeathÂ§r! Be careful!

Â§bLore:Â§r This mechanic originates from GT6, just like the acids!

Â§oEver wanted your pipes to look Â§levenÂ§rÂ§o cooler? Now you can!Â§r

Fluid and Item Pipes can be placed inside of Frameboxes, giving them an Â§6absolutely breathtakingÂ§r appearance!

Simply Right Click a frame onto a pipe or a pipe onto a frame, and you're done!

Â§bLore:Â§r This is a GTCEu-original mechanic!

Â§oDo you know what this is? Shame if you do not.Â§r

A fancy tool to help with base building, has different modes.
Also check out the Â§3Destruction GadgetÂ§r and the Â§3Copy Paste GadgetÂ§r.

Charge this in the charger slot of any GregTech machine.

Tell me... do not use it to make a cobble platform, please! At least chisel it first.

Â§oAn excellent way to save on some redstone contraptions.Â§r

The Â§aAdvanced Energy DetectorÂ§r is an RS-latch for Energy Control.

Put it on a Â§3Battery BufferÂ§r, set a Minimum EU near 0, and a Maximum EU near the max capacity.
The Cover will output a Â§4redstoneÂ§r signal until the high threshold is reached, and then it will wait until the low threshold is reached to output redstone again.

This is a must to automate inertia based power generators, such as Boilers, or more importantly Â§3Large TurbinesÂ§r.

The Â§aSimple System on ChipÂ§r will be used for either Â§dME Fluid Storage ComponentsÂ§r, or the best Â§dULV CircuitÂ§r recipe.

I would also recommend going ahead and making all the other useful colored Lenses ahead of time. They are listed here in an Â§eoptionalÂ§r task.
betterquesting:10.name:8: I see the world in colors

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oNow with disinfectant!Â§r

The Â§aSterilized CleanroomÂ§r is required to produce the next tier of circuits. Nearly every step must be performed inside of one! Good luck fitting everything into such a tight space!

If you only have one Â§3CleanroomÂ§r, you will need another for Â§aSterilizedÂ§r recipes.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: Normal Cleanroom recipes cannot run in the Sterilized Cleanroom, so you can't simply upgrade it.

This Maintenance Hatch is an upgrade to the Automatic Maintenance Hatch.
It allows your Multiblock to run regular Â§aCleanroom recipesÂ§r, but not Sterilized.

Â§oDon't you mean Stargatium?Â§r

Â§aNaquadahÂ§r is a late-game material, used for many things. It is required for building a Fusion Reactor, and progressing to ZPM-tier, to name a few.

For some reason, its fluid is Â§agreenÂ§r, don't ask me why.

Â§bLore:Â§r Naquadah is a material originally from Stargate.

Â§oYour fun is about to get cranked up to 11!Â§r

Â§dLuVÂ§r Components are significantly more difficult to produce than their predecessors. They require an Â§9Assembly LineÂ§r, many different forms of materials, and lots of fluids too!

You will notice that Â§9SamariumÂ§r is required for Â§aLuV+ MotorsÂ§r. Samarium is on its own not very difficult to obtain, but smelting it is slightly more involved. It requires Â§9Liquid HeliumÂ§r in the Freezer. You may have seen this already, if you made Â§9IV SuperconductorsÂ§r.

Â§bLore:Â§r In the original GregTech 5, these components were unobtainable!

Â§oYour blue cube is now green!Â§r

The Â§aAdvanced Processing ArrayÂ§r is an upgrade to the regular version. It now has a maximum of Â§a64Â§r machines, instead of 16.

Â§oTo Infinity, and Beyond!Â§r

The Â§aQuantum Link CardÂ§r is an upgrade to the Â§9Quantum Link TunnelÂ§r, which gives Â§9Wireless TerminalsÂ§r access to your AE system with unlimited range, and from any dimension.

Â§oAnother Stargate material? Impossible!Â§r

Â§aTriniumÂ§r is a very important material for progression. You'll need it to make a Â§9Fusion ReactorÂ§r, and throughout all Â§cZPMÂ§r.

It also requires an Â§dLuVÂ§r EBF to smelt! You'll probably want a dedicated setup for cooking this.

This Quest will be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r an Â§3LuV Energy HatchÂ§rÂ§r... or an Â§3LuV Dynamo HatchÂ§r for your Multiblock Generators.

Starting at Â§dLuVÂ§r, you'll start upgrading more multiblocks, which means more energy hatches! Both the Â§9EBFÂ§r, and the Â§9Assembly LineÂ§r will need power upgrades.

Don't forget that Â§d4 AmpÂ§r variants exist!

Â§oBe glad they don't use pumps...Â§r

Â§aLuV SuperconductorsÂ§r are a big requirement for making a Â§9Fusion ReactorÂ§r. You will need Â§ea lotÂ§rÂ§r of them.

Â§oSpicy Plutonium IsotopeÂ§r

Â§aPlutonium-241Â§r is yet another requirement for the Â§9Fusion ReactorÂ§r. It's very easy to make: just centrifuge some Â§9Pu-239Â§r to separate some out!

In the future, this material will require a Â§dNuclear ReactorÂ§r to produce, but that's not in GTCEu yet.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT Impact, making Pu-241 was a challenge. Your first Pu-241 had to be produced as a byproduct of its very expensive Naquadah fuel process, and it could only be made independently with something post-fusion!

Â§oIf you haven't struck gold yet, you will nowÂ§r

The Â§aLuV Electric ProspectorÂ§r is a major upgrade from the Â§eHVÂ§r one. It will make finding Fluid and Ore veins very easy.

Â§oFusing Europium? How...?

Â§aEuropiumÂ§r is the first major Fusion Material. You'll be using this quite a lot going forwards.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: The temperature of liquid Europium is very hot, but  is not a plasma. Plan your piping accordingly!

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In Gregicality Legacy, Europium was replaced with Rutherfordium as the first fusion material, because Europium is actually found in Rare Earth and is not fused in real life.

Â§oNot an actual TradeMark.Â§r

This armor provides more QoL compared to the Nano suit.

Â§9Helmet:Â§r Provides Â§dNight visionÂ§r (default keybind Â§4MÂ§r but check for conflicts), prevents harmful potion effects, and automatically eats for you!

Â§9Chestplate:Â§r Nullifies burning, but can be further upgraded into the Â§aAdvancedÂ§r version at the very end of Â§dLuVÂ§r Age. Note that this does NOT include a jetpack without the advanced upgrade.

Â§9Leggings:Â§r Provides the speed boost which the Nano leggings did not.

Â§9Boots:Â§r Provides Â§dStep AssistÂ§r, nullifies fall damage, and increases jump height!

Â§bLore:Â§r This armor is originally inspired by IndustrialCraft, but its first implementation within the GTCE environment came with Nuke Powered Utils, an addon mod to GTCE.

Â§oQuite a bit of a microcrafting project, but this is worth it!Â§r

The Advanced Quantum Chestplate combines protection, a personal battery and an Â§6ultimate JetpackÂ§r, all in one.

To Â§denable chargingÂ§r, shift right-click it when it is in your hand, then equip it (Note that there is a bug when it sometimes does not want to charge... you will forgive it, right?).

Note that this stores Â§oa lotÂ§r of energy. You may want to invest in an Â§3LuV Turbo ChargerÂ§r.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This armor piece is inspired by the IndustrialCraft  Addon Gravisuite, which added the Gravitation Suit, analogous to this chestplate.

Â§oHow do these even work?Â§r

Â§aCrystal CPUsÂ§r are used to produce Â§9Crystal CircuitsÂ§r, who would have thought?

Producing these is quite a bit different from the previous circuits' components. Instead of standard silicon wafers, these rely on Â§9EmeraldÂ§r or Â§9OlivineÂ§r.

Getting your first Crystal Chips will be difficult, so you may wish to invest in a high-tier autoclave. After you get your first Chip, you can duplicate them with Â§9EuropiumÂ§r. Don't worry about those other recipes yet, they're for later on in Â§cZPMÂ§r.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: An Â§9Advanced Item DetectorÂ§r cover will be useful for automating these. They work just like the Advanced Energy Detector.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT5u modpacks, making your first Crystal Chips required the autoclave to be in Low Gravity, which meant doing this process on a Galacticraft Space Station, or on the moon!

Â§oNaquadah, but radioactive!Â§r

Â§aEnriched NaquadahÂ§r is an isotope of naquadah, Nq-528. It is radioactive, and will be used to produce power in the future.

Currently, you just need it to make Â§9Trinium CoilsÂ§r.

Â§oNaquadah, but radioactive!Â§r

Â§aNaquadriaÂ§r is an isotope of Naquadah, Nq-522. It is highly unstable, and used for Â§3UVÂ§r components and Â§9Fusion Mk2Â§r.

Â§oGetting tired of all these pitch-black ingots yet?Â§r

Â§aZPM SuperconductorsÂ§r are a big requirement for making a Â§9Fusion Reactor Mk2Â§r. You will need Â§ea lotÂ§rÂ§r of them. 

You can also use them to make Â§9Superconducting CoilsÂ§r for cheaper.

This Quest will be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r a Â§3ZPM Energy HatchÂ§rÂ§r... or a Â§3ZPM Dynamo HatchÂ§r for your Multiblock Generators.

Don't forget that Â§d16 AmpÂ§r variants exist!

Don't forget that these hatches require a Â§9Data OrbÂ§r for research.

The Â§aUHPICÂ§r unlocks Â§3ZPM Energy HatchesÂ§r and Â§3DynamosÂ§r, as well as the Active Transformer. 

You may know the drill, but do you know the screwdriver?

Â§oPrepare your Platline!Â§r

Â§cZPMÂ§r Components thankfully aren't too much harder than Â§dLuVÂ§r. 

They use lots of Â§9OsmiridumÂ§r, so make sure your platinum refining process is up to the task.

Â§oUltimited Power!!!Â§r

The Â§aZero Point ModuleÂ§r (item) is a non-rechargable battery with TONS of energy stored. You may have found one of these before now, but couldn't discharge it until reaching Â§cZPMÂ§r tier.

These can only be found as loot from Â§6Jungle TemplesÂ§r.  They're very rare, so don't worry about finding one. This quest is Â§6optionalÂ§r and is just for fun. So feel free to hit the checkbox if you want to get the completion points.

Â§bLore:Â§r Zero Point Module, the full name of the ZPM tier, is  also from Stargate. It is named after a device which generated crazy amounts of energy.

Â§oThis really should be made in a nuclear reactor...Â§r

Â§aAmericiumÂ§r is a Fusion Mk2 material, used to progress into the Â§3UVÂ§r tier!

And yes, it does indeed have two fusion steps!

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In Gregicality Legacy, Americium was replaced with Dubnium. Americium is a material only obtained from nuclear reactors, so GCYL changed it to the synthetic element Dubnium instead.

Â§oThe final processing line, at last!Â§r

Production of Â§aSterilized Growth MediumÂ§r is the final processing line in GTCEu, for now at least...

You will need this for Â§4Wetware CircuitsÂ§r.

Producing it is not nearly as difficult as PBI, but nearly every step requires a Sterilized Cleanroom. This means you'll have to get creative with how you use your space.

Make sure to look at every recipe for every step. Some inputs are much more effective than others!

If you're not sure how to automate Â§eMince MeatÂ§r, I'll refer you to the Fisher Quest.

Â§ePro TipÂ§r: You can wall-share cleanrooms, with doors in-between too, if you want more space.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: GTCEu's Sterilized Growth Medium chain is loosely based off of Bartworks' from GTNH. The main difference is that GTNH required a Bacterial Vat multiblock, which was more complex than the ordered Assembly Line! GTCEu is considering adding a multiblock like it but with their own spin in the future.

Â§bMore LoreÂ§r: In Gregicality Legacy, the Sterilized Growth Medium production chain was very different. It was one of the most difficult processes in the mod, with over 30 complicated steps! It was based off of producing different real-life vitamins and nutrients.

Â§bEven More LoreÂ§r: In Shadows of Greg, this was made with just Distilled Water and Mince Meat! Oh how far we have come...

Â§oThe board that keeps lifeÂ§r

The final circuit board at last! As you can see, this board is Â§cmuchÂ§r more expensive than the other ones, but you should be okay.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GTNH, these circuit boards require LuV Sensors, instead of IV. This means that Wetware LuV circuits, needed other (crystal) LuV circuits! Additionally, because Wetware was so expensive, using Crystal was preferred unless UHV wetware circuits were needed. Thankfully, CEu does not have this problem, and LuV Wetware Circuits are worth making.

Â§oWhen engraving it once just isn't enoughÂ§r

The Â§aCrystal SoCÂ§r is used to make cheaper Â§9Crystal CircuitsÂ§r. Enjoy the discount!

Crystal SoC's require Â§9ZPM EmittersÂ§r, which means you need a Â§9Data OrbÂ§r for their research.

In the future, these may become more difficult to make.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT5u, the texture for this item was red, and did not have the special design on it. There was a "raw" version with the design, but it was used for other unrelated things. Who knows why!

Â§oThis texture is really ugly...Â§r

Â§aStem CellsÂ§r are a major component of Â§4Wetware CircuitsÂ§r. Just don't ask why these use Osmiridium.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: The Nomifactory modpack has a much better texture for these, and uses it in its custom Draconic Stem Cells.

Â§aUV SuperconductorsÂ§r are a big requirement for making a Â§9Fusion Reactor Mk3Â§r. You will need Â§ea lotÂ§rÂ§r of them. 

You can also use them to make Â§9Superconducting CoilsÂ§r for even cheaper.

Â§oPrepare your Fusion Reactors!Â§r

Â§3UVÂ§r Components are a little bit harder than Â§cZPMÂ§r. 

They use lots of Â§9TritaniumÂ§r and Â§9NaquadriaÂ§r, so make sure your have enough Fusion Reactors, and a fast enough Naquadah Plant.

They also need a lot more Â§9ComputationÂ§r, which means Â§3Advanced HPCA ComponentsÂ§r are now required!

Computation Needs for Early UV:
- Â§a32 CWU/tÂ§r: Basic Â§3UVÂ§r Components and the Network Switch
- Â§a48 CWU/tÂ§r: Â§3UVÂ§r Sensor, Emitter, and Field Generator

Â§oHow does Neutronate even work??Â§r

Â§aUHV SuperconductorsÂ§r exist, and are used for a few things. You can use them for Superconducting Coils, as well as the Â§9Rotary Hearth FurnaceÂ§r and Â§9Bulk Blast ChillerÂ§r from Â§2GCYMÂ§r. These two multis are your parallel EBF and Vacuum Freezer!

This Quest will be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r a Â§3UV Energy HatchÂ§rÂ§r... or a Â§3UV Dynamo HatchÂ§r for your Multiblock Generators.

Don't forget that Â§d16 AmpÂ§r variants exist!

Â§oNo, it doesn't make you floatÂ§r

The Â§aGravi StarÂ§r is the final upgraded Nether Star in GTCEu. It's needed for Â§3UVÂ§r Sensors, Emitters, and Field Generators.

Â§oAnd you thought there wouldn't be creative items...Â§r

The Â§aCreative Energy CellÂ§r is one of the few craftable creative items. It provides infinite energy to your AE system, so you don't have to worry about adding any more Â§9Dense Energy CellsÂ§r, or using Â§9Energy AcceptorsÂ§r anymore.

This Quest will be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r a Â§3UHV Energy HatchÂ§rÂ§r... or a Â§3UHV Dynamo HatchÂ§r for your Multiblock Generators.

These are the final energy hatches in GTCEu. 

Don't forget about the Â§d16 ampÂ§r versions!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Upgrading your Assembly Line for the Last Time

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oIs this... the end?Â§r

Crafting the Â§aUltimate BatteryÂ§r is the end of GTCEu and the GregTech Community Modpack. Â§6Congratulations!Â§r

Now that you've finished the mod, there's a few things you should do:

- Â§9Join the GTCEu DiscordÂ§r and tell us about how your playthrough went! Also show off your battery :) 
   Â§9LinkÂ§r: https://discord.gg/bWSWuYvURP

- Â§eGo outsideÂ§r (and start playing GregTech in real life, right?)

- Â§cBlow up your world with TNT and GT DynamiteÂ§r. Â§nMake a backup first!!!Â§r


Â§6Thank you for playing the pack!Â§r
- The GregTech Community Pack Dev Team

Â§oDon't ask me how neutrons create electron holesÂ§r

This is the Â§afinal silicon bouleÂ§r, which produces a ton of wafers! It also unlocks the recipe for the Â§aHighly Advanced SoCÂ§r, which is used to make cheaper Â§4wetware circuitsÂ§r.

Â§oYou're going to need a lot of charcoalÂ§r

The Â§aLarge Titanium BoilerÂ§r is yet another steam boiler. It's even more efficient than the previous ones, and produces more steam too. However, Steam Â§cbarely scalesÂ§r at this voltage.

This thing is really not worth it, and there are much better alternatives for power by this point, so you shouldn't make this. The better alternatives require Â§9EV energy hatchesÂ§r, which are later in the chapter

Â§eNoteÂ§r: This quest can be skipped (for completion progress) by clicking the Checkmark. You do not have to actually craft one.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT5u, there is another multiblock called the Large Heat Exchanger. It is also made from titanium, but produced Superheated Steam from hot IC2 coolant, or lava. This was a much better than regular steam, and was actually viable! This may come to CEu one day in the future.

Â§oGood luck fueling thisÂ§r

The Â§aLarge Tungstensteel BoilerÂ§r is the final steam boiler. It's even more efficient than the previous ones, and produces more steam too.

This thing is Â§nextremelyÂ§r not worth it, and you should use something else. Don't make this, it's not good. Steam doesn't scale beyond this point, and this boiler will likely be removed in the future.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: This quest can be skipped (for completion progress) by clicking the Checkmark. You do not have to actually craft one.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: No one makes these in GT5u either...

Â§oThis thing is completely ludicrous!Â§r

At the cost of 16x the drilling Power, the Â§3Advanced Fluid Drilling Rig IIÂ§r will be gaining Â§664x the outputÂ§r in Fluid.
The depletion of veins is also eighthed. This means you will get a total of Â§6128xÂ§r as much Oil (or whatever fluid) as the regular rig from a bedrock fluid vein until depletion!

Even when depleted, you can still use this and be very power positive.

One single Â§3Advanced Fluid Drilling Rig IIÂ§r should be enough to last you until the end of the game, for whatever fluid you drill.

This Large Miner is nearly identical to the regular one, except it has a wider range and uses more drilling fluid.

It's an optional upgrade, which you might not even want.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: There may be a rebalance for these in the future. See the Multiblock Miner quest for details

This Large Miner is nearly identical to the regular one, except it has a wider range and uses more drilling fluid.

It's an optional upgrade, which you might not even want.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: There may be a rebalance for these in the future. See the Multiblock Miner quest for details

The Â§3Charcoal Pile IgniterÂ§r is a unique multiblock. It is used to produce Â§aCharcoalÂ§r faster than Â§3Coke OvensÂ§r, but comes with the trade-off of Â§amanual laborÂ§r.

To operate the igniter, dig a big pit into the ground, up to Â§e9x5x9Â§r blocks in size. The tooltip mentions up to 4 blocks in depth, but you'll need up to a 5th for the structure. Fill the floor of the pit with vanilla Â§abrick blocksÂ§r. Then, fill the remaining space entirely with Â§alogsÂ§r. After that, Â§acover the filled pitÂ§r with grass, dirt, or other natural groundcover to form a roof. In the layer with the roof, place the igniter! To start it, light it with Â§aFlint and SteelÂ§r.

Once the progress completes, open up the pit and mine the Â§aBrittle CharcoalÂ§r with a shovel (or spade!). Each block drops 1.4 charcoal on average, and one log converts into one block!

Â§eNoteÂ§r: The pit must be Â§centirelyÂ§r full of logs. Air blocks will not allow the multiblock to form.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: This quest is Â§boptionalÂ§r. If you would like to skip this quest, hit the checkmark instead.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This multiblock originally comes from GT5u, but did not require a fire-starting item to start.
This terminal will allow you to configure the automatically stocked fluids in a Â§afluid interfaceÂ§r remotely!
This terminal will allow you to configure the automatically stocked items in an item interface remotely!

Â§aAE2 Fluid CraftingÂ§r allows you to autocraft with fluids directly!

To get started, you need a Â§aFluid DiscretizerÂ§r. Only one is required for the entire ME network. It will make all of your fluids accessible by your system into "Drops." These do NOT take up space in your storage system, despite being items.

Once you have one in your network, you can use Â§aFluid Pattern TerminalsÂ§r to pattern recipes with fluids in them directly. This is very useful for circuits, for example.

The Â§eDual InterfaceÂ§r can be used for autocrafting recipes containing fluids. It will supply both the items and fluids according to the requested craft.

The Â§9Fluid Packet DecoderÂ§r can be used to turn the Drops back into normal fluid, if you get some. It's also useful for Ordered Fluids in the Assembly Line if you enable it in the config and want an additional challenge.

The Â§9Precision BuretteÂ§r can be used to fill fluid containers with precise amounts. You probably don't need this...

The Â§9Fluid AssemblerÂ§r allows you to autocraft recipes that use filled fluid containers, but instead draws the fluid from the ME system. An example of this would be recipes using water buckets in them. You also probably don't need this...

Â§oDon't want to spend your circuits to select recipes?Â§r

By clicking the Â§6Circuit Configuration SlotÂ§r in machines, you can create a Â§bGhost Programmed CircuitÂ§r. 

This is a fake circuit that allows you to select a given configuration for recipes! There's no more need to spend your circuits crafting Â§bProgrammed CircuitsÂ§r anymore.

Â§dElectric MachinesÂ§r and Â§dItem Input BusesÂ§r will have a Ghost Circuit Slot.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This feature is originally from GTNH!

Â§oThis is a guide on how to automatically route Â§lallÂ§rÂ§o your Hot Ingots to your Chemical Bath while keeping everything automated perfectly fine.Â§r

The cheap way would be to use filters, and manually add Hot Ingots one by one... That's boring! I don't like being bored, let's do something much better.


Install an Â§aOre Dictionary FilterÂ§r Cover on the side of your Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r, open it and set to Â§eÂ§lingotHot*Â§r whitelist.
The slot is to Â§dtestÂ§r items to make sure you configured the Filter properly, drag ingots from JEI!

From here, you can route with Â§9Item PipesÂ§r.

Connect the output of your Â§3EBF(s)Â§r to the input of your Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r and the output dump (Chest or Crate).
You can also have a Â§dRestrictive PipeÂ§r in front of the output dump to ensure the Chemical Bath will be prioritized.


Â§lÂ§9Note:Â§r If you wish to know more Ore Dictionaries for more automation setups, they will display if you press Shift when hovering over an item. This is due to an enabled config in JEI Integration.

Â§9Other Note:Â§r The Ore Dictionary Filter partially supports Â§dregexÂ§r, hover over the info icon for more information.

Â§oIf you read the previous Quest, this shouldn't be too bad. If you didn't... What are you waiting for!?Â§r

Distillating Â§aOilÂ§r will give you Fuel that you will need to desulfurize.

Â§aHydrogen SulfideÂ§r is perfectly Â§drecycledÂ§r in an Â§3ElectrolyzerÂ§r.
To automate this process, simply place your Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r and your Â§3ElectrolyzerÂ§r next to each other. Be sure to use your Â§5ScrewdriverÂ§r to Â§4enable input from output sideÂ§r.


Â§aLight FuelÂ§r is a good Â§9PowerÂ§r option. But there is something even greater... Check the Quest to the left.

Â§oThings are about to get complicated!Â§r

This quest will explain a mechanic of the Assembly Line: Â§dOrdered InputsÂ§r.

The Assembly Line requires the Item Inputs to appear in the same order as the recipe does in JEI. 

This means that the top left input must come first, the top right input must be 4th, and the bottom right input must come last, for example.

If enabled in the config (more on this at the end), Fluid Inputs can also be ordered. This is Â§csignificantly more difficult to automateÂ§r, and it is Â§aoff by defaultÂ§r. Enable it if you want more of a challenge!

Â§9How to automate Ordered Item Inputs:Â§r

There are many ways to automate Ordered Items: GT item pipes, redstone, other mods, you name it! This quest will give a specific recommendation using Â§3AE2Â§r.

Have your Interface containing the patterns face an Â§3Item P2PÂ§r. Set two output P2Ps: one into the first Â§3Input BusÂ§r, and the other into Â§3Item PipesÂ§r. Make your Item Pipes connect to all Input Buses including the first.
Do not forget Â§dBlocking ModeÂ§r, and you have got yourself an easy automation! This will also work flawlessly once we inevitably add ordered item inputs.

Â§9How to automate Ordered Fluid Inputs:Â§r

This one is... more difficult. Fluid Pipes behave very different compared to Item Pipes, so you Â§4cannotÂ§r use the same solution as above. You can automate the fluids in a few different ways: Â§3crafting cells of fluidsÂ§r or AE2FCR with Â§3Fluid Packet DecodersÂ§r. The decoder route is much better, and involves outputting the fluids as fluid packets directly, then decoding them in the right location. This quest won't explain how to do this entirely due to it being off by default, so the full solution is left as an exercise to the reader.

Â§eConfigsÂ§r: If you find this mechanic unfun, it can be disabled with the config Â§5"B:orderedAssembly"Â§r for Ordered Items and Â§5"B:orderedFluidAssembly"Â§r for Ordered Fluids. We strongly encourage you to try Ordered Items out before disabling it right away.

Â§oFeeling scientific?Â§r

This quest will explain a mechanic of the Assembly Line: Â§dResearchÂ§r.

Recipes in the assembly line will often require Research. This means you need to do a few extra things before the recipe will run. You'll notice there's a second tab in Â§3JEIÂ§r: Â§dThe ScannerÂ§r. Recipes needing Research will also have the output show in the Scanner's page.

Â§9ScanningÂ§r:

Scanning is the first step for research. Take the item shown in JEI and put it with a Â§3Data StickÂ§r to scan it. This will Â§4consumeÂ§r the item and put Data on the Data Stick. Pretty straightforward, right?

You will need at least an Â§6HV ScannerÂ§r to progress to Â§dLuVÂ§r, an Â§5EV ScannerÂ§r for Â§aLuV Energy HatchesÂ§r, and an Â§1IV ScannerÂ§r for Â§aFusion ReactorsÂ§r. You can make any one of them to complete this quest.

See the next quest for how to use these Â§3Data SticksÂ§r.

Â§9Data ManipulationÂ§r:

Eventually, you'll want multiple Assembly Lines, but you won't want to re-scan for every Research. This is why you can also use the Â§3ScannerÂ§r to Â§dCopy DataÂ§r. Place the data stick you want to copy in one slot, and a blank one in the other. This will copy the contents of the first stick into the second!

Â§4ImportantÂ§r: Using two different data sticks with data on them will cause one to Â§4overwriteÂ§r the other. Be careful!

Â§9Data StorageÂ§r:

Later on, recipes will require different Â§aData Storage ItemsÂ§r for research, such as the Â§3Data OrbÂ§r. This process will remain the same, but will use different Data Storage Items instead. They can also be copied the same way, but you cannot copy between different types of storage items.

Â§eConfigsÂ§r: If you find this mechanic unfun, it can be disabled with the config Â§5"B:enableResearch"Â§r. We strongly encourage you to try it out before disabling it right away, since it becomes very significant late game content as you progress further into research.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT5, Assembly Line recipes would be hidden in NEI until you completed research for them. After scanning the data stick, you could view the recipe's ingredients by printing a book with the Data Stick - a long and annoying process! It was then made to display in NEI once you acquire the item.
TecTech later made a nice machine which acts as a recipe viewer for the Data Stick (this mod is so great...).

Â§oWho needs hard drives anyways?Â§r

Once scanned, the Â§3Data Stick tooltipÂ§r will be updated to show what things it can be used to make in the Assembly Line. Put this data stick into a Â§dData Access HatchÂ§r. 

The Assembly Line will now be able to run all the recipes provided by Data Sticks. You'll want one Data Stick for each research, to avoid re-scanning many times.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: In GT5u, this hatch only had 4 slots, which meant you had to constantly swap data sticks around until you could make a larger one!

Â§oTime to build a server room!Â§r

The Â§3Data BankÂ§r is a multiblock capable of storing huge amounts of data. You can fill it with Â§aData Access HatchesÂ§r, and fill those with Â§aData Storage ItemsÂ§r.

After that, you'll need power, and then a way to connect it to your Assembly Line! This is done through Â§3Optical Fiber CablesÂ§r, which can be used to link Â§3Optical Data Hatches togetherÂ§r.

An Â§9Optical Transmission HatchÂ§r is used to send data (like an output), and an Â§9Optical Reception HatchesÂ§r recieve the data (like an input). 

Optical cables have some restrictions however. They can only connect Â§eone input to one outputÂ§r. The Data Bank is a solution to this, since you can place many hatches on them to route in different directions.

You can use this behavior to Â§echainÂ§r Data Banks as well. Connecting one Data Bank to another, and then one of them to an Assembly Line will provide the data of both banks!

Â§eNote: Â§rThis multiblock will be required later on in progression, but is very useful to set up early.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This multiblock also originates from TecTech, but it required optical cables to be painted as well. You don't have to do that here, but it looks really nice if you do!

Â§oMore than a large transformer.Â§r

The Â§3Active TransformerÂ§r is a multiblock used to transform energy on a much larger scale. For example, you can convert HV to LV power directly, by using the appropriate energy hatches.

It also has a second function, detailed in the next quest.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This is yet another feature from TecTech, which also required these cables to be painted. They too look really good if you paint them, but it is again optional.

Â§oTime for some lasers!Â§r

The Â§3Active TransformerÂ§r has a second use, Â§6Laser PowerÂ§r. Lasers are like superconductors, but behave slightly differently. They share the energy input across all connected active transformers, allowing widespread power distribution. Â§3Active TransformersÂ§r are used to convert regular EU to and from Lasers.

Like optical cables, they can only be connected to Â§eone input and outputÂ§r. But, these ones also only can move in Â§estraight linesÂ§r. To turn them, an Â§3Active TransformerÂ§r with a Laser Source Hatch (output) and Target Hatch (input) is needed.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This is yet again another TecTech feature, but there's a bit more too it this time. TecTech's carried 1000s of amps and caused some extreme power inflation in the GTNH late to end game.

Â§oYour research adventures continue!Â§r

The Â§3Research StationÂ§r is the upgrade to the Scanner. It is used for more advanced forms of research. It will allow you to perform research which requires Â§aData Orbs and ModulesÂ§r.

When running the Â§3Research StationÂ§r, energy and Â§9ComputationÂ§r is needed. The latter is provided through an Â§9HPCAÂ§r, which is explained in the next quest. It is recieved with a Â§3Computation Data Reception HatchÂ§r. Note that only one Reception Hatch is allowed in a Research Station.

This multiblock needs computation Â§dsporadicallyÂ§r, which means the recipe will not reverse progress if you don't supply enough. It will simply halt in-place. It will also not progress at all without meeting at least the minimum computation rate. The machine will still draw energy constantly, even when recieving no computation however.

To scan items, the process is relatively similar. In the Â§3Object HolderÂ§r, place the target item in the center slot, and the data storage item in the other slot. Then provide computation, and the data storage item will be updated upon completion. When running, the target item will be Locked and cannot be removed.

Â§eNoteÂ§r: To form this multiblock the Â§3Object HolderÂ§r must face the controller.

Â§oThis isn't a quantum computer...Â§r

The Â§3High Performance Computation ArrayÂ§r, also known as the Â§3HPCAÂ§r, is the multiblock used to create Â§9ComputationÂ§r, measured in CWU/t (Compute-Work Units per tick).

The HPCA is a modular multiblock built out of different components. There are Â§a9 slots availableÂ§r for different components, and there are some example layouts in the JEI previews.

There are two main types of components:
- Â§9Computation ComponentsÂ§r: These generate a certain amount of CWU/t and require EU/t and cooling.
- Â§9Cooling ComponentsÂ§r: These provide a certain amount of cooling, and require EU/t.

Currently Available Components:
- Â§9EmptyÂ§r: Fills a slot but otherwise does nothing.
-Â§9 Heat SinkÂ§r: Requires no power but provides 1 cooling.
- Â§9Active CoolerÂ§r: Requires power, PCB Coolant, but provides 2 cooling.
- Â§9ComputationÂ§r: Creates 4 CWU/t, but requires a lot of power and cooling.

The HPCA draws some power to idle. Power and cooling requirements are scaled between this idle upkeep power, and a maximum value depending on how much computation is being actively used.

If the HPCA is not given enough cooling, Computation components can be Â§4damagedÂ§r if it is running above Â§c100CÂ§r. The idle temperature is Â§a20CÂ§r. Only computation components can be damaged, and all other blocks will be unharmed.

The HPCA can only have 1 Â§3Computation Data Transmission HatchÂ§r. You can connect it to the Reception Hatch of the Â§9Research StationÂ§r with Optical Fiber Cable to transmit the computation.

Basic CWU/t Requirements for ZPM Tier:
- Â§a4 CWU/tÂ§r for Â§cZPMÂ§r Sensors, Emitters, and Field Generators
- Â§a8 CWU/tÂ§r for Â§cZPMÂ§r Enegy Hatches
- Â§a16 CWU/tÂ§r for Â§3UVÂ§r Circuits and beyond.

Don't feel forced to go for 16 CWU/t immediately. There's lots to do in between these milestones.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This mechanic is loosely inspired by TecTech's Quantum Computer, which is similar but has some much more annoying mechanics like the Uncertainty Resolver.

Â§oTime for some computational advancement!Â§r

Â§3Advanced HPCA ComponentsÂ§r are improved versions of their regular counterparts, and allow for increasing the computation you can produce from an HPCA.

The Â§3HPCA Advanced Computation ComponentÂ§r produces Â§a4xÂ§r the computation for only Â§a2xÂ§r the Cooling!

Â§oWith our powers combined...Â§r

The Â§3Network SwitchÂ§r allows multiple HPCAs to be used in conjunction with each other! This allows you to provide far more computation to your Â§aResearch StationÂ§r.

HPCAs can be connected to Â§3Network SwitchesÂ§r with transmission and reception hatches, and then the Network Switch can output to a Â§aResearch StationÂ§r with another transmission hatch.

HPCAs cannot connect to Â§3Network SwitchesÂ§r by default, and each connected HPCA requires an Â§3HPCA Bridge ComponentÂ§r to enable this functionality.

Â§oDefinitely isn't terrible for both you and the environment...Â§r

Â§3Dielectric PCB CoolantÂ§r is used for highly advanced late and end-game machinery.

You only need a little bit in Â§dLuVÂ§r, but you'll want to automate it in Â§cZPMÂ§r tier.

Â§oCentralized Power at last!Â§r

The Â§3Power SubstationÂ§r is a multiblock power storage system. Fill it with Â§a2-18 layersÂ§r of assorted Â§9Capacitor BlocksÂ§r to increase its storage. Each layer must be full of capacitors, and you can use Empty Capacitors to fill unused spaces.

Â§9CapacitorsÂ§r also hold significantly more energy than the batteries used to make them. In the Â§3Power SubstationÂ§r, Â§9CapacitorsÂ§r can be mixed, so they do not all have to be the same tier.

At Â§1IVÂ§r Tier, you can make Â§5EVÂ§r and/or Â§1IVÂ§r Capacitors.

Energy is input with regular Energy Hatches, and output with regular Dynamo Hatches.

You can also use Â§9Substation HatchesÂ§r to transmit many more amps. These hatches only work in Substations, and do not work in regular multiblocks.

Â§oIncreased Storage Density!Â§r

This hatch allows you to store more Â§aData Storage ItemsÂ§r than the basic one.

Don't forget that this hatch requires a Â§9Data OrbÂ§r for research.

Â§oData storage sure is expensive...Â§r

The Â§3Data ModuleÂ§r is required for Endgame Research. Â§aAssembly LinesÂ§r cannot read from it using Â§aData Access HatchesÂ§r directly, and instead require the Â§9Data BankÂ§r.

Â§oFinally... no more interfaces on buses!Â§r

The Â§3ME HatchesÂ§r directly connect to your Â§aAE SystemÂ§r, allowing you to skip placing interfaces directly on buses and hatches.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This feature originally comes from GTNH!

Â§oWondering how to move that oil around?Â§r

Â§3Long-Distance Fluid PipesÂ§r can be used to send fluids across great distances. Place one endpoint at each end, and connect them with pipeline blocks.

These pipes instantly transfer from the input side to the output side.

They also have a minimum distance between pipe endpoints, so you can't use these for short-range operations.

Â§oWondering how to move those ores around?Â§r


Â§3Long-Distance Item PipesÂ§r can be used to send items across great distances. Place one endpoint at each end, and connect them with pipeline blocks.

These pipes instantly transfer from the input side to the output side.

They also have a minimum distance between pipe endpoints, so you can't use these for short-range operations.

Â§oFeeling attracted yet?Â§r

Â§aMagnetic SamariumÂ§r requires an Â§3IV PolarizerÂ§r.

The Â§3IV Cutting MachineÂ§r is required to unlock Â§3IV Energy & Dynamo HatchesÂ§r, you know you do.

Upgrading it to the Â§2Gregicality MultiblocksÂ§r version is a wise decision.

This block allows you to encode patterns with up to Â§b36Â§r total inputs and Â§b8Â§r total outputs! 

If you need to make something in huge batches, this is the tool for you!

Â§eNote:Â§r This block does not connect to an ME system, so don't get rid of your old Pattern Terminals.

A quick note on Â§aIridiumÂ§r and Â§aOsmiumÂ§r. 

You can technically obtain these materials now, but you should wait until you reach Â§9IVÂ§r tier. Producing these materials takes a lot of power, and you won't be able to smelt them into ingots until Â§9IVÂ§r anyway.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Iridium, Osmium, and The EV Tier

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oYou probably have some old machines lying around, right?Â§r

You definitely know by now that Arc Furnaces can recycle machines, but starting at Â§5EVÂ§r they upgrade to Â§a9 slotsÂ§r!

Â§eNoteÂ§r: This quest accepts either an Â§5EVÂ§r or Â§9IVÂ§r Arc Furnace. You don't have to make both.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Getting Rid of Those Old Machines

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oVisions of GT++Â§r

The Â§aAlloy Blast SmelterÂ§r is the only main Â§2GCYMÂ§r machine available in the Â§5EVÂ§r Tier. You can use it to produce any alloy you would normally use the Mixer for. 

Instead of producing Hot Ingots, the ABS produces Â§9Molten FluidsÂ§r if the recipe is hot enough. These fluids require cooling with a Vacuum Freezer. Otherwise it produces regular liquids.

Don't be afraid of some long smelting times. This machine incorporates the Mixer step directly into the smelting recipe, and actually saves you quite a bit of time over smelting the dust in an EBF!

Nearly every Â§2GCYMÂ§r material is produced in this machine, so if you have trouble finding a mixer recipe, look for a molten fluid!

Â§bLoreÂ§r: This multiblock was originally inspired by GT++. It did not use heating coils at all, had no temperature requirements, and only produced regular liquids for all materials. It was pretty OP back in the day, but it was later restricted to only a single energy hatch to balance it out. It for some reason also allowed you to cook any dust into liquid too.

The Â§aBeam FormerÂ§r is an alternative to using ME Cable.

Place one at each end of a straight run, and it will form a beam between them! This beam will send the AE singal between each side.

The beam has a range of Â§e32 blocksÂ§r between the endpoints, not including them.

These beams also have the GT bloom effects too!

If the beam is blocked, the connection will un-form. Doing this using redstone (such as pistons) technically makes it possible to shut off different sections of the system, but doing so can be Â§claggyÂ§r. As an extension of this, avoid the toggle bus as well - it has the same problem.

Walking through the beam does not block it!

The Â§aInterface P2P TunnelÂ§r is an upgraded version of Â§9Item/Fluid P2P TunnelsÂ§r.

The input side is placed on an ME Interface containing patterns. It can have multiple outputs, which should connect to inventories.

When multiple crafts of a single pattern are requested, the P2P Tunnel will evenly distribute the crafts between all of the connected outputs.

The Interface P2P Tunnel also respects Â§eBlocking ModeÂ§r, which is set in the interface containing the patterns.

It additionally works with Â§9Fluid InterfacesÂ§r and Â§9Dual InterfacesÂ§r.

NAE2 adds Â§aDense Crafting CPUsÂ§r which provide a lot more bytes in a lot less space!

It also adds Â§aDense CoprocessorsÂ§r which allow you to power up your Crafting CPUs to perform more tasks simultaneously!

These cells will void Â§cÂ§lÂ§neverythingÂ§r inserted into them.

Filter them with a Â§9Cell WorkbenchÂ§r to make sure nothing important gets lost!

They also store the amount of items voided, and can produce items in the Â§9Matter CondenserÂ§r using the voided items. This can be very useful for producing AE2 Singularities, for example.

The Â§aPattern MultitoolÂ§r does A LOT!

Â§2Blank Pattern Storage:Â§r
R-clicking the tool will open a gui where you can insert Â§9Blank PatternsÂ§r. Add regular Â§9Capacity CardsÂ§r to increase the slots. Opening any Â§9Pattern TerminalÂ§r with the tool in your inventory or in a bauble slot will utilize Blank Patterns from these slots. You can also view this pattern storage GUI from any Pattern Terminal.

Â§2Bulk Pattern Modification:Â§r
Inserting Â§9Encoded PatternsÂ§r instead of blank ones will allow you to multiply/divide/add/subtract them all at once in bulk. Division and subtraction is enabled while holding Â§ashiftÂ§r. This GUI also shows up in the Â§9Interface TerminalÂ§r or any Â§9ME Item/Fluid/Dual InterfaceÂ§rÂ§r. This is particularly useful when multiplying up your patterns for parallel on-demand machinery.

Patterns can also be cleared in bulk with the "Clear" button. There is a confirmation after clicking it, but use with caution.

Â§2Item Search and Replace:Â§r
R-clicking the tool and opening the Â§aReplace tabÂ§r will bring up a new GUI. This GUI will allow you to replace all occurrences of one item with another for the Â§9Encoded PatternsÂ§r stored within the tool. Successful replacements are highlighted in Â§agreenÂ§r, and invalid patterns in Â§credÂ§r. This is particularly useful for Â§eupgrading GT circuitsÂ§r, such as transitioning from Nano to Quantum EV circuits.

Â§2Easy Pattern Transfer:Â§r
Shift-LClicking patterns will move them between the player inventory and the multitool where possible. This means you can easily move patterns around between interfaces and terminals without clogging your inventory.

Â§2In-Place Editing:Â§r
Rclicking an Â§9ME Item/Fluid/Dual InterfaceÂ§r will display the interface's patterns in the multitool. This will allow you to easily modify the patterns inside it without having to manually move them back and forth.

Â§bLoreÂ§r: Neeve, the author of the NAE2 mod suggested tiering this item at Â§eUXVÂ§r tier, because it "gives the player way too much power." For reference, Â§eUXVÂ§r is 4 tiers past Â§3UVÂ§r tier, two tiers before Â§cÂ§lMAXÂ§r voltage.

These upgraded Â§aAcceleration CardsÂ§r massively increase the speed of Â§9ME IO PortsÂ§r.

If you're moving huge amounts of items or fluids between cells, this is the card for you.

The Â§aAdvanced Memory CardÂ§r allows for much greater control and efficiency when setting up Â§9P2PsÂ§r.

You can use the card on any Â§9P2P tunnelÂ§r connected to an Â§9AE2Â§r network, and it allows you to rename, rebind, link, or cycle the mode of any other Â§9P2PÂ§r on the network. You can also use it to reset all connections on a Â§9P2P tunnelÂ§r.

Â§bLore:Â§r The Â§aAdvanced Memory CardÂ§r is from Â§2Betterer P2PÂ§r, which is a fork of Â§2Better P2PÂ§r, integrating features from GTNH's fork of the mod.

This hatch acts like an infinite water source for multiblocks! It can make some setups much more convenient, and also has effectively infinite throughput so it doesn't have the limitations of the Â§9Infinite Water Source CoverÂ§r not being fast enough.

The ME Storage Exposer can - as its name suggests - expose the contents of your ME network to any attached inventory.

For instance, if you place it on an Input Bus, the Bus will be able to view anything contained within your network. This can be incredibly powerful when paired with appropriately-filtered Conveyor Modules or Robot Arms. You may want to integrate this into your Â§6Ore ProcessingÂ§r in future.

Â§7This thing is seriously powerful...

The Â§dProgrammed Circuit CardÂ§f will take your autocrafting capabilities to the next level - if used in an Interface, you can now send patterns containing Â§9Programmed GregTech CircuitsÂ§f, and the Interface will tell the machine to switch its Circuit!

Of course, such power does not come cheap, and you are encouraged to parallelize your processing instead of bottlenecking on a single machine, but this card is incredibly useful in many setups.

Oh, and Â§4don'tÂ§f forget Â§eBlocking ModeÂ§f!

The Job Auto-Complete Card allows your Interfaces to inform your ME Network that a performed recipe has been completed, Â§bregardlessÂ§f of whether the expected output has actually been crafted.

A possible use-case for this would be to pattern the "ingredient" blocks required to construct a LCR, and then use an Â§6Auto-Complete CardÂ§f so that the craft does not hang. Now, you can order Â§aentire multiblocksÂ§f from the comfort of your Terminal!

Welcome to Â§2Â§lGregTech: The Community ModpackÂ§r.
