This modpack features Â§2Â§lGregtech: Community Edition UnofficialÂ§r (also known as Â§2GTCEuÂ§r or Â§2CEuÂ§r), a continuation of GTCE. This mod provides a lot more content through all the tiers and up to Â§dUltimate VoltageÂ§r, and a non negligible amount Quality of Life.

This is a pure Â§4TechÂ§r modpack, focusing on GregTech and its progression.

You will find no better place to learn about this mod and all the features it adds!

Â§6This questbook is very informativeÂ§r, so check it out to learn anything new about the mod. Click on the EyeÂ§r icon to toggle Â§9View ModeÂ§r to read any quest ahead of time. This is one of many features added by Â§2Better Questing UnofficialÂ§r, yet another great port of a mod.


Â§bLore:Â§r At the time of writing this, a few players have already completed the modpack. They thoroughly enjoyed it! GTCEu really is what GTCE should have been.

Â§4Â§lBe sure to properly read this quest to not get lost during your playthrough.Â§r


Informative Quests such as this will appear in both the chapter it is unlocked, and the Information chapter. Regularly come back to the Â§9"Tips and Tricks" TabÂ§r if you feel like you forgot something.


Quest outlines are merely the main goals. Â§6Every single Quest is extremely important or provides crucial InformationÂ§r. Â§cIf something is optional, it will be statedÂ§r.


Modpack can be played on Â§dPeacefulÂ§r, and we recommend you to do so. You may also use the keepInventory Gamerule and abuse minimap teleport as you see fit. This modpack is not focusing on survival.


Make good use of Â§2JEIÂ§r. Items have several recipes, so do not stop at the first displayed. Identify patterns in autogenerated recipes (example: all the Iron related items macerating into Iron Dusts). When complex recipes arise, we will make sure to Â§6guide youÂ§r through the best path to a product.

Â§oA minecraft adventure starting with Wood!? This is truly unoriginal, I want a refund...Â§r

If you're familiar with Â§2GregTechÂ§r, you may be aware of nerfed vanilla recipes. We have a few of them. However Wood to Planks is unchanged, rejoice!

Here, get some food. If you're playing on Peaceful, put it on a display.

Here's a list of some of the things you'll be needing for early game. Collect more than in this quest, you will need more.

I would advise doing this quest first and take the Â§6RewardÂ§r. That way you can do a little bit of main Progression Â§obeforeÂ§r being required to go mining.

Rubber Trees are found in Â§2ForestÂ§r, Â§2JungleÂ§r or Â§2SwampÂ§r Biomes.

EightÂ§r Furnaces might seem excessive. But trust me, you will want them.

Â§oGlass, at last!Â§r

Use Mortars or a Macerator (your choice!) to microcraft your way to Glass Dust, which you can then turn into a Â§aGlass blockÂ§r.
Glass will be easier later on. I am certain you have noticed that juicy Arc Furnace recipe.

Glass tubes will be required for Electronic Circuits, so make some!

Â§oSome of the details are repeated from the introduction quest, but we feel like we needed to expand on the explanation if you want to know all the details!Â§r

The veins and their details can be found in Â§2JEIÂ§r. They contain up to four different ores.

Â§dSurface rocksÂ§r indicate the type of veins that are below them. In Â§2JEIÂ§r, press U on the Tiny Dust you mined from the rock and navigate to the Â§aOre PageÂ§r. This page contains details on what types of ores generate, their generation patterns, their spawning dimension and Y-level range, and their spawning weight, which is the chance it spawns.

Ore veins generate in a Â§4GridÂ§r. Every vein is spaced by 3 chunks from one to another in a cardinal direction.
They spawn at the Â§4CenterÂ§r of the Chunks which have both their X and Z coordinates be at Â§b1 plus a multiple of 3Â§r (-8, -5, -2, 1, 4, 7, ...).

It will be simpler if you simply rely on Â§2In Game InfoÂ§r displayed in the top left corner. In most cases there will be a Â§dSurface RockÂ§r in the Center of the Chunk, which provides completely accurate information for the Ore Vein.

However Ore veins may be deleted by caves, Oil deposits, or from trying to generate above the ground.

It's a good practice to make Â§dWaypointsÂ§r to every vein you find, and to label their type. You may want to come back to it several times.

This modpack also includes the mod Â§dVisualOresÂ§r, which will mark discovered veins on your map. Â§9Right ClickÂ§r an ore block in the vein to add it to the map. You can toggle the ore vein view in the lower left corner of the fullscreen map.


Each Ore vein is always Â§d7 blocksÂ§r tall, and ores generate in 4 different patterns:
- The Â§9Top OreÂ§r generates in the higher 4 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Bottom OreÂ§r generates in the lower 3 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Between OreÂ§r generates in the middle 3 layers of the vein.
- The Â§9Sporadic OreÂ§r generates anywhere in the vein. There will be the least amount of this ore in a vein.
The same ore type can be in 2 different generation patterns, such as in Cassiterite veins.
Â§


In Â§6LVÂ§r Age, you can craft an Ore Prospector to assist yourself in finding ores.

Â§oDid you know GregTech has tools equivalent to vanilla tools? Did you know some of them are actually better?Â§r

Here, the Â§aAxeÂ§r for example, this one is a beast! Mine a Wood Log and it will Â§6fell the entire treeÂ§r for you! Who needs Ore Excavation? Not me, not you!

Their durability wears down really fast, so you may want to make them out of Diamond (but not the vanilla diamond Axe, no!).

Take these spruce saplings to grow 2x2 giant trees. There's a lot of smelting coming up, and wooden planks are a surprisingly very effective fuel source.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.
betterquesting:10.name:8: I must Axe you two Questions

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oWrought Iron has a very low carbon content, but that's enough to make it tougher than regular Iron.Â§r

GregTech Tools made of Â§aWrought IronÂ§r are Â§650% more durableÂ§r than with regular Iron.

You can make it from Â§asmelting Iron NuggetsÂ§r, and Â§arecombining the NuggetsÂ§r. Do not convert all your Iron as it is not interchangeable.

Here's your Introduction to GregTech tools. Something that may confuse you is how JEI displays iron tools. But in fact you can make the tools off Â§dmany materialsÂ§r. The first one is Iron, or Wrought Iron if you read that quest.


Â§9Â§lHammer:Â§r A crafting tool used to for a lot of early game recipes. It also works as a mining tool for ores to crush them, more information on that later. Its last function is to mute machines by Â§msmackingÂ§r right-clicking them.

As an additional on Â§lallÂ§r GregTech tools. You can Â§6repairÂ§r them in an Â§6AnvilÂ§r using the material of the tool itself, like any vanilla tool! Â§dBottles o' EnchantingÂ§r are craftable too.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oThis hammer is very different. It's a pickaxe, but also not. It's a Â§dÂ§o3x3 pickaxeÂ§rÂ§o!Â§r

Make good use of this! You want it, I know it! This bad boy will give you so many ores in no time, given you are in a vein.

Â§3DrawersÂ§r are configured to Â§6keep their InventoryÂ§r when broken, so you can use them for your mining expeditions.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oIron is very abundant! And not just in the form of pure Iron Ore. In reality, Iron is found in a lot of oxide forms or minerals.Â§r

The Â§dOre GenerationÂ§r tab in this questbook tells you which types of materials come from which ore veins. The Ore Spawn Information and Ore Byproduct List tabs in Â§2JEIÂ§r list them as well.

Take a look at those tabs for Â§bÂ§aIronÂ§r. Any of the Ores listed here can be smelted directly to Iron. That is Â§dfour different veinsÂ§r that virtually have Iron Ore.

Do not bother about ore processing yet. Â§aDirect smelting will be the most efficient for a whileÂ§r, given how easy it is to obtain a lot of ores.


Gather Â§eanyÂ§r of the Iron yielding Ores to complete this quest.

More GregTech tools are required for progression, here are the most important of them all.

Â§9Â§lWrench:Â§r A crafting tool. But also a mining tool for GregTech machines (perfect if you think using pickaxes is unethical). Is that it? Certainly not! It has right click functions to double as a Forge Â§6Wrench for other modsÂ§r. Right Click also allows you to set the output side of GregTech machines. Shift right clicking allows you to rotate GregTech machines.

Â§9Â§lFile:Â§r A crafting tool. And that's it. Yes.

Â§9Â§lSaw:Â§r Another crafting tool. If we were evil, we would force it to obtain 4 Planks and 4 Sticks from their respective crafting recipes. That said you can still use it to get Â§a6 Planks per LogÂ§r, if you wish.


Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

More tools, not important right now, but required later on.

Â§9Â§lScrewdriver:Â§r A crafting tool. It is used for special configuration of machines and Covers.

Â§9Â§lWire Cutter:Â§r A crafting tool. It is needed to connect wires together. Right-clicking on wires will enable or disable connection to other blocks.

Â§9Â§lMortar:Â§r A crafting tool, to grind various things into dust form.

Â§9Â§lKnife:Â§r A mediocre weapon, but also... you guessed it, a crafting tool!

Â§9Â§lSoft Mallet:Â§r A tool to pause machines from working with right-click. Right-clicking again resumes working.

There are a few Â§dother ToolsÂ§r which are less important, but deserve a mention.

Â§9Â§lCrowbar:Â§r A niche tool to remove Covers from GregTech machines with a right-click.

Â§9Â§lScythe:Â§r A powerful farming tool, automatically breaks and re-plants crops in a large area. Also works as a good weapon!

Â§9Â§lPlunger:Â§r A tool to clear stuck fluids from GregTech machines.

Â§9Â§lButchery Knife:Â§r A weapon pre-enchanted with Looting III. Useful for getting extra food, Leather...

Â§eNote:Â§r This quest's reward is Â§9Damascus SteelÂ§r. A rare material which is only found in Â§ddungeon/worldgen lootÂ§r. It is much better than the materials you have access to right now, so be sure to use it!

Â§eNote:Â§r Any Quest with GregTech tools can be completed with the tool crafted from any material, not just the one displayed.

Â§oMaybe you thought forcing crafting with tools would make your life painful. I shall present you the solution: the Crafting Station.Â§r

The Â§3Crafting StationÂ§r is a highly Â§9advanced Crafting TableÂ§r, with inventory slots for item and tools. Put the recipes either by dropping ghost items, or using the Â§a+Â§r in Â§2JEIÂ§r. Crafting the items will use the items and tools in the inventory. The 9 slots on the right are saved up recipes so you can re-use them without re-opening Â§2JEIÂ§r.

What makes the Â§3Crafting StationÂ§r amazing, is the fact that Â§6it can use adjacent inventoriesÂ§r in addition to its own inventory. If you are familiar to playing with Applied Energistics, the Crafting Station is essentially a mini ME Crafting Terminal.


Â§bLore:Â§r The reason Nomifactory had Forestry in its modlist was primarily due to its Worktable, which serves a similar function to the Crafting Station. A couple more Forestry items were used, otherwise the whole mod's functionality was disabled!

Â§oThis will be the first Project, or will it be?Â§r

The Â§3Coke OvenÂ§r makes Â§aCoke from CoalÂ§r, or Â§aCharcoal from WoodÂ§r, in addition to Â§dCreosoteÂ§r as bonusÂ§r output.
Â§dCreosoteÂ§r can be used as furnace fuel toÂ§6 smelt 32 itemsÂ§r, and is required for making Â§dTreated Wood PlanksÂ§r (rings a bell?).

The amount of resources required is listed in the first Â§eoptionalÂ§r task.
Check the Â§2JEI Multiblock PreviewÂ§r for the structure pattern.

Â§9Note:Â§r Â§lAnyÂ§r Brick block can be replaced with a Â§3Coke Oven HatchÂ§r as seen in the last Â§eoptionalÂ§r task. You can have up to five of them.
The Hatch allows for automation. It will Â§dauto-exportÂ§r both Fluid and Items with it! It also works for insertion into the Coke Oven (you can use Hoppers).


If the Coke Oven happens to fully fill up on Creosote that you are not using, break and replace the Coke Oven block. Automated fluid voiding is available later in the game.


Â§bLore:Â§r The concept of Multiblocks is very old in modded Minecraft. Think of IndustrialCraft 2's Nuclear Reactor, or Railcraft's Coke Oven; they were revolutionary at the time.

Gather more resources, namely Â§aCopperÂ§r and Â§aTinÂ§r.

Check the ore tab to find out which veins they come from.

You can tell at a glance the element types within most ores (and most other materials) with the Â§emolecular formulaÂ§r in the tooltip. Copper is Â§dCuÂ§r, Tin is Â§dSnÂ§r, Iron is Â§dFeÂ§r, and you can consult a Â§dperiodic tableÂ§r for most of the others.

This quest can be completed with Â§eeitherÂ§r metal, so you can claim as the reward the metal you're missing. Be sure to find a source of both soon though, as you will need a lot of both to get through the Steam Age.

Â§oHumanity's first Alloy, and yours too!Â§r

Â§6BronzeÂ§r is an alloy of Â§aCopperÂ§r and Â§aTinÂ§r. Grind down 3 parts Copper and 1 part Tin into dust, then combine and smelt them. You will need a Â§5MortarÂ§r from the "More Tools" Quest.

Make many more Â§aBronze IngotsÂ§r than what is called for here. This will be your main material for the Steam Age, and you will need lots of it.

Â§6The progression now continues in the Steam Age chapter.Â§r


Â§bLoreÂ§r: Bronze in real life is closer to 7 parts Copper and 1 part Tin. Here (and in most of the rest of modded Minecraft) it sadly has to be changed for game balance. Many more such cases!

Â§oThe bucket recipe is changed, it now requires Plates. #realismÂ§r

Â§dPlates are used everywhereÂ§r in GregTech. You make them Â§ausing two IngotsÂ§r thanks to your newly made Â§5HammerÂ§r. Better recipes for Plates will be unlocked later.


Here, take this Wooden Barrel full of Water as a reward. You may ask why? No reason! Ah, just as a way to teach you that all GTCEu tanks are portable!

Why is this chapter called Steam Age again?
Anyways, you have access to three types of boilers. I recommend you start with the Coal Boiler as it is the cheapest to make, and is easy to maintain (the fuel consumption is tiny!).

Craft Â§eanyÂ§r of the boilers to complete this quest.

Â§oWhy is this chapter called Steam Age again? It can't be due to this machine, can it?Â§r

Anyways... The Â§3Solid BoilerÂ§r is the only available Boiler for now, as the Glass needed for the others is not available. Make one, or two.

Â§cImportant:Â§r Boilers can Â§cexplodeÂ§r! Water does not mess too well with high temperatures, and a steam explosion may occur under the following conditions:
Â§9-Â§r The Boiler is hot, shown by the red bar in the GUI
Â§9AND
-Â§r The Boiler has no water, signified by the absence of blue bar
Â§9AND
-Â§r The Boiler receives waterÂ§r

You can be perfectly safe by filling the boiler with water before heating it up, and making sure it has water constantly. The drain is slow - Â§a1 mBÂ§r of Water boils into Â§a160 mBÂ§r of Steam - so you don't have to worry too much.

The Boiler will auto eject steam on all faces except bottom. For automated Water input, use the bottom face.


Â§9Note:Â§r In this modpack, explosions are configured to not damage any block or entity, but you still lose your machine!

Â§oThe Alloy Smelter makes alloys... The name didn't state it clearly enough.Â§r

Use it for more Â§6efficient BronzeÂ§r, and for future alloys.

This is the most Steam hungry machine out of all of them. If you ever run out of steam, whack your machine with the Â§5Soft MalletÂ§r to pause it momentarily.

Steam Machines accept Steam into their internal storage tank, piped from Boilers.

Steam machines will run recipes from JEI up to Â§aUsage: 32 EU/t (LV)Â§r. EU may be the Energy Unit for Electric machines, but the Steam machines will run using a proportional amount of steam.
Regular Steam Machines are Â§9twice as slowÂ§r as indicated by JEI.
High Pressure Steam Machines are the same speed as indicated by JEI, with adjusted steam consumption. You will unlock them once you obtain Â§dSteelÂ§r.


After each recipe, the Steam machines will vent some cooler steam (particles) from the side with the square. This is the exhaust port.
Â§cImportant:Â§r Keep the exhaust port unblocked, this is neither an input nor an output slot! If the machine fails to vent steam, it will stop working.
Â§9Reminder:Â§r Use your Wrench to change which side the exhaust port is facing (right-click).

Â§o
If you feel like sending yourself off to Heaven, I invite you to stand on top of pipes transporting steam, or you can also stand right in front of the vent as the machines are running recipes.Â§r

Â§oThe Steam Compressor compresses... I'm actually speechless.Â§r

I mean... that's it, nothing fancier. But you're unlocking new recipes for progression, mainly towards Â§9SteelÂ§r!

Â§oThe Forge Hammer hammers... That's fascinating!Â§r

A lot of recipes are the same as your hand crafting recipes using a Â§5HammerÂ§r, but instead uses this machine!

It can process Â§aCobblestone in GravelÂ§r, and Â§aGravel into SandÂ§r. And it's fast at that too!

Last but not least, it makes Plates at a better ratio: Â§6three Ingots for two PlatesÂ§r. A worthwhile investment!


You know what? Bonus! Get an anvil back from crafting it. This is a small reminder that you can repair GregTech tools using an Anvil.

Â§oThe Macerator macerates... I am done with this. (He isn't)Â§r

This means you can stop ruining your hands and destroying mortars grinding dusts by yourself, at the cost of time.

What this also means is Â§6Ore ProcessingÂ§r, but that's a scary topic presented in the next quest.
Â§cThe macerator will output only the first item shown in recipes from JEI!Â§r The other slots are locked until much later in the game (Â§6HVÂ§r Age to be precise).


Â§9My (important!) advice:Â§r it is better to Â§dkeep directly smeltingÂ§r ores for now! The efficiency loss is made up with fast mining.

Â§oThe Steam Extractor extracts... I cannot believe my own words.Â§r

Not many recipes are in the Â§3ExtractorÂ§r, but it is used for Â§9RubberÂ§r, which you will need after Steel.

You can also process Dirt in the Extractor for Â§aBonesÂ§r, which makes Â§aBone MealÂ§r for crops.

Â§oYour first Â§mbigÂ§rÂ§o Project! This one is for Steel!Â§r

The Â§3Primitive Blast FurnaceÂ§r (Â§3PBFÂ§r) is an inherently Â§5B A L A N C E DÂ§r multiblock. If you do not have a Â§3MaceratorÂ§r yet, this multiblock will be Â§lfour times as expensiveÂ§r.
Using the Â§3MaceratorÂ§r, you will need Â§d132 ClayÂ§r, split into Â§d66 Clay DustsÂ§r and Â§d66 Brick DustsÂ§r, as seen in the Â§eoptionalÂ§r task.

Build the structure using Â§4JEI previewÂ§r.

As for the Steel recipe, you will be rewarded if you used the Â§3Coke OvenÂ§r earlier, as each Steel Ingot only requires Â§aone CokeÂ§r instead of Â§atwo CoalÂ§r. Otherwise, you can simply use Â§aCharcoalÂ§r as it is mostly free.
Using Â§aWrought IronÂ§r cuts the recipe duration significantly... if you have the sanity to smelt thousands of nuggets beforehand.


Steel will be Â§9extremely important throughout the entire gameÂ§r, make a lot of it!
Steel also has Â§6double the durabilityÂ§r compared to regular Iron for GregTech tools. It also provides Â§6Diamond mining levelÂ§r, and is much faster!

Â§oSteel, the ShrÃ¶dinger alloy of all alloys. Made with a very small percentage of carbon in mass, it is significantly tougher than Iron or Wrought Iron.Â§r

One Â§3PBFÂ§r will most not likely cut it and be too slow. Make another one!

Did you know GregTech multiblocks can Â§dshare wallsÂ§r? This saves you a whole 12 Primitive Bricks for your second PBF.

What you may also do is upgrade to four Â§3PBFsÂ§r. It just depends on how much of an innate speedrunner you are.

Â§9Note:Â§r The Â§3PBFÂ§r cannot be reasonably automated, but putting blocks of Iron and Coke/Charcoal will guarantee it will run for a long time without any care.


Â§bLore:Â§r In GregTech 5, one single Ingot of Steel takes 360 seconds in the PBF when using Coal or Charcoal!
Pollution was also a thing, and four of these bad boys would guarantee your character would periodically get negative effects such as slowness, mining fatigue, or even nausea and poison.

The Â§3Primitive Water PumpÂ§r is your first way to automatically generate water for your boilers. It does not pump water from the world, instead it just creates it.

It is a multiblock, so consult Â§2JEIÂ§r for the structure. Also, multiblocks can be Â§6previewed in worldÂ§r if you sneak right-click the main Block with an empty hand.
Its functionality is fully explained in the description page in Â§2JEIÂ§r.

Small tip for you: no need to worry about Biome for now, as the boilers need very little water to keep up.

The Â§3Output HatchÂ§r is where water will be generated, you may have it face up or down to auto-output water into your pipes.
Â§9Reminder:Â§r Use a Â§5WrenchÂ§r to rotate GregTech blocks (sneak right-click).

Â§

Â§bLore:Â§r This Multiblock was ported from IMPACT, a 1.7.10 GregTech modpack which we appreciate greatly.

Grow Â§dRubber TreesÂ§r and cut them down to get Â§aSticky ResinÂ§r.

Â§oDid you think we would force you to use Treetaps...?Â§r

Â§oA little bit of exploring never hurts... right? Strech your legs.Â§r

Mine some Â§dSulfurÂ§r from the Nether.

Â§aPotions of Fire ResistanceÂ§r are Â§6craftableÂ§r!

Â§bLore:Â§r With the existence of Small Ores randomly scattered in GregTech 5, you could decide to mine enough in the Overworld to avoid the Nether Vein. It did require some dedication, though.
The Nether in GTQUÂ§f requires you to get the Nether Cake... Go check the Â§bMagicÂ§f questlines for more information!

Â§oPut that Resin into use! Rubber is an excellent insulation material, and that's exactly what it is gonna be used for.Â§r

Use the Â§3Alloy SmelterÂ§r to make Â§aRubber BarsÂ§r.
The ratios in the recipes start at a mediocre rate. In LV age, it will be a lot better.


Â§bLore:Â§r In base GregTech 5, and in base GTCE, you needed to get string and black wool carpets as your first insulation material. Â§mThat was obviously better and by farÂ§r.

Â§oRed Alloy is... well, completely fictional.Â§r

It is an alloy of Copper and Redstone used for conductivity.

You will need some for Â§9Electronic CircuitsÂ§r.

Â§bLore:Â§r This material originally comes from RedPower, what a throwback!

Â§3High Pressure BoilersÂ§r will be a better source of Steam to power your Steam machines.

Keep in mind energy conversion will use Steam to also power your Electric machines in the LV age.

Â§cNote:Â§r You will need more than a handful of Â§3HP BoilersÂ§r. The more you make, the easier it will be.

The Â§3Solid BoilerÂ§r burns solid Fuel. It's self explanatory.

The Â§3Liquid BoilerÂ§r burns either Â§dLavaÂ§r or Â§dCreosoteÂ§r.

The Â§3Solar BoilerÂ§r burns nothing, it works on solar energy.

Do you want a recommendation...? Well, you're out of luck, all of them are really good while having their own drawback. But I can tell you this: you will love the Advancement name from making an HP Solar Boiler.


Get Â§eanyÂ§r of the three proposed boilers to complete this quest.

If you remember in the Steam Information Quest, I told you how regular Steam machines had a duration penalty and were twice as slow.

High Pressure Steam machines no longer have any duration penalty for recipes, making them clear upgrades.

Make Â§eoneÂ§r of the proposed HP machines to complete this quest.

To its simplest form, Ore Processing in GregTech boils down to Â§aconverting one ore into two ingots through two dustsÂ§r, like several other tech mods.

The added spice is the amount of steps, either optional or required. This small guide is an Â§dintroduction to Ore ProcessingÂ§r.
The main purpose of GregTech Ore Processing is to provide Â§abyproductsÂ§r on top of the initial outcome. At Steam Age, none of the byproducts are obtainable.

Â§9The steps available in Steam Age go as follows:Â§r
One Ore (block) Â§9->Â§r Two Crushed Ores (Macerator)
One Crushed Ore Â§9->Â§r One Impure Dust (Hammer)
One Impure Dust Â§9->Â§r One Dust (Â§oIn world crafting explained belowÂ§r)
One Dust Â§9->Â§r One Ingot (Furnace, you should know this one)

A pickaxe or mining hammer enchanted with Hammering, or a GregTech Hammer directly gives Crushed Ores from breaking Ore blocks, but only at a 1:1 ratio. The Fortune enchantment can increase this ratio, to 2x with Fortune III, which matches the Macerator.

The rule bends for ores giving more than two dusts (such as redstone), and for dusts that cannot be smelted (redstone again!). Yet you can still do direct smelting to get half the amount you would from the full processing.

Â§dJEI does not indicate Impure Dust to Clean Dust conversionÂ§r, so keep that in mind that you should Â§athrow them into filled cauldronsÂ§r (full stacks at once to use less water).

Ore Processing will be explained further once you get into LV Age.


There, take this nice reward for your efforts learning this beautiful mess.

Â§oThe Steam Grinder's big brother. Or little brother, don't let him know.Â§r

The Â§3Steam OvenÂ§r is a great multiblock to Â§6effortlessly smelt large quantities of items.Â§r No more lines of furnaces that you have to manually empty and refuel.


As always, check Â§2JEIÂ§r for the structure.

Recipes are handled differently than in previous Multiblocks or Singleblocks machines.
The main block acts as the brain.
Inputs go into the Input Bus.
Outputs come out of the Output Bus.
The Steam Hatch is the heart, pump steam in to power the whole thing.

Â§9Note:Â§r Buses and Hatches Â§dautomatically import/exportÂ§r (depending on context) through their front face. This makes automation extremely easy. Simply place chests, drawers, anything you see fit next to their side with a dot.


Â§cWarning:Â§r This multiblock is much more expensive than your typical machines at this point. You will also need some alloys you have not crafted yet. Either be prepared to spend a lot of resources, or wait until you start LV Age (it will be easier).


Â§bLore:Â§r This Multiblock - despite being very similar to the Grinder - is not ported from a GregTech version or addon. Its actual origin is the Steam Oven from Railcraft, which dates back to 1.4.7!

Â§oThe Steam Oven's elder brother. Or perhaps it was the opposite?Â§r

The Â§3Steam GrinderÂ§r is Â§ltheÂ§r reason you will start doing Ore Processing. Â§6It can pulverize large batches of items fast and effortlessly.Â§r


As always, check Â§2JEIÂ§r for the structure.

Recipes are handled differently than in previous Multiblocks or Singleblocks machines.
The main block acts as the brain.
Inputs go into the Input Bus.
Outputs come out of the Output Bus.
The Steam Hatch is the heart, pump steam in to power the whole thing.

Â§9Note:Â§r Buses and Hatches Â§dautomatically import/exportÂ§r (depending on context) through their front face. This makes automation extremely easy. Simply place chests, drawers, anything you see fit next to their side with a dot.


Â§cWarning:Â§r This multiblock is much more expensive than your typical machines at this point. You will also need some alloys you have not crafted yet. Either be prepared to spend a lot of resources, or wait until you start LV Age (it will be easier).


Â§bLore:Â§r This Multiblock originally comes from GT++. It required Tumbaga to craft, an alloy with a mix of Gold and Bronze.

Make these molds, to be used for alloy smelting. Be sure to make Molds and not Extruder Shapes.

Take this reward, it will help you reduce the amount of malding by molding your gears.

Â§o*insert black&white paper gif*Â§r

Obtaining paper is both more difficult and less efficient than in vanilla.

You will need to grind Â§aSugar CanesÂ§r into Â§aChadÂ§r, and then press it with a mallet and water.

Â§9Note 1:Â§r The bucket is not consumed. You can use other fluid containers in the recipe, like Wooden Barrels, to make this easier.

Â§9Note 2:Â§r Make a Sugar Cane manual farm.

Â§9Note 3:Â§r As a reminder, Bone Meal can be used on Sugar Canes.

Â§9Note 4:Â§r In LV Age, you will be able to make Paper from Wood, if you want more.

Â§9Note 5:Â§r The Crafting Station makes this microcrafting absolutely trivial, use it!

Â§9Note 6:Â§r Paper will be used as a poor wrapping material for the upcoming resistors.

Â§9Note 7:Â§r I have a pleasure to share this moment with you, fellow Greg enjoyer.

Â§9Note 8:Â§r If you didn't notice the meme reference in the quest title and the italics... Nothing will happen, let's move on.

Â§oThe harder component for circuitsÂ§r

Vacuum Tubes are painful to make, hehe.
Wires and Sticks are sadly very expensive right now, but they will get cheaper in Â§7LVÂ§r Age.

Vacuum Tubes are also technically your first Ultra Low Voltage (Â§8ULVÂ§r) Circuit! You won't find very much use for these by themselves though.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Electronics Part Three: The Vacuum Tubes

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oThe circuiter part of circuits... Sorry I ran out of adjectivesÂ§r

Macerate Wood into Wood Pulp, then Compress it into Wood Plates. Combine it with Resin to make an empty board. Stick in some expensive copper wires (they will get cheaper in LV Age) and you have got the base for your first circuit.

Â§oThe easier component for circuitsÂ§r

You will want the recipes using Â§aFine WiresÂ§r as it will save you more materials overall.
This wire recipe is sadly expensive. But once you get to LV, they will become cheap.

Â§oThis quest technically requires all the previous quests it depends on, not just one. I figured it would be nice if you could see all the requirements ahead of time.Â§r

Your first Â§aElectronic CircuitÂ§r!! YEEEEEEEEHAAAAAW!!
Just kidding, you actually need three Circuits to get started anywhere relevant in the Â§7LVÂ§r Age. Thankfully for you, a generous donator under the name of Mr. Questbook Writer decided to give you the third Circuit.

Here, I'm also throwing a Â§aLV Machine HullÂ§r in this quest. That's what you need to make any Â§7LVÂ§r machine! I am feeling so generous, that this quest will grant you a second hull, free of charge!

Â§6Once you complete this Quest and the LV Motor Quest, you are ready to move on to the LV Age.Â§r

All machines typically have one Â§7Front FaceÂ§r, and one Â§9Output FaceÂ§r.
The Â§7Front FaceÂ§r should be obvious.
The Â§9Output FaceÂ§r is the face with a dot or hole on it. By default, this is at the back of the machine as you place it.

Machines can Â§aauto-outputÂ§r through their output face. To turn on auto-output, click the appropriate button in the GUI. Fluid and item auto-outputs are toggled separately. Further control over auto-outputs can be achieved with Â§dFiltersÂ§r and Â§dCoversÂ§r, which are explained in the quest to the left of this one.

Right-clicking a machine with a Â§5WrenchÂ§r changes the output side, and shift-right-clicking changes the front side. Keep in mind that the front side Â§ccannotÂ§r also be the output side! 

By default, items and fluids cannot be inserted through the output side, but this can be toggled with a Â§5ScrewdriverÂ§r. Either right-click the output face directly, or shift-right-click on the grid corresponding to the side of the output.


There are unique machines that do not process recipes, such as the Â§3PumpÂ§r, Â§3MinerÂ§r, Â§3FisherÂ§r, Â§3Item CollectorÂ§r...
These machines will output on their Front Face (which is still marked as a dot).

Â§oOne of the gatekeepers to the LV Age... You are getting close.Â§r

We are cutting down the retrieval task counts as you progress further into the modpack so you don't have to check several times which items to submit. Remember that Â§2JEI is your friendÂ§r if you forgot how to craft things!

Craft six Â§aLV Electric MotorsÂ§r! This may seem like a lot, but that's the bare minimum required to get to the good stuff in LV Age.


Â§6Once you complete this Quest and the Electronic Circuit Quest, you are ready to move on to the LV Age.Â§r

Â§oTo not confound with a certain man.Â§r

Â§aPotinÂ§r Fluid Pipes have a very Â§6high ThroughputÂ§r, for the material tier and cost, you may use this.

To get Â§aPotinÂ§r, look at the recipe for the Â§aDustÂ§r.

This quest calls for either the small or normal version, get Â§eeitherÂ§r to complete it.


Â§bLore:Â§r Potin Fluid Pipes were originally created in GT++, and were a huge power spike in GT:NH. Despite that fact, everybody seems to be enjoying them, and so we do too.
Also in reality, this is an alloy used in coins! Don't question the logic.

Â§oA crafting component, did you expect anything fancier?Â§r

Just like the LV Motor, it is used to craft LV machines.

Â§oA crafting component, but also a cover!Â§r
(Next quest explain how to interact with covers)


The pump, when placed on a machine, will transfer fluid. You can configure it to import or export.
It can accept a Â§9Fluid FilterÂ§r.

Â§oA crafting component, but also a cover!Â§r
(Next quest explains how to interact with covers)


The Conveyor Module, when placed on a machine, will transfer items. You can configure it to import or export.
This has a special interaction with Item Pipes to enable perfect Â§dRound RobinÂ§r.
It can also accept various Â§9Item FiltersÂ§r.

Â§oA crafting component, OH MY GOSH THIS ONE IS EXPENSIVE, but also a cover!Â§r
(Next quest explain how to interact with covers)


The Robot Arm, when placed on a machine, is a more advanced Conveyor Module. It lets you transfer items in specific batches, at specific rates, or keep a certain amount of items stocked.
Actual uses for the Robot Arm will be explained in future Quests as tutorial.

Â§9Note:Â§r The functionalities provided by the Robot Arm work Â§lonlyÂ§r if it is doing the operation.


Â§bLore:Â§r GregTech 5 had blocks such as the Buffer, Filter and Type Filter to allow fine control over items. In GTCE it's all been replaced by the almighty Robot Arm and various Filter Covers. That is a lot more compact!

Â§oCovers are ways to give your machines extra behavior without using any extra block space.Â§r

Covers are placed by right-clicking with it on a face of a machine, and removed with a Â§5CrowbarÂ§r (or by mining the machine, but that's too brutal!).

Pretty much any GregTech TileEntity will accept Covers, even if they provide no functionality.

Opening a Cover is done by shift-right-clicking it with an Â§5empty handÂ§r. You can also right-click with a Â§5ScrewdriverÂ§r, or shift-right-click on another face using the grid.

For the Covers transferring Items/Fluids, you will have a button to enable/disable other forms of transfer through the cover:
Â§9- Â§rDisabled: only the cover will be allowed to transfer on this machine side.
Â§9-Â§r Allow Filtered (only relevant with a filter!): other transfer will be enabled only if it matches the filter
Â§9-Â§r Allow Unfiltered: any other transfer is allowed on this machine side.

Placing a cover of a lower voltage tier on a machine is Â§9safeÂ§r.

Â§oYes, you will need more Steam production!
The Steam pressure will exert a force on the Turbines. Their rotation activate the Generator, producing Electricity.Â§r

The Â§3Steam TurbineÂ§r is the only Generator you can realistically use in the LV Age. Â§2Later you will unlock more Power optionsÂ§r.

Â§d2 Steam = 1 EUÂ§r


Â§lIntroduction to Â§9Â§lElectric Energy TransportationÂ§rÂ§l:Â§r

Â§1EUÂ§r - the Energy Unit - is transported through direct connection, Â§aWiresÂ§r or Â§aCablesÂ§r.
Wires are inferior, as they will Â§celectrocuteÂ§r you and Â§close more energyÂ§r, so you want to use Cables.

Â§cCable lossÂ§r means you will have to stick your Machines close to your Generators, but that kind of issue is only for the early game. If you look up ahead, you will be able to obtain Â§6SuperconductorsÂ§r down the line.

If you use one single Â§3Steam TurbineÂ§r, you may use Â§a1x Tin CablesÂ§r.
If you upgrade to Â§32 Steam TurbinesÂ§r, you should use Â§a2x Tin CablesÂ§r, else they may end up Â§cburningÂ§r.
This is because of the Â§9AmperageÂ§r mechanic... but that will be explained later so you can enjoy playing.


Â§9Note:Â§r GT6-style Cables are Â§denabledÂ§r. It means that placing Cables connect them only to the block they were placed against. To open more connections, use your Â§5Wire CutterÂ§r on the grid.
Â§2GTCEuÂ§r Cables now have Â§6native RF supportÂ§r! You can plug any RF appliance into an EU source and it will automatically convert. The ratio is Â§a4 : 1Â§r (RF : EU).

Â§oTechnically, you could make more or less any LV Machine, but I specifically want you to make the best one of them all first! I know, I know... You're asking where is your freedom of choice.Â§r

No more painful wires! This machine lets you make Â§6two Wires from one IngotÂ§r, that should be three times cheaper than what you were doing up until now!

To the right of this Quest are more important machines which will help you a lot to get cheaper intermediates.


Â§9Note:Â§r Recipes inside Â§3LV MachinesÂ§r go up to Â§aUsage: 32 EU/t (LV)Â§r. Anything higher than that and you will need a MV or even better machine instead. Needless to say that's for later.

You will need a Â§dProgrammed CircuitÂ§r for recipes. I'm sure you don't want to spend a precious circuit crafting one, so Â§6read the dedicated quest for important detailsÂ§r.


Â§oThis Quest's reward is wonderful. It's called freedom!
Overall rewards will also be less generous from now on.Â§r

Â§oArgueably the second best LV machine to craft, but the choice is yours!Â§r

This helps converting one Â§6Ingot into one PlateÂ§r, which is a better ratio than the Forge Hammer.

You will need a Â§dProgrammed CircuitÂ§r for recipes. I'm sure you don't want to spend a precious circuit crafting one, so Â§6read the dedicated quest for important detailsÂ§r.

Â§oThe Lathe lathes... We should probably rename these machines to avoid these terrible quest introductions!Â§r

An important machine to help shape metals. Thanks to it, you can turn Â§6one Ingot into two RodsÂ§r, and Â§6one Bolt into one screwÂ§r. That's twice the efficiency on those recipes as opposed to crafting.


Â§bLore:Â§r The GregTech 5 Lathe produces one Rod and 2 small piles of Dust per Ingot. We also have a setting for this in GTCEu, but it's turned off by default.
The Gregtech 6 Lathe acts like GT5's but bolts lathe into one screw and one 1/72 pile of dust. Cursed!

Â§oThe Polarizer polarizes... We're doing this again aren't we?Â§r

One of the cheapest - if not the cheapest - LV machine. Use this to make Â§6Redstone-free Magnetic RodsÂ§r for your Motors.

Â§oThis of a chemical reaction, either realistic, theorical or invented by the power of video gaming. The Chemical Reactor will create the conditions for it to happen, and TADAAA. You can also call this a magic box, if you want.Â§r


The Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r will be required for Â§la lotÂ§r of recipes.


Then, use your freshly made Chemical Reactor to unlock a new, Â§6better recipe for RubberÂ§r. It is Â§dunusableÂ§r as a Fluid, so you will need to make another machine next.

Make an Â§3SolidifierÂ§r to solidify directly into Â§aRubber SheetsÂ§r. You want this.

Make an Â§3Assembling MachineÂ§r to use the molten Rubber for Â§aCablesÂ§r. Not important for Tin Cables.


Â§eNote:Â§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in Â§lanyÂ§r tank in your inventory. A Drum is the perfect candidate.

Â§oAn Iron-Nickel Alloy.Â§r

It has Â§650% more durabilityÂ§r for GregTech tools compared to Iron, and is also faster. All tools made from it come with Â§6Efficiency IÂ§r, great for mining!

Â§aPlatinumÂ§r (needed for SMD Diodes) has its own dedicated Quest in the Â§5EVÂ§r tab.

Â§bLore:Â§r The SMD Inductors make an appearance in GTCEu for the first time. It's more consistent and convenient to have all Circuit components get a SMD counterpart.

Â§oThe concepts presented are for the curious players. Don't read past the TL;DR if you are not interested.Â§r

Â§6Â§lTL;DR:Â§r For safety, match the Â§2VoltageÂ§r for every Consumer and Producer, unless you like Â§cfireworksÂ§r...

This Quest will go into the Energy mechanics in more detail. If you have a basic understanding of electricity in Â§ereal lifeÂ§r, the GTEU system is not too different! An even more in-depth walkthrough will be found on the GTCEu wiki in Github.

The laws of physics:
Â° Â§9PowerÂ§r = Â§2VoltageÂ§r * Â§dAmperageÂ§r
Â° Â§1EnergyÂ§r = Â§9PowerÂ§r * Â§6TimeÂ§r
Â§8ResistanceÂ§r is an excluded concept in GregTech, it is instead simulated partially with cable losses.

The units:
- Â§1EUÂ§r is the Â§1EnergyÂ§r.
- Â§9EU/tÂ§r is the Â§9PowerÂ§r.
- Â§dAÂ§r or Â§dAmpÂ§r is the Â§dAmperageÂ§r.
- Â§2VÂ§r would be the Â§2VoltageÂ§r, but we prefer referring to it as Â§7LVÂ§r, Â§bMVÂ§r, Â§6HVÂ§r... as those are the relevant values for gameplay (technically: Â§7LVÂ§r = 32V = 32EU/t/A).

Here comes the Â§4dangerousÂ§r part:
Â§9-Â§r Â§aCablesÂ§r and Â§aWiresÂ§r which receive Â§2higher VoltageÂ§r than their rating will Â§cburnÂ§r, in additions to burning from too many Â§dAmpsÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Â§3MachinesÂ§r which receive Â§2higher VoltageÂ§r than their Tier will Â§cexplodeÂ§r! Extra Â§dAmpsÂ§r are not affecting them, as they consume only what they need.


Every Â§6tickÂ§r, Â§1EUÂ§r Â§apacketsÂ§r are being attempted to be transferred from Energy Producers to Consumers. These Â§apacketsÂ§r have two parameters: Â§2VoltageÂ§r determined by the tier of the Producer, and Â§dAmperageÂ§r. This determines how much Â§9PowerÂ§r can actually be transferred. There are no partial Amps, and Energy is transferred only if the full Amp Â§apacketÂ§r can be received.
In summary, Energy is transported in Â§apacketsÂ§r of Â§132EUÂ§r for Â§7LVÂ§r, Â§1128EUÂ§r for Â§bMVÂ§r... Energy that is actually received can be lower with cable loss.

Machine Energy Input is limited by Â§2VoltageÂ§r (too high and boom!), and by Â§dAmperageÂ§r. Thus, a Â§bMVÂ§r Machine with Â§d2AÂ§r Input connected to a Â§7LVÂ§r line will never accept more than Â§964EU/tÂ§r.
It is still possible to run Â§bMVÂ§r Machines on Â§7LVÂ§r lines, but only if the recipes are low enough Â§9PowerÂ§r, or if you have a Â§3MV BatteryÂ§r in the charging slot. The machine will only accept Â§d1AÂ§r when idle, and so the Â§3BatteryÂ§r will recharge only at Â§932EU/tÂ§r.

Â§oSo many choices! AAAAAAAhh! Didn't I tell you I would give you freedom!?Â§r

The LV Age will make you craft a lot of different machines! Are you lost? Here is a tip to set goals: check a lategame item and go from there. So let's say Fusion Controller Mark 3... Nevermind, let's check a closer goal instead. The Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r, the main end goal of LV Age.

The EBF is expensive, which is why you should focus first on machines making materials cheaper. Quests will keep helping you for that.

Other important goals are the Â§3Assembling MachineÂ§r and Â§aMV CircuitsÂ§r.


Talking about goals to note down, take this Clipboard. You will appreciate it.

Â§oHey you! Yes you! HEY!! Why are you running away!?Â§r

This quest is a presentation of the Â§dFull Scale of regular Ore ProcessingÂ§r. Why "regular" you may ask? Well... some ores are special but that's for much later. Oh no I'm getting carried away!


If you haven't noticed the Â§aOre ByproductÂ§r Tab in Â§aJEIÂ§r, press U on any GT ore, and it should be the second rightmost Tab.
This tab presents all the Ore Processing recipes! As you can see, Ores can give many Â§6ByproductsÂ§r, some of which do not exist as an Ore.

Whenever you want to obtain a material, refer to that page to see if you can obtain it, and select the process that you will find to be the most suitable.


Each Quest surrounding this one presents a different machine that has some relation to Ore Processing.


Â§cNote:Â§r Do not get too carried over with Ore Processing yet! It is slow and somewhat power hungry. Around 90% of ores are not important enough to warrant going out of your way to obtain the Byproducts.
betterquesting:10.name:8: What is this Mess? Part Two

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oThis machine combines Cauldron washing for simple automation, but also advanced and precise washing for byproducts.Â§r

Washing a Â§aCrushed OreÂ§r will grant a Â§aPurified OreÂ§r which can refined further, some useless stone, and more importantly the first Â§6ByproductÂ§r.
On average every Â§9three Purified OreÂ§r will also net you Â§9one DustÂ§r of this Â§6ByproductÂ§r! So prioritize this step the most.

Distilled Water over Water cuts recipe duration in half, but is also less convenient to produce.
A rarely used machine. It uses magnetic fields to separate some Magnetic ores and gain additional Â§6ByproductsÂ§r you would not obtain otherwise.

Â§lOutside of Ore Processing:Â§r
Oh boy this machine does a lot... Decomposition recipes to separate dust types, separating air and many others...
The list is too long, let's just say Â§cyou need the CentrifugeÂ§r.


Â§lFor Ore Processing:Â§r
This takes Â§aImpure DustÂ§r or Â§aPurified DustÂ§r and turns them into clean Dust plus an added tiny Dust Â§6ByproductÂ§r. This is outside of the optimal chain for Byproducts, but this is also the cheapest Ore Processing machine of this set to run and to setup on a small scale.


Â§bLore:Â§r In base GTCE, this was the strongest Ore Processing machine as it was fairly easy to use, and gave three tiny dusts, just like the Ore Washer or the Thermal Centrifuge. We tuned it down in favor of diversity.

Â§lOutside of Ore Processing:Â§r
This machine, similarly to the Centrifuge, also does a lot of things...
And I cannot list them! But fortunately it's one of the cheapest, so get it whenever you want something from it.

Â§lFor Ore Processing:Â§r
So, I lied, it's not Â§oexactlyÂ§r in the Ore Processing, it's actually for Â§aDecomposition of DustsÂ§r. However, most of this style of Decomposition through Electrolysis is locked at Â§bMVÂ§r.
You can see the Â§emolecular formulaÂ§r in Dust tooltips to see at a glance what you can get from them.

Â§cTake caution!Â§r Due to how ores work, Dusts which can be Â§ddirectly smeltedÂ§r into Ingots can give higher metal yields than electrolysis. However, it means you lose the other products in the dust. You will have to decide for yourself on each case.

The Â§3Thermal CentrifugeÂ§r is the most energy hungry out of the Ore Processing machines.
It takes Â§aCrushed OreÂ§r or Â§aPurified OreÂ§r to give a different Â§6ByproductÂ§r from the Â§3Ore WasherÂ§r, but at the same rate.


Â§bLore:Â§r The Thermal Centrifuge in GT5 required 48EU/t to run. Yes this is above 32EU/t, but GT5 had special mechanics where certain machines such as this one could accept more than 1 Amp.
In GTCE, the Thermal Centrifuge was made to only work at MV with 60EU/t recipes.
And now to be honest with you... it was awful, never worth it. So we buffed the machine to be much more relevant.

Â§oThe Fluid Solidifier Solidifies... Or you could say it freezes stuff if you like cursedness.Â§r

Build this machine next to your Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r to automatically solidify Rubber into Â§aRubber SheetsÂ§r.
Then, Â§dwrenchÂ§r the side of your Â§3Chemical ReactorÂ§r and enable Fluid Â§9auto-outputÂ§r.

There will be more Fluids to solidify, so you may re-purpose your Â§3Fluid SolidifierÂ§r when not crafting Rubber.

While this is an extremely Â§9importantÂ§r machine, this will Â§9Â§lnot help you immediatelyÂ§r as it is expensive. Most of the recipes you want to unlock require Â§cfluidsÂ§r. Get a little bit more infrastructure before rushing this.


The Â§3Assembling MachineÂ§r is core to gameplay. Consider it as important as a Crafting Table, except... well, it's a machine duh.


We as modpack developers also love to use this to include all sorts of custom recipes. And do you know what's the good news? It lets you unlock Â§dApplied EnergisticsÂ§r!


Once you have enough Infrastructure, you will be able to make better recipes for:
Â§9-Â§r Â§6Vacuum TubesÂ§r
Â§9-Â§r Â§6ResistorsÂ§r
Â§9-Â§r Â§6Circuit BoardsÂ§r


Â§bLore:Â§r Back in the days of GregTech 2, the Assembling Machine only had two slots, and was used merely for alternate Circuit and Hull recipes.

Â§oThis machine does nothing exciting. It puts stuff into stuff.Â§r

Make this machine only when you feel like it's time you invest into Batteries.

Â§aBatteriesÂ§r for storing energy! They can be put into the energy slot at the bottom middle of machine GUIs, or in a Â§3Battery BufferÂ§r.

Batteries in your inventory can be shift right-clicked to enable Â§dchargingÂ§r your EU items.

Â§7LVÂ§r, Â§bMVÂ§r, and Â§6HVÂ§r Batteries come in three forms, allowing you to pick the one you find the best depending on materials you have. Â§dLithiumÂ§r has the best capacity, followed by Â§dCadmiumÂ§r, then Â§dSodiumÂ§r.

My recommendation is: find a Salt vein, and either Â§aelectrolyze SaltÂ§r for Â§dSodiumÂ§r, or Â§aOre wash crushed LepidoliteÂ§r for Â§dLithiumÂ§r.


Get Â§eanyÂ§r Battery to complete this quest.

Â§oBatteries are great! They let you store energy if you have too little or too much power generation.Â§r

Make some Battery Alloy, used for Battery Hulls.

Antimony is found in the Â§cNetherÂ§r, do not forget to check that Ore Tab.


Â§9Note:Â§r This quest does Â§lnotÂ§r contain functional Batteries, head to the next one for that!

Â§9DrillsÂ§r are electric tools which come in different tiers. The Â§7LVÂ§r Drill is quite good: mining a 3x3x1 area. Higher-tier drills can mine 3x3x3, 5x5x5, and up to 9x9x9 to make huge holes!Â§r

This suggested drill is with a Diamond tip, which might be the best material for it right now.

Â§9Note 1:Â§r All Electric Tools have a lot more durability than indicated, as they use Energy to prevent damage from being applied! On top of that, they can be enchanted as Pickaxes can.

Â§9Note 2: Â§fDrills can now be configured to different ranges, not just the maximum or a single block.

Â§bLore:Â§r Up until GTCEu, Electric tools required Stainless Steel, which made them locked until almost HV age.

Â§oBy itself, the Battery Buffer does nothing. What it does, however, is accept batteries in its inventory, to act as a... buffer... with the... batteries. I hope you got it!Â§r

The Â§3Battery BufferÂ§r handles Â§9two Amps inÂ§r, and Â§9one Amp outÂ§r Â§dper BatteryÂ§r. Output side has the dot, all other sides are inputs.
Â§6It will also charge both EU and RF Tools inside itÂ§r.

This is a must have if you don't have unlimited power at hand.

Get Â§eanyÂ§r LV Battery Buffer to complete this quest. However the 16 slots variant is a bit overkill at this stage. You'll probably want a 4 slot buffer to start with for your machines, and a second 4 slot buffer which you can make later for your EBF. Make sure you understand why by the end of the LV chapter!

Â§9Note:Â§r Do not loop your lossy Cables back to your Battery Buffer, you will end up voiding energy!

Â§bLore:Â§r To be frank with you, the GTCE Battery Buffer was mediocre. It has been reworked by yours truly to provide a mix between GT5 and GTCE's functionality. Energy now splits evenly across all batteries!

Â§oIf you wanted to be picky, it would be Dioxygen, or Oxygen Gas. But gameplay convention makes it simply Oxygen.Â§r

You could be spending Â§ominutesÂ§r in JEI looking for Oxygen recipes given the many ways to obtain it. Various minerals will produce it when electrolyzed.

However the best source according to me (!) is Â§acentrifuging AirÂ§r after making a Â§dGas CollectorÂ§r, which you probably cannot make just yet. This recipe also gives Â§aNitrogenÂ§r, which can speed up certain Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r recipesÂ§r.

The second best source according to me (!) is Â§aelectrolyzing Silicon DioxideÂ§r. Silicon Dioxide is obtained from various sources, such as Glass Dust, Granite Dust and Black Granite Dust.

The third best source according to me (!) is Â§aelectrolyzing WaterÂ§r. But that's more for Â§aHydrogenÂ§r due to the higher energy cost.

The fourth best source according to me (!) is Â§ato not voidÂ§r it, ever. Any Oxygen obtained from any source is worth something and should be stored in Tanks. The Â§3Steel Multiblock TankÂ§r is a good candidate for storing Oxygen... Or you can simply make more drums.


Â§eNote:Â§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in Â§lanyÂ§r tank in your inventory. A bucket will also work.

Â§oJust kidding, Tanks for fluids.Â§r

GregTech has a lot of Fluids. Â§3DrumsÂ§r allow you to store them. Any Â§3DrumÂ§r can be broken and picked up and will Â§6keep the FluidÂ§r.

Additionally, internal tanks from machines will accept interacting with an item containing fluid. This is great for manual crafting.

To void Fluid contained in a Drum, place it in your crafting grid.

Â§9Pssst:Â§r A Â§5ScrewdriverÂ§r right-click allows a Drum to Â§ddrainÂ§r its content into another container placed under it. This is great to keep Liquid Boilers fueled for longer.


Â§oDo not attempt to store Steam using Drums, Â§ma massive Creeper will be dropped in your baseÂ§rÂ§o. Buffering Steam is largely overrated, and it's unethical, I beg you. *sobbing face*Â§r


Â§bLore:Â§r The Drums are actually ported from GregTech 6!

The Sifter sifts Â§dGem typeÂ§r Â§aPurified OresÂ§r to find Â§aExquisiteÂ§r and Â§aFlawlessÂ§r Gems, which can be cut into normal Gems. It also finds Â§aPurified DustsÂ§r of that gem. Overall this gives a Â§6higher yieldÂ§r than other means.

A small amount of Â§dFlawless EmeraldÂ§r will be required in the MV Age, and running the ores in Â§3Sifting MachineÂ§r is how you obtain them.

Each higher tier of Â§3SifterÂ§r increases the chance of all Gem types to be found, at the cost of more energy. More on Overclocking.

Â§9Note:Â§r If you crushed Gem Ores (such as Diamond), it is critical you use this machine to recover the actual gems in non dust form. However this is a rather slow process, so you may sometimes want to smelt this type of ore directly into the Gem.

The Autoclave typically is the last step of Ore Processing, to turn a few select Â§aGem DustsÂ§r back regular Gems.

It is very slow so in general it is not advised to crush gem ores at all, as the recovery process is too expensive.


Â§9Note:Â§r In this modpack, the Autoclave is required to make Fluix Crystals to progress in Applied Energistics.

Prepare Â§a128 CupronickelÂ§r, Â§a32 BronzeÂ§r and Â§a16 Tin AlloyÂ§r to craft the Heating Coils for your Electric Blast Furnace.

This is still less than half of the cost of the entire EBF in raw materials. You will also need about a stack each of Invar and Steel.

Note that Â§aCupronickelÂ§r can be made in the Â§9Alloy SmelterÂ§r. It's much faster than mixing!


The Cupronickel Coils will allow the EBF to perform recipes up to Â§d1,800KÂ§r (ignoring Voltage bonuses). That's pretty hot if you ask me.

This Quest explains the core mechanic of the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r, while other Quests after it will explain the mechanics of the Multiblock Parts that you will also need, so be sure to refer to them!Â§r

The Â§3EBFÂ§r is your first electric multiblock! It is used to process materials at high temperatures.

You will use the EBF to make Â§aAluminiumÂ§r and progress to Â§dÂ§bMV AgeÂ§r. It can also make Â§7SteelÂ§r faster than a PBF.

The EBF is a beefy boy. The minimum power cost to run a recipe is Â§9120 EU/tÂ§r! That's slightly under 4 Â§7LVÂ§r Generators. This is why it was locked behind the Battery Quest. You may wish to consider building a separate power line, with separate Generators and Battery Buffer to run this.


Â§bLore:Â§r We have a config "casingsActiveEmissiveTextures" which enables bloom on the Coils of the EBF when it is running. Feel free to enable it, no need to restart the game!

Â§oThe description of the machine refers to metallurgy where Blast Furnace and Arc Furnace serve a similar purpose, not exactly here though!Â§r

The Â§3Arc FurnaceÂ§r uses a little bit of Â§9OxygenÂ§r to smelt items in a different fashion than Furnaces.

You can use it to make easier Â§aWrought IronÂ§r, Â§aGlassÂ§r, and gain access to Â§aAnnealed CopperÂ§r.
It can also recycle various components and machines back to their original material.


Â§bLore:Â§r Previous versions had both the Arc Furnace and the Plasma Arc Furnace. But why not use one machine for both? That's what we decided, but then we decided to remove one of the two plasma recipes. And then the other plasma recipe... Enough rambling that just means the Plasma Arc Furnace is gone. RIP.

Â§oThe Steam Extractor extracts... Wait no this was in the line one chapter ago!Â§r

The reason I did not present LV versions of Steam machines is because they are not required! You may not want to invest into an upgrade that virtually does nothing. Except for Â§othis oneÂ§r specifically because it does more.


The Â§3Basic ExtractorÂ§r gains Fluid capabilities, which enables Â§aFluid ExtractionÂ§r. Use it to melt Rubber that you previously solidified, to Â§dmelt Soldering AlloyÂ§r for your circuits, to Â§dmelt Red AlloyÂ§r for the Â§6best Vacuum Tube recipeÂ§r in the Â§3AssemblerÂ§r!


Â§bLore:Â§r Did you notice this machine is both an Extractor and a Fluid Extractor? The two of them were separated in previous versions of GregTech.

Â§oTime to end the misery of hand crafting rotors!Â§r

Use both your machines to turn a material into a Fluid, and solidify it back to a Rotor! This combination makes up for Â§6four Ingots per RotorÂ§r.
You can also do the same for Â§6GearsÂ§r and Â§6Small GearsÂ§r, which will then be superseded by the Â§3MV ExtruderÂ§r.


Â§9Note:Â§r Some metals require higher voltage than LV for Fluid Extraction, so keep that in mind.

Â§oI know what you're thinking! Don't think! I mean... Maintenance in GregTech is not as bad as you think, and looking at multiblocks with this hatch makes me feel happy.Â§r

Most Multiblocks require a Â§3Maintenance HatchÂ§r. You will need to do Maintenance for the Multiblock to begin operating.
This is done by having a Â§9WrenchÂ§r, a Â§9ScrewdriverÂ§r, a Â§9Soft MalletÂ§r, a Â§9HammerÂ§r, a Â§9Wire CutterÂ§r, and a Â§9CrowbarÂ§r in your inventory, opening the Maintenance Hatch and Â§eclicking the center spot onceÂ§r. Â§cNo need to move tools individuallyÂ§r.
Alternatively you can fix problems by placing a Â§9TapeÂ§r in the Maintenance Hatch, but I would love to tell you that's unethical.

Maintenance problems have a Â§d5%Â§r chance of occuring every Â§dhour of activityÂ§r. Needless to say they are very rare. Each problem increases the recipe durations by 10%. Fixing the problems is done the same way as above.


At Â§6HVÂ§r age, you will unlock other Maintenance Hatches that do not enforce fixing the problems manually.


Â§bLore:Â§r Maintenance dates back to GregTech 3 for Minecraft 1.5.2. That's a long time ago!
Maintenance problems increased power usage instead of duration. And that caused all sorts of "happy" issues. Ah, fun times!
betterquesting:10.name:8: This is not as Scary as it looks #1.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oIt is time to stop processing Resin through the Extractor.Â§r

You can now Â§3centrifugeÂ§r Â§aResinÂ§r, which will still give the Raw Rubber, alongside with Â§aGlueÂ§r (and the less useful Plantball).

Make a lot of Glue. You can use for Â§6cheaper ResistorsÂ§r, Â§6cheaper Circuit BoardsÂ§r in the Â§3Assembling MachineÂ§r and more... Â§oin the next questÂ§r.


Â§eNote:Â§r Submit a fluid by having it stored in Â§lanyÂ§r tank in your inventory. A bucket will also work.

Â§oI'm not sure why it's called "Good" Circuit Board, as I consider it rather evil to craft.Â§r

This Circuit Board is used to create Â§dMV CircuitsÂ§r!


Â§9Note:Â§r You have Â§ltwoÂ§r options to make the Phenolic Circuit Board. Using Â§aSodium PersulfateÂ§r or Â§aIron III ChlorideÂ§r, making boards takes Â§6only a quarter of the SilverÂ§r as opposed to the crafting recipe.
Â§lHoweverÂ§r given how painful it may be for you to obtain these chemicals Â§oright nowÂ§r, you may want to simply use more Silver by mining most of a Galena Vein...


The Quest for Sodium Persulfate is in the MV chapter, if you are interested in that.

Â§oDon't let JEI fool you, there's only one available recipe right now for this Primitive Diode.Â§r

Diode has a inconvenient recipe, but it will get cheaper and more convenient once you can obtain Polyethylene.
This is required for Â§dMV CircuitsÂ§r.

Â§oThe Chemical Bath bathes... You thought the bad jokes were over didn't you?Â§r


Â§lOutside of Ore Processing:Â§r
You can make Â§6Paper out of WoodÂ§r, to throw away your Â§aSugar CanesÂ§rÂ§9*Â§r. I know you hate them.
There are some other less important recipes, such as applying colours to various items and blocks, or bleaching them.

Â§9*Â§r Â§aSugarÂ§r will still be appreciated as a part of Â§cTNTÂ§r production in the Â§6HVÂ§r age, unfortunately.


Â§lFor Ore Processing:Â§r
Some Â§aCrushed OresÂ§r have an alternate recipe on the way to Â§aPurified OreÂ§r, involving bathing in either Â§aMercuryÂ§r or Â§aSodium PersulfateÂ§r. This step is not really important, unless you really want that special Â§6ByproductÂ§r. This can be a nice alternate source of Gold.

Many materials going forward cannot be smelted directly from any Ores! They are instead obtained as byproducts from processing of other ores. Gallium and Arsenic are among these materials.

For Â§dGalliumÂ§r, you may, ranged from worst to best (compromising difficulty and yields):
Â§9- Â§3Electrolyze Â§aSphaleriteÂ§r for a low chance of small dust. Note that you lose on direct smelting value.
Â§9-Â§r Put Â§aCrushed BauxiteÂ§r in the Â§3Chemical BathÂ§r. Note that this requires Â§9Sodium PersulfateÂ§r.
Â§9-Â§r Obtain it as a Byproduct of Â§aSphaleriteÂ§r Ore Processing, in the Â§3Thermal CentrifugeÂ§r or Â§3CentrifugeÂ§r.

For Â§dArsenicÂ§r, you will have to mine and Â§3centrifugeÂ§r Â§aRealgarÂ§r.

Â§oThis Mixer mixes... What did you expect at this point?Â§r

Put this machine off until you actually require it for recipes in progression.


Some hand alloys can also be made in the mixer, except at higher yield.

Â§oMV Circuits! Does this mean MV Age...? Well, do you have Aluminium?Â§r

Each Electric Age has Circuits corresponding to its tier. The Good Electronic Circuit is the Â§dfirst MV CircuitÂ§r you can make, out of three.

The next thing you should probably do is craft a Â§3Circuit Assembling MachineÂ§r to make more Circuits! For cheaper!


Â§6Having this and Aluminium will grant access to MV Machines.Â§r

Â§oHopefully your first MV Circuit expense.Â§r

From now on, all Circuits will be made in a Â§3Circuit AssemblerÂ§r. Use it now to make Â§6cheaper LV and MV circuitsÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r The Circuit Assembler appears in and out of GregTech versions. GT5 did not have it, and it was added in GT5 Unofficial. GTCE did not port it, and it was added back in GTCEu.

Â§aAluminiumÂ§r is the main ingredient for Â§bMVÂ§r machine hulls. Check aaaall the way to the other side for Â§2Sapphire QuestÂ§r if you haven't acquired Â§aAluminium DustÂ§r yet.

Once you setup an Â§3MV ElectrolyzerÂ§r, you can get Â§aAluminiumÂ§r through many other ores. All of this quest's rewards bear Â§aAluminiumÂ§r.

The process of smelting Aluminium can be accelerated with Â§9NitrogenÂ§r, which is obtained by centrifuging Â§9AirÂ§r from a Â§3Gas CollectorÂ§r.


Â§6You will still need MV Circuits in order to make MV machines.Â§r

Â§oSteel can form a lot of Alloys... such as Blue Steel, Red Steel, Black Steel... Fun names?Â§r


Vanadiumsteel is required in small quantities in progression. It is Â§6nearly four times as durableÂ§r as Steel for GregTech tools. The Vanadium comes from Â§aVanadium MagnetiteÂ§r, which you have probably encountered in Magnetite veins.


Take some Blue Steel free of charge, that one is twice as durable as Steel.

The Gas Collector collects Air, to centrifuge into Â§aOxygenÂ§r and Â§aNitrogenÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r GregTech 5 players remember when they had to use a Compressor with IC2 cells to get Compressed Air... In here, cell chemistry is no more.

Â§oTo power Multiblocks with energy, you need Energy Hatches.Â§r

Multiblocks do not look at Voltage of recipes, instead they simply check if they have the Power requirement.
The EBF needs at least Â§4120EU/tÂ§r power input to run its recipes. It is achieved with Â§3two LV Energy HatchesÂ§r. Each one takes 2 Amps of LV, so that's 4 Amps of LV for 128EU/t maximum power.


Â§9Note:Â§r Be wary of Cable Â§clossesÂ§r bringing the actual power input below the recipe requirement! I Â§lhighlyÂ§r recommend placing your Â§3Battery BufferÂ§r next to the Â§3Energy HatchesÂ§r for the minimum cable length.

Â§oThis is a Guide to help you form Multiblocks and troubleshoot issues.Â§r

There are two really important factors to know when building Multiblocks.

Â§lCheck the JEI preview:Â§r This one was probably obvious, but there's more than just a picture of how the Multiblock looks like! Use your mouse to Â§drotateÂ§r the preview, Â§9hover over the partsÂ§r to gain additional informations. The JEI page also contains the amount of blocks to build it. You can also Â§dright-clickÂ§r a block in the preview to get a display of all available blocks in that placement.


Â§lThe JEI preview is a suggestion:Â§r There is no unique way to form the Multiblock. Most of the time, you have complete freedom for the Â§9tier of Buses/HatchesÂ§r. And you also have the Â§dfreedom of placementÂ§r.

Taking the EBF as example, any tier of Energy/Bus/Hatch can be used, and they can be placed anywhere replacing a casing. Fluid Hatches are also optional, though you probably want them to handle recipes with fluid.

Additionally, you can Â§dsneak right-clickÂ§r the multiblock controller for an Â§6in-world previewÂ§r, or use the Â§4TerminalÂ§r's Multiblock Helper.

Similarly to the Steam Multiblocks (I hope you made them!), you will need Â§3BussesÂ§r to move items in and out.
For fluids, you will need Â§3HatchesÂ§r.

That is it, folks!

Â§oCheck the recipe from the wire, and then in the Material JEI page, check the recipe for the dust. Handy isn't it?Â§r

Â§6SuperconductorsÂ§r are special Wires available for each Voltage tier. They do not have any Cable counterpart, but they have absolutely Â§6no cable lossÂ§r! They also don't damage you when you touch them.
The 1x variant also covers 2 Amps! Isn't that nice?

Now is a good time to replace your crappy Â§aTin CablesÂ§r. Recycle them in the Â§3PackagerÂ§r to recover both Tin and Rubber.

Â§bLore:Â§r No version of GregTech had actual Superconductors for LV up until Gregicality and GTCEu. Though some modpacks had lossless cables.

Â§oThe Â§3Large BoilerÂ§r is an Â§6optionalÂ§r big boy variant of the Small Boilers. It runs off solid or liquid fuel.

If you want Steam-based power production, this will be your choice. Other power options are listed in the Â§bMVÂ§r Chapter.


Â§cImportant:Â§r This Boiler can also Â§cexplodeÂ§r similarly to the regular Boilers! I would like to say the explosion is not kind... but it's configured to not damage blocks or entities on this modpack.
Â§cWater supply is crucialÂ§r. Dedicate a Â§3Primitive PumpÂ§r with a LV Output Hatch in the Â§lsame chunkÂ§r as the Boiler. Any biome will still be enough to supply enough water.


Once fully heated up, the Â§3LBBÂ§r produces 800 Steam per tick, which is Â§d400EU/tÂ§r after conversion, or 12.5 Basic Steam Turbines! This (relatively!) immense power comes at the cost of Â§la lotÂ§r of burnable fuel.
Â§5Â§lButÂ§r the +/- buttons in the GUI let you Â§9throttleÂ§r the Boiler, down to 25% power for 200 Steam per tick. That is Â§d100EU/tÂ§r, or slightly above 3 Basic Steam Turbines.


Â§9Note:Â§r Informations about Multiblocks are given after you get the Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r. I recommend you get that first.

Â§oGTCE killed Cell Chemistry... GTCE killed Cells!
... So let's have GTCEu revive them! Nonono, not the Cell Chemistry, the Â§9Â§oCellsÂ§r.Â§r

Cells are an alternative form of Fluid storage. All Cell types with the same type and amount of Fluid inside them Â§6stackÂ§r. They can be automatically filled with a Â§3Canning MachineÂ§r.

Cells hold Â§done bucketÂ§r of Fluid.

Universal Cells hold up to Â§done bucketÂ§r, but also can store Â§9fractionsÂ§r of Buckets. Ideal to store leftover Fluid without spending a whole Drum. 

Cells made from higher tier materials can hold even more fluid, but Â§9DrumsÂ§r and Â§9Super TanksÂ§r will hold more by then.

Like Drums, Cells can be placed into a crafting grid to clear their contents.

Â§oJust kidding, Silicon Wafers in this mod are perfectly fungible.Â§r

Â§9Silicon BoulesÂ§r are made in the Â§3EBFÂ§r with lots of Â§aSilicon DustÂ§r and a small amount of Â§aGallium ArsenideÂ§r.
After making the Boule, cut it in the Â§3Cutting MachineÂ§r to get 16 Silicon Wafers ready for engraving.

The best Â§aSiliconÂ§r source at this point shall be either Â§dGlass DustÂ§r, or Â§dSodaliteÂ§r.

Â§cWarning:Â§r Each Silicon Boule takes 7.5 minutes to make at 120 EU/t, or 1,080,000 EU! If the EBF loses power midway, the recipe will start to Â§close progressÂ§r. Be sure you have enough power before starting.

Welcome to AE2! This modpack has gated AE2 behind a decently involved line in HV, so you probably won't be able to access this till HV.

Anyway, to begin with, you will need Highly Impure Fluix Slurry. This has 2 requirements;

Â§6Distilled WaterÂ§f and Â§4Thermally Expanded RedstoneÂ§f.
They are on their own pretty easy to get.

Anyway, to purify this impure slurry, we have to centrifuge it. Finally we have the Pure Fluix Slurry, which gives us Gem-Grade Fluix. This can be directly processed into Fluix in an Â§4Autoclave,Â§f or electrolyse it to reclaim the Indium!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Line of Fluix, Toe of Frog

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oRelatively large tank storage comes at the cost of a Multiblock... for now.Â§r

The Â§3Wooden Multiblock TankÂ§rÂ§r holds Â§a250,000 mBÂ§r, but it cannot store Â§chot FluidsÂ§r such as Lava, or Â§cGasesÂ§r such as Steam or Oxygen.

The Â§3Steel Multiblock TankÂ§r holds Â§a1,000,000 mBÂ§r, and lifts restrictions on which Fluids can be stored.

Get Â§eanyÂ§r of the Tanks to complete this quest. The Steel version is way too expensive right now, I would not recommend it.

Fluid transfer is done through the Controller block, or up to Â§atwo ValvesÂ§r.
Valves can Â§9auto-outputÂ§r by placing them on the Â§dbottom layerÂ§r and making them Â§dface downÂ§r (as always, use a Â§5WrenchÂ§r to adjust their facing).

Unlike Â§3DrumsÂ§r, they are not portable. But I bet you guessed that already...


This Quest rewards an extra Â§6Cove OvenÂ§r. Place it next to an existing Coke Oven, they can Â§dshare wallsÂ§r.


Â§bLore:Â§r Just like Drums, these multiblocks are ported from GregTech 6.

Â§3Item PipesÂ§r are a simple yet very effective way to move items around Â§dinstantlyÂ§r, but with throughput limitations.
Higher tier pipes provide ridiculously large throughput, a rare sight in modded Minecraft!

Item Pipes Â§9do not pullÂ§r, but they will push any item inserted into them to other connected inventories, prioritizing Â§9the closestÂ§r first.

The priority mechanics are Â§omore complicatedÂ§r, so skip ahead if you are not interested:
A Â§eDestinationÂ§r will have a Â§dRouting ValueÂ§r calculated, which is the sum of all Routing Values of the individual Pipes to that Destination. Whichever Destination has the Â§clowest Â§dRouting ValueÂ§r will be the one selected for Insertion.
Â§3Restrictive PipesÂ§r typically have the lowest Priority for insertion due to their higher Routing Value.


Right now, you can use them in combination with Â§6HoppersÂ§r, but you will also be able to use them with Conveyor Modules, Output Buses, and machine Auto-Outputs all in the LV age.

Â§9Note:Â§r GT6-style Pipes are Â§denabledÂ§r. It means that placing Pipes connect them only to the block they were placed against. To open more connections, use your Â§5WrenchÂ§r on the grid.

Get Â§eanyÂ§r of the suggested Item Pipes to complete this quest.

Â§bLore:Â§r Oooooh YEAH! Item Pipes were in GregTech 5, and for whatever reason they were not kept for GTCE, so you had to use other mods to transport items. Who does that!? Jokes aside, I hope you love Item Pipes being back in GregTech!

Â§5Player:Â§r Â§oThat's it, I give up, you are going insane! We are in LV Age but you present me a HV machine!?Â§r

Â§5Writer:Â§r Â§oHold on... There must have been a reason. Ah! Let me grab my script.Â§r


Yes! This is indeed not completable yet, which is also why this quest appears in the Â§6HVÂ§r Chapter.

Remember the thing about Macerator I told you that made you feel unextremely sad and disappointed? Well... that disappointment is gonna keep going until then.

Â§6The Macerator will unlock its second and third slot at HVÂ§r. And this will be great for Ore Processing. In fact if you check the Ore Processing JEI page, you will see that one byproduct is absolutely locked by this, after the Thermal Centrifuge step.

Â§cNote:Â§r Unlike in GTCE, the Â§bMVÂ§r Macerator in GTCEu does Â§cnotÂ§r have a second slot!


Â§5Writer:Â§r Â§oCome back to me when you are stronger, young Padawan.Â§r

Â§oSoldering Alloy is used to... solder... things in the Assembler of Circuit Assembler.Â§r

Â§aSoldering AlloyÂ§r is used solely as a Â§9FluidÂ§r, and in most cases is Â§dinterchangeableÂ§r with more TinÂ§r.

The choice will be yours. Save more materials? Make Soldering Alloy.
Or spend less time crafting materials? Use Tin.

ME Glass Cables are the most basic type of ME Transport, and they have 2 recipes.

Utilizing Â§dRadonÂ§f is HIGHLY recommended, as it gives MUCH more output!

Â§oAlright, making this is quite involved, this has to be good right?
Also, this is only an Empty Spray Can, which you have to fill with Chemical Dye.Â§r

So, the Â§aSpray CansÂ§r do not provide any functionality for machines, but are quite Â§bvisually appealing and usefulÂ§r!

Any (or almost) GregTech TileEntity (machine, pipe, cable...) can be Â§6paintedÂ§r to one of the 16 colors of your choosing. This is great for screenshots, or to separate different setups for visualization in a Multiplayer base. They also help with distinguishing between pipelines and cables.

Holding the Â§aSpray CanÂ§r in the offhand will automatically paint the block you place.

The Prospector is an amazing tool to find veins.

Its GUI is interactive, and automatically adds veins to the map with Â§dVisualOresÂ§r.

Â§6This thing is great.Â§r


Â§bLore:Â§r Â§oBack in MY days, the portable Prospector was locked to Â§dÂ§oLuVÂ§r.Â§r

The Â§3Electric Blast FurnaceÂ§r requires a Â§3Muffler HatchÂ§r to run. This hatch must be Â§cunobstructedÂ§r so it can output its beautiful smoke particles.

When a recipe is performed, there is a small chance for the Â§3Muffler HatchÂ§r to give bonus items, typically tiny Dusts of Ash.

Â§9Note:Â§r Do not try to automate the extraction of items from the Â§3Muffler HatchÂ§r, it is not intended. It voids excess when full, so do not worry about it stopping machines from running.


Â§bLore:Â§r In GregTech 5, polluting multiblocks had Muffler Hatches. The higher tier the hatch, the lower the Pollution.
Pollution had interesting effects such as turning grass and dirt into sand.
Muffler Hatches in GTCEu are more about the look (can you deny that the particles look good!?) and small rewards, rather than punishing game mechanics.
betterquesting:10.name:8: This is not as Scary as it looks #2.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Â§oDid you hate crafting the components in the previous tier? They're back, and stronger!Â§r

Here is a list of the components you will need in the Â§bMVÂ§r Age. To alleviate the pain, be sure to autocraft or Â§dbulk-craftÂ§r these parts, especially Â§aMotorsÂ§r.

Note the appearance of the Â§aEmitterÂ§r? This one requires a Â§dFlawless EmeraldÂ§r which will be only attainable with the Â§3Sifting MachineÂ§r for now.

Conveyors, Pumps and Robot Arms are upgrades to Â§7LVÂ§r versions if you use them as covers.

Before we start, here's something to consider, to get to glorious Ethylene:
With the Â§aOilÂ§r route, you will need at least a Â§3LV DistilleryÂ§r.
With the Â§aBiomassÂ§r route, you will need a Â§3MV DistilleryÂ§r.
Get Â§eeitherÂ§r to complete this quest.



Now, let's discuss a complex topic: Â§9DistillationÂ§r. This guide will help you understand how and why the Â§aJEIÂ§r recipes are the way they are, so stick with me!

Nearly all the Â§3DistilleryÂ§r recipes are duplicates from the Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r, except that they only have one Fluid output, and void everything else.
In other words, you could argue the Â§3DistilleryÂ§r is an Â§dinferiorÂ§r Â§3Distillation TowerÂ§r.

This doesn't mean that the Â§3DistilleryÂ§r is always inferior though. It is unlocked earlier. It is Â§dsmallerÂ§r, Â§dcheaperÂ§r, and Â§dmore energy efficientÂ§r per recipe.
In many cases, you won't even mind losing the other Fluids.


Â§3DistilleriesÂ§r are an essential component for power generation, whether you pick Â§aDieselÂ§r or Â§aBenzeneÂ§r.
You will probably want many of them, and as low tier as possible to avoid the energy losses from Overclocking.

Â§oThe Pyrolyse Oven processes organic products by thermal decomposition in an inert environment.Â§r

The Â§3Pyrolyse OvenÂ§r is an electric equivalent of the Â§3Coke OvenÂ§r. It can produce Â§9Coal CokeÂ§r and Â§9CharcoalÂ§r with a Â§9CreosoteÂ§r byproduct just as before, but also has additional Â§6Organic ByproductsÂ§r. The most beneficial of these being Â§aWood TarÂ§r.
Another product is Â§aBiomassÂ§r, which is more pertinent for progression Â§oright nowÂ§r.

Those byproducts can be Distilled for an array of organic resources, with different byproducts giving different ratios of different chemicals.
You will need to read the Â§9DistillationÂ§r Quest to hopefully understand the full scale..

Â§
There are recipes that can accept Â§bNitrogenÂ§r to double the speed. This is not quite worth right now.
You will be fine with just one Â§3LV Energy HatchÂ§r and Superconductors to supply a steady Â§d64 EU/tÂ§r.

The Â§3Cupronickel CoilsÂ§r are more than enough to get started, but you may want to upgrade eventually.


Â§
Â§9Â§lNote:Â§rÂ§l The Plant path is one path towards Â§9Â§lEthyleneÂ§rÂ§l. The other path involves Oil.Â§rÂ§r
The Pyrolyse Oven remains Â§doptionalÂ§r. But it is great to have either for Power, or for the various Byproducts.


Â§bLore:Â§r In GT5u, the structure for the Pyrolyse Oven is a giant box with only 9 coils inside. Players usually spend several minutes debugging what is wrong due to the lack of JEI preview.

Â§oHave you seen the Oil spouts when wandering around, or mined into a deposit of Oil?Â§,Â§r

Get a Â§3PumpÂ§r, place it above an Oil spout and Power it!

Each Oil deposit can have between Â§63,000Â§r and Â§69,200Â§r buckets of Oil, which is huge! Refining the OilÂ§r onsite into either Â§aLight FuelÂ§r or Â§aDieselÂ§r (or both) is perfectly viable. Next Quests explain what they are good for.
Store this into Â§3DrumsÂ§r, but you will truly want to use a Â§3Super TankÂ§r as soon as you unlock it.

Â§cWarning: Â§rDo not forget to Â§dchunkloadÂ§r with FTB Utilities (open the map in the top left corner, claim the chunks with left-click, and enable force loading with shift-left-click).


Â§
Â§9Â§lNote:Â§rÂ§l The Oil path is one path towards Â§9Â§lEthyleneÂ§rÂ§l. The other paths involve Trees and Plants.Â§rÂ§r
For now, Oil is Â§doptionalÂ§r. But it will become mandatory starting with Â§5EVÂ§r Age, much later.

Oil can also be refined in the form of Â§aLight FuelÂ§r, Â§aDieselÂ§r or even Â§aGasolineÂ§r, which are excellent power options.
